Add a few chopped fresh basil leaves and a cup of vegetable broth, some freshly ground black pepper and a little sea salt.
If you are using regular (not low sodium) broth from a can, taste before adding salt as it may have enough already.
Ideally Id recommend using low sodium or homemade broth.
Bring the soup slowly to the boil, give it a stir, put on the lid and reduce the heat to a simmer.
Leave to simmer for about 20 minutes.
After 20 minutes, taste the soup and add more salt and pepper if needed.
Add a few drops of Tabasco sauce, tasting as you go, until you get the flavour you want.
I find that of all things, soup needs to be continually tasted throughout the cooking process to make sure its turning out right.
Leave the soup to sit with the lid off and heat still at a low simmer while you lightly brush a few slices of fresh bread with olive oil and lightly grill them.
You can do this outside if so inclined, or inside in a stovetop grill pan.
When the bread is done, spoon the soup into bowls and serve with the bread.
You can add a dollop of creme fraiche to the soup if youre feeling particularly extravagant.
68ce5e6dca.pred:
In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the garlic and onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and cook until they begin to break down, about 10 minutes.
Add the basil and broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the Tabasco Sauce and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of fresh basil.

e8c76f1472.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Combine macaroni, 1-1/2 cups of the cheddar cheese, the spinach, tomatoes and Parmesan cheese in large bowl; set aside.
Heat oil in medium saucepan on low heat 1 min.
Add onions; cook 2 to 3 min.
or until crisp-tender.
Add flour; mix well.
Cook 2 min., stirring constantly.
Gradually add milk, stirring until well blended after each addition.
Increase heat to medium.
Bring to boil; cook 2 to 3 min.
or until thickened, stirring constantly.
Add to macaroni mixture; toss to coat.
Spoon into 1-1/2-qt.-casserole dish sprayed with cooking spray; sprinkle with remaining Cheddar cheese.
Bake 20 min.
or until heated through.
e8c76f1472.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onions; cook and stir 2 minutes.
Add flour; cook and stir 1 minute.
Gradually add milk, stirring constantly.
Cook until mixture comes to a boil; reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Stir in cheese, spinach, tomato, and Parmesan.
Pour into a 2-quart casserole.
Bake, uncovered, 20 minutes or until heated through.

11e9299476.gt:
Preheat the oven according the directions for the biscuits.
Have the biscuits ready to put in oven
Start cooking the Sausage.
Once cook drain out the oil that's in the pan
Leave sausage in pan.
Add the flour and the milk.
Put heat to high and continue to mix.
Don't stop mixing until the gravy starts to boil.
Once its boiling, lower down heat to simmer for 5min.
Don't touch for those 5min.
Now put in the biscuits in the oven
Once the 5min is up give the gravy a little mix and set aside to cool down.
The longer it sits outside the thicker it would get.
When the biscuits are ready open them up and pour the sausage gravy on top.
Enjoy.
11e9299476.pred:
Mix the sausage, milk, flour, salt and pepper together.
Form the mixture into a ball and roll it out on a floured surface.
Cut the dough into 4 pieces and roll each piece into a 5-inch circle.
Place the sausage in the center of each circle and fold the dough over the sausage.
Press the edges together to seal the dough and cut off the excess dough.
Bake the biscuits at 400 degrees for 10 minutes.
Serve with gravy.

0ca9bd3da2.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.To prepare aioli, combine first 5 ingredients in a small bowl; set aside.To prepare crab cakes, combine bell pepper and next 7 ingredients (through black pepper) in a large bowl; stir well with a whisk.
Add panko and crabmeat; toss gently.
Divide the crab mixture into 12 equal portions, shaping each into a 1-inch-thick patty.Heat oil in a large ovenproof skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add patties; cook 2 minutes.
Carefully turn patties over.
Place pan in oven; bake at 350 for 6 minutes.
0ca9bd3da2.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, combine the crab, mayonnaise, mustard, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, pepper, and panko.
Mix well.
Shape into 1-inch balls.
Place on a baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve with Herbed Aioli.

d9c04f21ab.gt:
Add the Bombay Sapphire, lemon juice and caster sugar to a short glass / tumbler and stir.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Drizzle the berry liqueur over the top and watch it 'marble' through the drink.
Top up with more crushed ice and garnish with 1 blackberry and a wedge of fresh lemon.
d9c04f21ab.pred:
In a large pitcher, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar.
Stir until the sugar has dissolved.
Add the Chambord or creme de cassis and the blackberry.
Stir again.
Serve over crushed ice.

2f161399c5.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook and stir sausage in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
Stir in cream cheese.
Unroll crescent dough and separate into individual pieces; spoon 2 to 3 teaspoons sausage mixture onto each piece of dough.
Roll dough around filling.
Brush each crescent roll with egg white.
Arrange crescent rolls on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until rolls are lightly browned, about 15 minutes.
2f161399c5.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Crumble sausage into a bowl.
Add cream cheese and mix well.
Separate crescent rolls into triangles and place in baking dish.
Spoon sausage mixture over crescent rolls.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until crescent rolls are golden brown.
Beat egg white and brush over sausage mixture.
Bake for 5 more minutes.
Serve warm.

e81515ca45.gt:
Slice the chicken tenders diagonally into thin strips and season lightly with salt and pepper.
It's easiest to slice partially defrosted tenders.
Cut off both ends of the cucumbers and chop roughly into thin long pieces.
After 3 minutes, when the sauce thickens from the katakuriko coated on the chicken like the photo, it's done.
Heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in a pan over medium heat, and add the chicken tenders.
Spread out the pieces and fry.
Lightly fry both sides, add the cucumbers and stir fry for about 1 minute.
Turn up the heat to high, and add the ingredients listed under [A] (water or soup stock, vinegar, sugar, ketchup, tonkatsu sauce and salt).
Stir fry for 3 minutes while shaking the pan, being careful not to let the sauce burn.
After 3 minutes, when the sauce thickens from the katakuriko coated on the chicken like the photo above, it's done.
Doesn't it look delicious?
e81515ca45.pred:
In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp of vegetable oil.
Add the chicken tenders and cook until golden brown.
Remove from pan and set aside.
Add the remaining oil to the pan and saute the cucumbers, onions and katakuriko until the onions are translucent.
Add the chicken back to the pan and stir in the water, vinegar, sugar, ketchup, tonkatsu sauce and salt.
Cook until the sauce thickens and the chicken is cooked through.
Serve over rice.

fd3e9f4f9e.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine sugar, butter and cream cheese in large bowl.
Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until creamy.
Add milk, eggs and vanilla.
Continue beating until smooth.
Stir in flour and coconut.
Spoon into paper-lined or greased muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Bake 32-38 minutes or until light golden brown.
Serve warm or at room temperature; top with fruit preserves or jam.
fd3e9f4f9e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the cream cheese and milk until smooth.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, coconut, and 1/2 cup of the sugar.
Add to creamed mixture alternately with the milk, beginning and ending with flour mixture.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
Invert cake onto rack and cool completely.
Frost with preserves or jam.

fcf4d62dec.gt:
Measure the sugar and 1 tablespoon of water, and put into a pan.
You don't have to dissolve the sugar.
Measure out the water you will add later, and prepare in a cup.
Start heating over a medium-high heat.
It will gradually bubble up.
Keep watching it, and you'll see it starting to brown from the edges.
When all of the syrup has browned, turn off the heat.
It will keep cooking and the flavor will continue to deepen, so watch out!
If you like bitter caramel wait for a while before adding the water.
If you prefer less bitter caramel or you're serving this to little kiddies, add the water immediately.
It will splatter, so be careful.
Shake the pan to even out the consistency of the mixture.
If you added too much water, put the pan back on the heat to evaporate some.
Pour the caramel sauce into flan or pudding cups while it's still hot.
If you don't add it right away, it will harden!
Swirl the cups around so that the sauce is evenly distributed.
When the surface of the sauce hardens and no longer sticks to your fingers when you touch it, add the flan mixture and get going!
fcf4d62dec.pred:
In a small saucepan, combine sugar and water.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves.
Cook, without stirring, until the mixture turns a deep amber color.
Stir in the water, if needed, to prevent burning.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Pour into a bowl and let cool completely.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

9c987e0b4b.gt:
Saute sauerkraut and caraway in a skillet over medium-high heat.
When most of the moisture has evaporated and sauerkraut begins to brown, stir in lemon juice and set aside.
Arrange an egg roll wrapper on a work surface with a corner towards you; brush edges with egg wash.
Place a strip of cheese on the wrapper, about 1 inch above the bottom corner, then top with strips of beef and about 3 tbsp sauerkraut mixture.
Drizzle with mustard.
Fold the bottom corner up over the filling to enclose, fold in the sides, then roll to the top corner of the wrapper.
Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat to about 360*.
Add half the egg rolls and fry on all sides until brown and crisp, 5-7 minutes.Drain on paper towels while frying remaining rolls.
Serve Egg Rolls with Thousand Island Dressing for dipping.
9c987e0b4b.pred:
In a large bowl, combine sauerkraut, caraway seeds, lemon juice, corned beef, swiss cheese, egg, water and egg roll wraps.
Mix well.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Roll the mixture into 1-inch balls and fry in the hot oil until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with prepared thousand island dressing for dipping.

ab4c597668.gt:
BEAT margarine at medium speed of electric mixer until light and fluffy; beat in jelly powder.
Mix in egg.
Stir in flour and baking powder.
SHAPE dough as illustrated; chill 2 hours.
CUT and bake at 350F for 8-10 min.
; cool.
GLAZE: Mix 2 cups icing sugar and 3 Tbsp water until smooth.
Blend in 3 to 4 drops food colouring to tint to desired colour.
Dip edges of cookies in frosting and dry on rack.
ab4c597668.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Shape into 1-inch balls.
Roll in powdered sugar.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes.

c7e6c70205.gt:
In a medium bowl place first 7 ingredients up to lemon juice.
Stir until combined.
Set aside.
In a medium saute pan place 1/4 cup oil and heat to medium hot.
Fry each tortilla for 15 seconds, or until softened.
Drain on paper towels or paper bags.
In a large, heavy pan place 4 cups of oil and heat over high heat until very hot.
Loosely roll each tortilla and deep-fry it for 1-2 minutes, or until crisp.
Drain on paper towels or paper bags.
Stuff reserved vegetable mixture inside each tortilla.
Cut the taquitos in half, crosswise.
c7e6c70205.pred:
Combine first 5 ingredients in a bowl.
Add oil to a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add tomatoes, bell pepper, and jalapeno and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add feta cheese and cilantro and cook, stirring, until cheese is melted, 1 to 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Spoon about 1/4 cup filling onto each tortilla, leaving a 1/2-inch border.
Roll up tortillas and secure with a toothpick.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add taquitos and cook, turning occasionally, until golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.

f1211da4d4.gt:
In a serving dish, add quinoa, watermelon, red onion, feta and mint.
Gently toss to combine.
Drizzle in olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Toss to combine.
Top with mint garnish.
Serve chilled.
f1211da4d4.pred:
In a large bowl, combine quinoa, watermelon, onion, feta, mint, and olive oil.
Toss gently to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Toss again before serving.
Garnish with mint and serve.

13da1b6a5b.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350F.
Coat a pie pan with cooking spray.
Heat a medium nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heat.
Cook the scallions, bell pepper, and bacon for 3 minutes, or until softened.
Spoon into the prepared pie pan.
Top with the Cheddar.
In a large bowl combine the milk, egg substitute, mustard, and nutmeg.
Pour into the pie pan.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan.
Bake for 35 minutes, or until golden and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
13da1b6a5b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, combine the scallions, green pepper, and Canadian bacon.
In a large bowl, combine the shredded cheese, evaporated milk, egg substitute, mustard, nutmeg, parmesan cheese, and bacon mixture.
Pour into a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 30 minutes or until the quiche is set.
Serve warm.

9a8cea064f.gt: Puree all ingredients together in a blender until smooth.
9a8cea064f.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a jar and refrigerate.

6aecc26678.gt:
1 Prepare millet corn meal: Pour whole grain millet into a grain mill and mill to a cornmeal-like consistency.
See the attached blog link for more detailed instructions on how to mill.
2 Preheat the oven to 400 F. 3 Spray the bottom and sides of an 8 x 8 glass pan with olive oil.
4 Mix together all dry ingredients in a large bowl.
5 Lightly beat egg in a separate small bowl.
6 Combine and stir the beaten egg with the goats milk and oil.
7 Add the liquids to the dry ingredients and mix thoroughly.
8 -Pour the batter into the greased pan and smooth the top with the back of your spoon.
9 Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
10 Allow to cool for a few minutes, slice into single-size portions, and serve!
Makes 9-16 servings, depending on how you slice it.
6aecc26678.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Stir in 1/2 cup of the goat's milk and mix well.
Pour into a well-greased 9x5 loaf pan.
Bake for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.

ebbeab0277.gt:
Cover baking sheet with parchment.
Dip 12 plastic teaspoons, 1 at a time, in white chocolate; shake spoon gently over bowl of melted chocolate to remove excess chocolate.
Place on prepared baking sheet.
Refrigerate 10 min.
or until chocolate is firm.
Melt semi-sweet chocolate.
Partially dip each spoon in chocolate; return to baking sheet.
Refrigerate 10 min.
Use decorating gels to decorate spoons to resemble snowmen faces as shown in photo.
ebbeab0277.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spray 24 miniature muffin cups with cooking spray.
Place 1/2 of the melted baker's white chocolate in a small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the melted baker's semi-sweet chocolate in another small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the orange decorating gel in a third small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the black decorating gel in a fourth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a fifth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a sixth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a seventh small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in an eighth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a ninth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a tenth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in an eleventh small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a twelfth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a thirteenth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a fourteenth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a fifteenth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a sixteenth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a seventeenth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in an eighteenth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a nineteenth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a twentieth small bowl.
Place 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows in a

32186ea03f.gt:
In a large skillet, cook the beef, onion and garlic over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
Stir in the water, tomato paste, parsley, salt, mint if desired, cinnamon and pepper.
Set aside.
For sauce, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Stir in flour until smooth; gradually add milk.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Remove from the heat.
Stir a small amount of hot mixture into eggs; return all to the pan, stirring constantly.
Add the Parmesan cheese and salt.
Place half of the potato slices in a greased shallow 3-qt.
baking dish.
Top with half of the Parmesan sauce and all of the meat mixture.
Arrange the remaining potatoes over meat mixture; top with the remaining Parmesan sauce.
Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
32186ea03f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, brown the ground beef with the onion and garlic.
Drain off excess fat.
Add the tomato paste, parsley, salt, mint, cinnamon, and pepper.
Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, butter, flour, milk, eggs, and Parmesan cheese.
Mix well.
Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 1 hour.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

d25661eadd.gt:
Place your pork tenderloin in an oven proof pot.
Grate your garlic cloves and rub it into the pork tenderloin.
Rub smoked paprika powder into the pork tenderloin.
Dice the onions and place them in the pot with the pork tenderloin.
Cover with bbq sauce.
Put on the lid and make sure it is closed.
Cook in the oven at 125F celsius/255F for 5,5 hours.
Take out your pot and remove the lid.
Using to forks, pull the meat apart.
Serve with tortillas, vegetables and a sauce of your chosing.
d25661eadd.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Cut the pork tenderloin into 1.5 cm cubes.
Place the pork cubes in a large zip-lock bag.
Add the garlic and onions, and mix well.
Add the bbq sauce and mix well.
Add the paprika and mix well.
Seal the bag and refrigerate overnight.
The next day, remove the pork from the bag and place in a roasting pan.
Cover with foil and bake at 180C for 3 hours.
Remove the foil and bake for 30 minutes more.
Let cool and shred the pork.

794b47fa63.gt:
Saute onions in a small amount of oil until translucent.
Add garlic and ginger and saute until fragrant.
Add the rest of the ingredients except the prawns.
Bring to a boil.
Turn down the heat and add the prawns.
Simmer until the prawns turn pink and are cooked through.
794b47fa63.pred:
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat.
Add the onions, garlic, ginger, chili powder, cayenne, and sugar.
Saute for 3 minutes.
Add the tomato paste, coconut milk, and salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the prawns and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with rice.

46aa69285e.gt:
Add oil to pot.
Over medium heat, saute chicken, season with salt, cook until no longer pink.
About 3-4 minutes.
Remove chicken from pot, set aside.
In the mean time, in a food processor, make a flavor paste.
Combine tomatillos, green chilies and jalapeno and blend until thick & smooth.
May need to make 2 batches.
Add more oil if desired, add onions and garlic, saute until tender, about 5 minutes.
Careful not to burn the garlic.
Add chicken back to pot.
Add cumin and coriander.
Stir.
Add the flavor paste, green chilies, chicken broth and beans to the cooked chicken pieces.
Simmer for at least 45 minutes or until desired thickness is achieved.
I prefer to simmer longer, for up to 2 hours.
Top with cilantro at serving.
Serve with warm torn flour tortillas or crispy tortilla chips.
46aa69285e.pred:
In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Add the tomatillos, jalapeno, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, chilies, broth, beans, and cilantro.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Serve with shredded sharp cheddar cheese, if desired.

75ce65d04e.gt:
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
Set aside.
Combine sugar and shortening.
Cream until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg.
Stir in apple butter.
Add dry ingredients.
Mix well.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Drop dough by heaping teaspoons onto lightly greased baking sheets.
Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes.
Cool on racks.
75ce65d04e.pred:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together shortening and sugar.
Add egg and apple butter; mix well.
Stir in flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.

b240a9e8bb.gt:
Heat oven to 250F degrees.
Mix together cornmeal, flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Combine egg whites, milk and margarine, mix well.
Pour milk mixture into the dry ingredients, stir until just smooth (do not over mix).
In a large non stick skillet heat the 2 tbsp oil, heat until quite hot but not smoking.
Drop in a 1/4 cup of batter for each fritter.
Cook approx 4-6 minutes on each side.
Keep warm in the oven covered with foil until you have cooked all the fritters.
Serve with Blueberries or other fruit.
b240a9e8bb.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Add milk, margarine, and vanilla to egg whites and mix well.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and mix just until combined.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Drop batter by tablespoonfuls into hot oil and fry until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with syrup or fresh fruit.

6390dfd5d5.gt:
1.
Put a large soup pot on the stove.
Add all of the ingredients except the water, peanut butter, salt, and pepper into a large soup pot.
2.
Turn heat on high and add water as needed to cover all of the ingredients in liquid.
3.
Cover the pot to retain the heat and bring the mixture to a low boil.
4.
When the mixture has come to a boil, reduce the heat to medium low and boil for 1520 minutes or until the sweet potatoes are fork tender.
5.
If using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth.
Add the peanut butter and then puree until well incorporated.
If using a food processor or stand up blender, process/blend the mixture until smooth.
With one of the batches, process/blend until smooth, add the peanut butter, and then process/blend until well incorporated.
6.
Taste and season with salt and pepper as desired.
7.
Ladle into bowls and serve with naan, pita, or rolls.
6390dfd5d5.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place sweet potatoes in a large baking dish.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake until tender, about 45 minutes.
Remove from oven and set aside.
In a large pot, saute onions and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Add tomatoes and water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add broth, sweet potatoes, red pepper flakes, thyme, and peanut butter.
Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve hot.

fdb9200291.gt:
start by heating a large skillet with butter, garlic & olive oil cook on med heat about 1 minute add in diced serrano chili cook another minute.
add in shrimp & chopped lobster and all seasonings along with chili paste.
Cook 6-7 minutes till shrimp are nice & pink.
This is a spicy dish Enjoy!
fdb9200291.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil and butter over medium heat.
Add the garlic and chili and cook for 1 minute.
Add the lobster tail, chili paste, hot shot seasoning, black pepper, garlic salt, and serrano chili and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the shrimp and cook for 3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with rice or pasta.

fd78cf3ab6.gt:
Cut the tortillas into quarters.
In a large skillet, heat the oil and fry the tortilla pieces until crunchy.
Lower the heat to low.
Add the red chile sauce and mix gently through the tortilla pieces.
Top with the shredded cheese and cook until the cheese just starts to melt.
Remove from the heat and serve with your choice of eggs.
Garnish with chopped green and red onions.
For the sauce: Remove the stems, seeds and veins from the chile pods.
Rinse with cold water.
Add the chiles to a pot and add enough water just to cover them.
Bring to a boil and simmer covered for 20 minutes.
After 10 minutes turn the chiles over to cook evenly.
Drain and cool.
In a blender, mix 3 cups of water, half of the cooked chile pods, 3 Tablespoons flour, 2 cloves garlic and half the salt.
Blend until smooth.
Strain the sauce removing any seeds.
Repeat this process with the rest of the ingredients and set aside to cool.
Recipe from Muy Bueno Cook Book.
fd78cf3ab6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the tortillas and fry until crisp, about 1 minute per side.
Remove from skillet and drain on paper towels.
In a bowl, combine the red chile sauce, colby cheese, eggs, and 1/2 cup water.
Mix well.
Place tortillas in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Pour the egg mixture over the tortillas.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until the eggs are set.
Sprinkle with the green onions and red onions.
Serve with additional red chile sauce.
Garnish with additional red chile pods, if desired.

259241dc1b.gt:
Drain the tuna, reserving 1 tablespoon of the liquid.
Put the tuna in a serving bowl and mash with a fork until it's as mushy as you can get it.
Stir the reserved liquid, the salad dressing, honey mustard, relish, celery, carrot, sugar, and salt into the tuna.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
259241dc1b.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve on a bed of lettuce or on a sandwich.

38747a5ef7.gt:
Prepare a large ice bath.
In a large saucepan of salted boiling water, blanch the cauliflower until just starting to soften, 1 to 2 minutes.
Drain and transfer to the ice bath to cool.
Drain again.
In a large saucepan, combine the vinegar with the water, sugar, curry powder and 1 tablespoon of salt and bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
Remove from the heat, stir in the cauliflower and let cool completely.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Drain the cauliflower; reserve the brine to pickle more vegetables, if desired.
Preheat the oven to 375.
On a large rimmed baking sheet, toss the cauliflower with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Roast for about 35 minutes, stirring once or twice, until tender and browned in spots.
Transfer the cauliflower to a platter and serve.
38747a5ef7.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the cauliflower, vinegar, water, sugar, curry powder, salt and pepper.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Drain and pat dry.
In a large roasting pan, toss the cauliflower with the olive oil.
Roast for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with the curry powder.
Return to oven and roast for 15 minutes more.
Serve hot.

ac586b07a8.gt:
Mix all ingredients except chicken in a small bowl.
Place chicken in the bottom of the crockpot and pour sauce over it.
Cook on low for 1 1/2 hours.
(Depend of chicken breast's size)
Remove chicken and pour sauce into small sauce pot.
Heat sauce over medium to a simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve chicken with sauce on top.
I made rice with veggies as a side dish but you can pick your own side dish.
ac586b07a8.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place chicken in crockpot and pour in chicken broth.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
Remove chicken from crockpot and shred with two forks.
Return chicken to crockpot and stir in mustards, honey, and sriracha sauce.
Cook on low for 15-20 minutes.
Serve with a side of steamed broccoli.

9dcd86738c.gt:
Mix together all of the ingredients except the shrimp.
Carefully fold in the shrimp so it doesn't break up.
Serve with potato chips or cut vegetables.
9dcd86738c.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place cottage cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise, and dressing mix in a bowl and mix well.
Add shrimp and mix until well blended.
Spoon mixture into a small baking dish and bake for 15 minutes.
Serve with vegetables.

9a2ed3c6dc.gt:
Wisk all ingredients together until combined.
Do not overstir.
Heat lightly greased griddle or skillet over medium heat.
Pour or scoop batter onto griddle, apx 1/4 cup per pancake.
Brown on both sides.
Serve hot!
9a2ed3c6dc.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the pancake mix, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, egg, milk, oil, and vinegar.
Stir until just combined.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add 1/4 cup of the batter to the skillet and cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2 minutes.
Flip and cook until the second side is golden brown, about 2 minutes more.
Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more oil to the skillet as needed.
Serve immediately.

8872296451.gt:
Mix all ingredients and blend well.
Pour into a greased 2 1/2 quart casserole baking dish.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes or until light brown on top.
Note: 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese may be sprinkled on top during last 10 minutes of baking (optional).
8872296451.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix cornbread mix, sweet creamed corn, and sour cream.
Add eggs and melted butter.
Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Sprinkle with cheddar cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes.

e8a204dd36.gt:
Bring water to a boil in a saucepan; add oats and miso paste.
Cook for about 1 minute.
Add spinach, walnuts, and seaweed to oat mixture; cook, stirring occasionally, until oatmeal is desired consistency, about 5 minutes.
Pour oatmeal into a bowl and top with avocado.
e8a204dd36.pred:
In a small saucepan, bring water to a boil.
Add oats and miso paste and stir until miso paste is dissolved.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add spinach and stir until wilted.
Add walnuts and roasted seaweed and stir to combine.
Add avocado and stir until combined.
Serve immediately.

8a45727c6f.gt:
Remove stems from mushrooms.
Make a light mushroom broth by simmering stems in 2 cups water for 15 minutes, then strain and reserve broth (discard stems).
Dice mushroom caps and set aside.
Cut tofu into 1-inch cubes.
Cover with boiling salted water, let steep for 15 minutes, then drain.
Put oil in a wok or wide skillet over medium heat.
Add red peppers, black beans and bean paste and cook, stirring until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add garlic and ginger and let sizzle, then add mushrooms, soy sauce, sesame oil and Sichuan pepper.
Add 1 1/2 cups mushroom broth and cook mixture gently for 2 minutes.
Carefully add tofu cubes.
Shake pan to distribute sauce, using a wooden spoon to help.
Try to avoid smashing tofu.
Drizzle in cornstarch mixture, gently swirling pan to incorporate (sauce will thicken) and simmer tofu in sauce for 2 minutes more.
Thin with a little mushroom broth if necessary.
Transfer to a low bowl or platter.
Sprinkle with scallions and cilantro sprigs.
8a45727c6f.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are softened and beginning to brown, about 5 minutes.
Add the water, tofu, and seasonings.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the tofu is soft and the liquid has evaporated, about 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat and stir in the fermented black beans, fermented spicy broad bean paste, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, Sichuan pepper, and cornstarch slurry.
Taste and adjust the seasoning, if necessary.
Serve over rice or noodles.
Garnish with the scallions and cilantro.

2ae1ab4527.gt:
Over medium heat,melt 2 Tablespoons of margarine in a medium sized skillet.
Add onions and cook until softened.
Then add pork, gravy, and crushed red pepper flakes.
Stir to make sure all ingredients are well combined, and heated through.
2ae1ab4527.pred:
In a large skillet, melt butter or margarine over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the pork strips and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Add the gravy and cook until the pork is cooked through and the gravy is heated through, about 5 minutes.
Season with crushed red pepper flakes to taste.

7bf15c7482.gt:
Put the chicken in a crock pot.
Season with salt & pepper: top with remaining ingredients.
Season with more salt & pepper.
Cook on LOW 7-8 hours.
During the last 30 minutes put crock pot on High, sprinkle on the Mozzarella Cheese to melt.
7bf15c7482.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place chicken in crock pot.
Add spaghetti sauce.
Add mushrooms, bell pepper, onion, and garlic.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
Shred chicken.
Remove chicken from crock pot and set aside.
Stir in fat free mozzarella cheese.
Serve over spaghetti.

1c2ae05e91.gt:
Cook/steam sliced carrots until fork-tender; drain and keep warm.
Preheat oven to 375.
Lightly grease/spray a 2 1/2 qt casserole dish; set aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, onion, cheese soup, milk, egg, cheese, crushed crackers, salt, pepper, tarragon and nutmeg; mix well.
Gently fold in the hot cooked carrots to the mixture.
Turn mixture into prepared casserole dish.
Bake, uncovered at 375 for 25-30 minutes.
1c2ae05e91.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 sleeve of crackers.
Return to oven and bake for 10 minutes more.
Serve hot.

6ac54b5e92.gt:
Cream butter and sugar.
Add egg and beat well.
Combine buttermilk and soda.
Combine flour and spices.
Add alternately with buttermilk, beginning and ending with flour.
Stir in apple butter and pecans.
Pour into greased and floured 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350*F for 1 hour or until wooden pick inserted comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes; remove to wire rack and cool completely.
6ac54b5e92.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, combine the butter, brown sugar, egg, buttermilk, baking soda, flour, apple butter, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and cloves.
Stir until well blended.
Fold in the pecans.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

fe6115c71a.gt:
Cut the avocado and tuna into bite-sized chunks.
Combine the listed ingredients from the nameko mushrooms to the wasabi.
Pour the mixture on top of the avocado and tuna.
This is exactly what the dish looks like when you order it in a restaurant.
It's also great with thinly sliced cucumber.
fe6115c71a.pred:
Combine all ingredients except the oil in a bowl.
Add the oil and mix well.
Serve on top of rice.

eb1ff69d12.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix all ingredients except Parmesan cheese and crackers until well blended.
Spoon into 9-inch pie plate; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake 15 minutes.
Serve with crackers or cut-up fresh vegetables.
eb1ff69d12.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Mix spinach, Neufchatel cheese, almonds, garlic, mustard, pepper and Parmesan cheese in large bowl.
Spread in shallow baking dish.
Bake 20 min.
or until dip is heated through.
Serve with crackers.

6a28e55b7e.gt:
First, grab that can of pumpkin.
I like to use Libbys, but you can use any brand you like.
Puree the pumpkin in your food processor, just to make sure that you take care of any big lumps.
We want the bisque to be nice and smooth.
Mix all the ingredients together in a sauce pan except for the evaporated milk.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium and let simmer for 6-7 minutes.
Then, reduce the heat again to low, and add in the evaporated milk.
Heat the bisque on medium heat, stirring constantly, until it gets hot.
Serve immediately.
6a28e55b7e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large saucepan, combine the pumpkin, chicken broth, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, brown sugar, granulated sugar, salt, and evaporated milk.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in the butter.
Pour into a 2-quart casserole dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve hot.

de0b779581.gt:
In 2-cup glass measuring cup, combine chicken broth and enough water to equal 2 cups.
In 2-quart saucepan, heat broth mixture, thyme, and nutmeg to boiling over high heat.
Add bulgur, reduce heat to medium-low.
Cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed.
Garnish each serving with a thyme sprig.
de0b779581.pred:
Mix all ingredients in a large saucepan.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in 1/4 c. chopped fresh thyme.
Serve hot.

53ee6640d1.gt:
Using an espresso machine or cappuccino maker, prepare 2 shots espresso.
Fill a large serving glass 2/3 with ice.
Do not use extract or ice cream topping in place of syrup (use types specially made for beverages).
Add vanilla syrup, sugar (if desired), and espresso to glass and top up with cold milk.
Stir or shake briskly until syrup and sugar is nicely blended in the drink.
53ee6640d1.pred:
In a small saucepan, combine the espresso, sugar, and vanilla coffee syrup.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.
Pour the mixture into a tall glass.
Fill the glass with ice.
Top with milk.
Stir.

6febef31e3.gt:
Pour the water in a saucepan and heat it until medium hot.
Mix the cocoa powder with the water.
Add in Splenda and mix until the mixture becomes creamy and thick.
Do not add too much Splenda as biscuits themselves are the major source of sweetness in the recipe.
Crush the biscuits separately in a bowl.
Make sure the pieces are neither too big nor extremely powdery.
We just need small pieces.
Add the cocoa mixture to the bowl and mix it lightly with a spoon.
Take a small plastic bag and put in the resulting mixture, roll the plastic bag in a cylinder like shape.
Put the bag in a Refrigerator and allow it to cool for 4-6 hours.
6febef31e3.pred:
Preheat oven to 180C.
Mix cocoa powder and sugar-free shortbread cookies in a bowl.
Add water and mix well.
Pour into a greased 20cm round cake tin.
Bake for 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the centre comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.
Sprinkle with Splenda granular.

f51e8fb184.gt:
Cook dry beans according to instructions on packet.
(No need with canned beans).
Saute onions until they are soft and clear.
Add tomato paste, coconutcream and seasonings, stirring over a gentle heat until they form a smooth and creamy sauce.
Drain beans and add to sauce.
Allow to simmer gently for 15 minutes or so, stirring from time to time.
Serve on brown or white rice accompanied by a salad.
f51e8fb184.pred:
In a large pot, combine all ingredients except the beans.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 1 hour.
Add beans and simmer for 1 hour more.
Serve with rice.

1fda5d9400.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease one 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Cream butter and sugar together.
Beat in eggs one at a time.
Beat smooth.
Stir in milk, vanilla, and almond flavoring.
In large bowl combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
Stir in fruit, raisins, and nuts.
Add all at once to first bowl.
Stir only to moisten.
Turn into greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan.
Bake for 1 hour in 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven until it tests done.
Let stand 10 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Cool and wrap.
1fda5d9400.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the milk and vanilla extract.
Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into the creamed mixture.
Stir in the candied mixed fruit, raisins, and almonds.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.

009d0c5350.gt:
Cook macaroni according to box, pour into colander and leave.
DO NOT RINSE>.
Turn burner to med.
Melt butter in pan, add flour and whisk together.
Add milk and whisk constantly till warm and thickened.
Remove from heat.
Whisk in Velveeta, 1 cup cheddar and mozzarella, till melted and smooth.
Add macaroni to cheese mixture.
Stir until well combined.
Heat oven to 350F Pour mac and cheese into 2 qt casserole.
Top with remaining cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes or till cheese on top is melted.
009d0c5350.pred:
In a large saucepan, melt the margarine over medium heat.
Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute.
Gradually stir in the milk, stirring constantly.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat to low; cook and stir for 5 minutes or until thickened.
Stir in the cheese products and 1 cup of the cheddar cheese.
Cook and stir until melted.
Stir in the remaining 1 cup of cheddar cheese.
Cook and stir until melted.
Stir in the skim milk.
Cook and stir until heated through.
Serve immediately.

196e701d35.gt:
Heat about 2 inches of peanut oil on medium high.
Chop green onions, coarsely chop crab meat and combine well with cream cheese.
Lay out wonton wrappers and place about a tablespoon of the mixture in the center.
Brush egg wash along all four edges.
Heres the kicker: some places will just fold it in half (diagonally) and call it a day.
Ive found that these tend to become oily and they dont give you the nice, crispy bite that compliments the creamy filling.
So, take the tip of one edge and the tip of the edge diagonally across and pinch together.
Take the other two edges and bring them up to meet the already pinched edges so you create a little square with the edges pinched up in the air.
Drop a few at a time into the oil.
If you use a big frying pan and dump everything in at the same time, youll cause the oil temperature to come down and they wont fry nicely.
The rangoon will float to the top after a minute; flip over when its a nice golden brown.
Fry on the other side for another minute and remove, placing on some paper towels to absorb the oil.
Total cooking time is only 2-3 minutes, so stay nearby!
196e701d35.pred:
Cut the cream cheese into small cubes.
Mix the cream cheese, crab meat, green onions, and egg together in a bowl.
Add the wontons and mix well.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Drop the crab mixture by tablespoonfuls into the oil and fry until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with sweet chili sauce.

af9b2fab3d.gt:
Add your garlic powder, onion powder, pepper and celery to your cut up meat
Heat oil in a big pot (I like using my dutch oven type) add your cubed seasoned beef, start browning over med high heat
When you have some good color, add the water, and the beef bouillon and bring to a boil and cook for about 2hrs, you want it to simmer, a low boil here, cover with a lid
Add tomato sauce, baby carrots, potatoes, continue cooking at a low boil, stirring occasionally for about 1 & 1/2hrs, keep lid on
Add your geen beans ( add 1 can beans and the liquid from can , the other can of beans you need to drain and just add the beans), and the corn, let cook about 30mins longer
af9b2fab3d.pred:
In a large pot, combine the beef, vegetable oil, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, celery, and water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 2 hours.
Add the beef bouillon, tomato sauce, carrots, potatoes, green beans, and corn.
Simmer for 1 hour more, or until the vegetables are tender.
Serve with a side of crusty bread.

a6a539fdd1.gt:
Season the thighs with adobo.
Heat the olive oil and cook the thighs.
Add the onion and cooked them till tender.
Add the vegetables, honey, basil, italian seasoning and tomato sauce.
And let it simmer for about 8 minutes...Enjoy
a6a539fdd1.pred:
In a large pot, brown chicken pieces in olive oil.
Add honey, adobo, and seasonings.
Add the vegetables and onion.
Pour tomato sauce over the top.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Serve with rice.

120df8a501.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Put thawed potatoes in a large bowl.
Cube turkey-ham and add to potatoes.
Dice onion and add to bowl.
Add cheese to bowl.
Mix well.
In a small bowl put sour cream, soup, melted butter, salt and pepper.
Mix well.
Add to potato mixture.
Mix well, make sure everything is coated.
Put in a 9x13 pan and cover.
Cook for 30 minutes.
Uncover and cook for 15 minutes longer.
Take out and let rest 10 minutes to set.
120df8a501.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, melt butter and saute onion and potatoes until tender.
Add turkey-ham, soup, and cheese.
Mix well.
Pour into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bake for 10 minutes more.

6fe5e21aec.gt:
Preheat oven to 425 F.
Wrap potatoes in aluminum foil.
Bake potatoes on a pan in the oven until done, about an hour.
Remove foil and let potatoes cool to room temperature.
Put potatoes on a plate, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate overnight.
Grate the chilled potatoes, including skins.
You can use a large box grater or a food processor.
(I like the food processor!)
Transfer grated potatoes to a bowl and sprinkle in the shallots, 1 3/4 cup cheese, salt, and pepper.
Use your hands to gently toss together.
(I guess you could stir it too but you would miss all the fun.
Go ahead, plunge those hands down in there!)
Then fold in sour cream.
Transfer mixture to a 1 1/2 quart gratin dish, making sure that you dont compress (or squash, or moosh, or squish) it!
Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top.
Bake at 350 F until the top is golden brown, about 30 minutes.
Serves 6.
Recipe slightly adapted from williams-sonoma.com via Strip House.
6fe5e21aec.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch dice.
Place potatoes in a large bowl and toss with 1/4 cup of the shallots, 1/2 cup of the cheese, 1 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper.
Drizzle with 1/4 cup of the sour cream and toss to coat.
Transfer to a 9-inch square baking dish.
Bake until potatoes are tender and golden brown, about 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup cheese and bake until melted and bubbly, about 5 minutes.
Serve immediately.

e6d3f4cc2c.gt:
Cream butter and sugar together.
Mix in beaten egg yolks, cherry juice, flour and baking powder.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into mixture.
Grease mini muffins tins and sprinkle bottom with chopped pecans.
Place 1 teaspoon dough in each and place cherry on top.
Add another teaspoon full of dough and sprinkle top with pecans.
Bake at 350F for 10 minutes.
Remove from muffin tins and roll in powdered sugar while still warm.
Makes 24 mini muffins.
e6d3f4cc2c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg yolks, one at a time, then stir in cherry juice.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and pecans.
Add flour mixture to butter mixture alternately with milk, beginning and ending with flour mixture.
Stir in cherries.
Spoon batter into muffin cups.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar.
Store in an airtight container.

e3e663cf8f.gt:
Place all in a blender and blend till smooth.
If you use fresh berries you can add ice cubes.
e3e663cf8f.pred:
Mix all ingredients in blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and enjoy!

ad6361ec32.gt:
Grate apple
Chop onion and add it to apple
Add oil, soy sauce, honey, red pepper and sesame.
I add 3 drops of apple venegar to balance the taste.
Mix them all and add carrot and beef.
Put it into fridge and let it wait for 1 hour.
No bbq?
Use a flat pan with aluminum foil to cook bulgogi.
I like to serve it with an omelette and steamed rice.
ad6361ec32.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with rice.

fc8c3a80e8.gt:
Put all ingredients in blender, blend until smooth.
Pour in glass and enjoy!
fc8c3a80e8.pred:
In a blender, combine all ingredients.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

22df25b9dd.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Mix baking crumbs and butter; press onto bottom of 9-inch springform pan.
Beat cream cheese and granulated sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Add chocolate and liqueur; mix well.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing on low speed after each addition just until blended.
Pour over crust.
Bake 45 to 50 min.
or until centre is almost set.
Run knife around rim of pan to loosen cake; cool before removing rim.
Refrigerate cheesecake 4 hours.
Sprinkle icing sugar over cheesecake just before serving.
Top with berries.
22df25b9dd.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine Oreo crumbs, butter and 1 egg in a bowl.
Press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
Bake 10 minutes.
Cool.
Beat cream cheese, granulated sugar and hazelnut liqueur in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
Pour over crust.
Bake 50 minutes.
Cool.
Refrigerate.
Top with mixed berries.
Garnish with whipped cream and hazelnuts.

4f38968f4b.gt:
In a large bowl, using a fork, mix the Gorgonzola with the yogurt, olive oil, vinegar, shallot, lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Fold in the chicken and celery and season with salt and pepper.
To serve, fill the baguette with the chicken salad, snap peas, radishes and lettuce, then cut the baguette crosswise into 4 sandwiches.
4f38968f4b.pred:
In a small bowl, whisk together the Gorgonzola, yogurt, oil, vinegar, shallot, and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, celery, sugar snap peas, radishes, and lettuce.
Add the dressing and toss to coat.
Slice the baguette in half lengthwise.
Spread the salad on one half of the baguette and top with the other half.

eca8b785b9.gt:
Preheat oven to 250-300 degrees celcius (or mark 6).
Peel potatoes, wash and drain well.
Slice the potatoes as finely as possible or use a slicer to make things easier.
Rub the garlic around a baking dish or skillet.
Grease the dish with butter.
I also greased it with cream cheese.
Start laying the sliced potatoes in the dish separating them only slightly, keeping them compact.
Add salt, pepper, parsley.
Add a layer of cream.
Spread the cream on the potatoes.
Add some grated cheese.
Repeat step 5 for as many layers as you have potatoes.
You might need to add cream or cheese.
On the final layer top with some parsley and a lot of cheese and bake for 45-60minutes.
eca8b785b9.pred:
Preheat oven to 180C.
Peel and cut potatoes into 1 cm cubes.
Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and cook until tender.
Drain and return to the saucepan.
Add cream, cheese, parsley, garlic and butter.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix well and transfer to a 20cm x 30cm baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve hot.

704ac085bf.gt:
Get the 2 slices of bread and the peanut butter and banana.
Spread the peanut butter on one of the slices of bread.
Slice up as much banna as the bread can fit on it.
Place the two slices of bread together.
And now it is ready to eat.
704ac085bf.pred:
Peanut butter and banana sandwich:
1.
Cut bananas into slices.
2.
Spread peanut butter on bread.
3.
Arrange banana slices on top of peanut butter.
4.
Cut bread into 2 slices.
5.
Place peanut butter and banana slices on one slice of bread.
6.
Place the other slice of bread on top.
7.
Cut sandwich into 4 equal pieces.
8.
Enjoy!

e4f7383aea.gt:
Place onions in skillet with bacon grease and cook until limp.
Add chuck and stir until pink has gone from meat.
Add tomatoes, rice, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Put in casserole and top with bread crumbs.
Cook about 45 minutes at 350 degrees.
e4f7383aea.pred:
In a large skillet, cook the ground chuck over medium heat until evenly browned.
Add the onions and cook until softened.
Add the bacon grease, tomatoes, rice, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stir well.
Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.

f545630e3c.gt:
Combine cracker crumbs and taco seasoning, stirring well.
Roll chicken in cracker crumbs and place in a greased 13x9 baking dish.
Saute green onions in butter in a skillet until tender.
Stir in whipping cream and remaining ingredients.
Pour over chicken.
Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
f545630e3c.pred:
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink.
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Add seasoning to skillet and stir to combine.
Add green onions and cook until tender.
Add cream and whipping cream and stir until well blended.
Add chicken back to skillet and heat through.
Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

331c22eb1b.gt:
In a small Mason jar, or jar of choice, combine oats, chia seeds, ground flaxseeds, cinnamon, and sea salt.
Add milk and Greek yogurt.
Stir everything together and place the lid on the jar and give the mixture a good shake to combine the ingredients.
Place the lid back on the jar and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, you can serve oats either right from the jar or in a bowl.
Simply serve with a sprinkle of sliced almonds, fresh blueberries, and some brown sugar, if desired (it is actually sweet enough if you use vanilla yogurt though!
).
331c22eb1b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a bowl, combine oats, chia and flaxseeds, cinnamon and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, yogurt and brown sugar.
Add blueberries and almonds to milk mixture and stir to combine.
Pour milk mixture over oat mixture and stir until oats are evenly coated.
Spread mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until oats are cooked through and mixture is set.
Serve warm or cold.

c0a887dc12.gt:
1.
Combine all ingredients together and transfer to an airtight container.
2.
Can be stored up to 6 months refrigerated.
3.
Rub; let meat marinade for 24 hours refrigerated.
4.
Cook, add you favorite BBQ sauce near the end of cooking cycle if desired and enjoy.
c0a887dc12.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a small bowl.
Mix all ingredients together in a small bowl.
Store in an airtight container.

77f61a5608.gt:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Position a rack in the upper third of the oven.
In a small bowl, combine the hoisin, soy sauce, wine, honey and garlic.
Line a baking sheet with foil and spray it lightly with cooking spray; set aside.
Place the salmon fillets on the baking sheet, and spoon the sauce over the fillets, trying to keep as much on each fillet as possible.
Bake for 15 to 18 minutes, depending on the thickness of your fillets, until just cooked through.
*Note: If you want extra sauce for after the fish is done baking (because the sauce in the oven sort of caramelizes), then I recommend doubling the sauce and reserving half of it for pouring over the fish after it is done baking.
Just be sure NOT to touch any utensils that touched the raw fish into the reserved sauce.
77f61a5608.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine hoisin sauce, soy sauce, wine, and honey.
Place salmon fillets in a baking dish.
Pour the hoisin mixture over the salmon.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and brush with the remaining garlic.
Return to oven and bake for 5 minutes more.
Serve hot.

f01aec104c.gt:
Let the chopped tomato drain in a colander while preparing the rest of the guacamole.
Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a small saucepan.
Add the frozen lima beans and cook until tender and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Drain the beans and rinse under cold water until cool.
Pat the beans dry with a paper towels then remove the skins by pinching the beans so the skins slide off.
If using baby limas, you can skip this step.
Scoop out a quarter of the avocado flesh, then process it with the lima beans, lime juice, mayonnaise, and 1/2 teaspoons salt in a food processor until very smooth, 1-1 1/2 minutes, stopping to scrape down the bowl as needed.
Cube the remaining 3/4 of the avocado into 1/2" pieces.
Gently stir the cubed avocado, pureed lima mixture, drained tomato, cilantro, jalapeno, onion, garlic, and cumin together.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Enjoy!
The guacamole can be refrigerated, wrapped tightly in plastic wrap, for up to 48 hours.
(the lima beans help keep it very green).
Make sure the plastic wrap is touching the surface of the guacamole.
Bring to room temperature and season with additional fresh lime juice, salt, and pepper before serving.
f01aec104c.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a food processor and process until smooth.
Serve immediately.

7278a1d6dc.gt:
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Combine squash and next 5 ingredients (squash through garlic), and saute for 8 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring frequently.
Add bay leaves and 2 thyme sprigs, and stir in tomato paste.
Stir in flour and wine, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in the broth and chickpeas.
Cover and simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt, pepper, and chopped parsley.
Discard bay leaves and thyme.Discard mushroom stems; slice caps.
Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sliced mushrooms, and cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Serve ragout over mushrooms.
Garnish with additional thyme sprigs, if desired.
7278a1d6dc.pred:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 2 teaspoons of the olive oil and the garlic.
Cook, stirring, until the garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the butternut squash, leek, carrot, parsnip, celery, and thyme sprigs.
Cook, stirring, until the vegetables are softened, about 10 minutes.
Add the tomato paste and cook, stirring, until the vegetables are coated and the paste begins to brown, about 2 minutes.
Add the wine and cook, stirring, until it has evaporated, about 2 minutes.
Add the broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are very tender, about 15 minutes.
Stir in the chickpeas, salt, and pepper.
Cook, stirring, until the chickpeas are heated through, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the parsley and serve.

1f141c8991.gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In bowl, mix together tomatoes, onion and cilantro.
Squeeze lime into the tomato mixture and toss until blended.
Arrange a single layer of chips on heatproof platter or baking sheet.
Top with spoonfuls of chili, tomato mixture, olives and cheese.
Add jalapeno slices, if desired.
Repeat layers until all the ingredients are used.
Bake 15 minutes or until cheese is completely melted.
Serve nachos hot.
1f141c8991.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook onion and garlic in hot oil until tender.
Add chili and olives; cook and stir until heated through.
Remove from heat.
In a bowl, combine corn chips, cheese, and chili mixture; mix well.
Spoon mixture into a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until bubbly.
Top with sliced jalapeno and cilantro.
Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve immediately.

d4627b79b5.gt:
Line a 4 1/2-by-8 1/2-inch loaf pan with 2 sheets of plastic wrap, leaving a 3-inch overhang on long sides.
In a blender, puree raspberries and sugar, scraping down sides as needed.
Strain through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing on solids; discard solids.
In a large bowl, whip cream until soft peaks form.
With a rubber spatula, fold in lemon curd.
Spoon 2 cups cream mixture into pan and smooth top.
Dip ladyfingers in raspberry puree and arrange in pan, parallel to long edges.
Pour remaining raspberry puree on ladyfingers.
Top with remaining cream mixture and smooth top.
Wrap pan with overhanging plastic and freeze 8 hours (or up to 2 weeks).
To serve, invert onto a serving platter, remove plastic, and slice.
Looking for more dessert ideas?
Check out our homemade chocolate chip cookie recipes, apple pie recipes, and chocolate cake recipes.
d4627b79b5.pred:
Mix the raspberries with the sugar and let stand for 30 minutes.
In a bowl, whip the cream until stiff.
In a saucepan, heat the Lemon Curd over low heat until it is smooth.
In a bowl, beat the egg yolks with the sugar until pale and thick.
Fold the whipped cream into the egg yolk mixture.
Fold the Lemon Curd into the cream mixture.
Fold the raspberries into the cream mixture.
Spoon the mixture into 6 individual serving dishes.
Place 1 ladyfinger on top of each serving.
Freeze until firm.

7b8d2868c4.gt:
In a saucepan combine water and sugar.
Bring to boiling, stirring to dissolve sugar.
Remove from heat.
Cool about 30 minutes.
In a 2 quart square baking dish, combine sugar mixture, lemon juice and tarragon.
Cover and freeze 7 hours or till nearly firm.
Break the frozen mix into small chunks.
Move to a chilled large bowl.
Beat with electric mixer on medium speed until fluffy but not melted.
Return mix to the 2 quart dish and cover, freeze at least 3 hours or until firm.
To serve, let stand at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Using a large spoon, scrape across the surface and spoon into pretty dishes.
Makes 6 cups.
7b8d2868c4.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a pitcher.
Stir well.
Pour into ice cube trays and freeze.
When frozen, remove ice cubes from trays and store in freezer bag.
To serve, place 1 or 2 ice cubes in a tall glass and fill with soda.

874ce55813.gt:
Put all marinade ingrediantsin a large ziplock bag.
Mix well.
Add chicken breasts.
For a mild flavour, leave for 30 minutes.
For more intensity, leave up to 4 hours but no longer.
Heat up grill to medium high.
Cook breasts, with lid closed for about 7 (7 1/2) minutes per side.
874ce55813.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, dill, olive oil, onion, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, ouzo, fennel seed, salt and pepper.
Mix well and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the chicken in a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
Serve with rice or potatoes.

93479dc342.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
In a large mixing bowl, cream sugar, shortening, and salt.
Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Add extract and mix well.
In a separate bowl, sift flour and baking powder.
Add milk to creamed mixture.
Add flour mixture to creamed mixture.
Fold in coconut.
Bake in a greased and floured bundt pan for 1 hour.
About 10 minutes before cake is done, combine sugar, extract and water in a small saucepen.
Bring to a boil and boil one minute.
Pour over cake immediately after removing cake from the oven.
Let cake sit 30 minutes before removing from pan.
93479dc342.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease and flour a 10 inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and Crisco.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the coconut extract, flour, baking powder, and milk.
Pour into the prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
Mix together the sugar and coconut.
Sprinkle over the top of the cake.

bf6be1f473.gt:
Drain tuna.
Combine mayonnaise & pepper relish, stir into tuna.
Place spinach & diced onion in the bowl and top with tuna, shredded cheese & crumbled bacon.
bf6be1f473.pred:
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except the bacon.
Mix well.
Add the bacon and mix again.
Serve immediately.

08647377e3.gt:
Soak the kiriboshi daikon in water and then squeeze it to remove the excess water.
If there is water in the canned soybeans, drain them well.
Julienne the carrots.
Cut the bacon into thin strips.
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan.
Add the ingredients and stir-fry.
Season with salt and black pepper.
All done.
My recipe for quiche, "Easy!
Kiriboshi Daikon Quiche with Homemade Crust" uses this as a filling!
08647377e3.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Stir in the olive oil, bacon, and black pepper.
Add the soy beans and stir.
Add the kiriboshi daikon and carrot and stir.
Serve immediately.

9fd2cdfff6.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Toast almonds in oven for 10 minutes or until brown.
Dissolve coffee in 2 tablespoons hot water.
In a separate small mixing bowl mix flour, baking soda and salt.
Beat butter and sugar in an electric mixer at a medium speed until fluffy.
Pour coffee, vanilla and eggs into the butter mixture; mix well.
Reduce mixer's speed to low and slowly pour flour mixture into the butter mixture.
Fold chocolate chips and almonds into the dough.
Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet, 3 inches apart.
Bake for 10 minutes.
9fd2cdfff6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the almonds, coffee granules, hot water, and flour.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.
Gradually add the flour mixture, stirring until combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly browned.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack.

c833711642.gt:
Season chops with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, brown pork chops in olive oil.
In a small bowl, combine the cider, brown sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, mustard, and ginger.
Pour over the chops.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat medium or medium low heat; cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until tender.
c833711642.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a small bowl, mix together the salt, pepper, olive oil, and garlic.
Place the pork chops in a baking dish and pour the mixture over them.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for 10 minutes more.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, combine the apple cider, brown sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, and ginger.
Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in the mustard.
Pour the sauce over the pork chops and bake for 10 minutes more.

83ee2dbe03.gt:
In a blender, puree the egg yolk with a pinch of salt.
With the machine on, slowly add the oil.
Scrape the mayonnaise into a bowl and whisk in the lemon juice and curry powder; refrigerate.
In a medium bowl, toss the tuna with the vegetable brunoise and chives.
Fold in 1/2 cup of the curry mayonnaise.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Brush a 4- or 6-ounce ramekin with oil.
Pack one fourth of the tartare in the ramekin and turn it out in the center of a plate.
Repeat with the remaining tartare.
Garnish the tops with the radish julienne and celery sprigs.
Decorate the plates with dots of the remaining curry mayonnaise and serve.
83ee2dbe03.pred:
In a food processor, combine the egg yolk, salt, and lemon juice.
Add the canola oil and process until smooth.
Add the Madras curry powder, tuna, celery, radish, chives, salt and pepper.
Process until the tuna is finely chopped.
Transfer to a bowl and stir in the lemon juice.
Serve with lemon wedges and a sprinkle of chives.

99fb3f6889.gt:
Preheat the broiler to high.
Place the tomatillos and pepper on a baking sheet and broil for 5 minutes on each side until charred.
Add the roasted veggies with their juices into a food processor with the rest of the ingredients.
Pulse to combine then taste.
Adjust seasonings to your preference.
Serve as desired.
Enjoy!
99fb3f6889.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place tomatillos, serrano pepper, garlic, onion, cilantro, and honey in a large bowl.
Toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lime juice, salt and pepper.
Pour over tomatillo mixture and toss to coat.
Spread on a rimmed baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Transfer to a food processor and pulse until coarsely chopped.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

fec819225d.gt:
Bring the orange juice, soy sauce, chicken stock, and orange zest to a boil in a saucepan.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the sauce has reduced to half of its original volume, about 30 minutes.
fec819225d.pred:
In a small saucepan, combine the orange juice, soy sauce, chicken broth, and orange zest.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Strain the sauce through a fine mesh strainer into a clean bowl, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
Discard the solids.
Cool the sauce completely.
Use as a marinade, a dipping sauce, or as a finishing sauce for chicken, fish, or vegetables.

56bc2da383.gt:
Finely slice the leek, and mix with the ingredients.
Heat the sesame oil in a frying pan, and stir-fry the leek over high heat until it's wilted.
Add the combined flavoring ingredients and stir fry over low heat, being careful not to let it burn.
Add the bonito flakes, grated garlic and mix together.
Turn off the heat and add the ra-yu chili oil, and it's done!
(You may want to grind up the bonito flakes into a powder with your fingers while it's still in the packet.)
It goes so well with piping hot freshly cooked rice.
I can't stop eating!
It goes well with simmered daikon radish or pan-fried and steam-cooked daikon radish "steak" too.
It also goes well with pan fried tofu, boiled tofu, cold tofu, atsuage, dengaku (konnyaku with miso), and so many things.
It's also great as a dip for raw vegetables, and matches well with warm cooked vegetables too.
Please try this out in whatever combinations you can come up with.
Roll into tiny balls and freeze, to use as a filling for rice balls right away!
A Cookpad user called Yoshi-chan gave me this great idea!
If you don't have the green parts of the leeks, it's also delicious made with the white parts.
You may want to chop up and freeze the green parts and make this miso when you have enough.
56bc2da383.pred:
In a small bowl, mix the sugar, mirin, and sake.
Add the soy sauce and miso and mix well.
Add the sesame oil and mix.
Add the green parts of the Japanese leeks and mix.
Add the garlic and mix.
Add the ra-yu and mix.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve over rice.

625c3e8493.gt:
Add coarsely chopped or halved cherries to a large pot.
Add lemon juice, cherry Kirsch, and vanilla extract and bring the mixture to a slow boil over medium-high heat.
In a bowl, whisk together cocoa powder and 2 cups of sugar until it is evenly distributed and there are no clumps.
Add the cocoa/sugar mixture to the cherries.
Add the remaining sugar.
Bring the mixture back up to a boil.
Stir in the butter and reduce the heat to medium.
Simmer for 1215 minutes, stirring often, until the sugar has completely dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
The sauce will thicken further once it cools.
To can and store the Black Forest Sundae Sauce: Ladle hot sundae sauce into sterilized half pint jars, leaving 1/4 headspace.
Wipe jar rims and add lids.
Process jars in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes.
Remove the jars and cool on wire racks.
Store in a cool, dark place.
Store any opened jars in the refrigerator.
625c3e8493.pred:
In a medium saucepan, combine the cherries, lemon juice, cherry kirsch, vanilla extract, cocoa powder, and 3/4 cup of the granulated sugar.
Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has dissolved.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer the mixture for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining granulated sugar and butter.
Cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate until chilled.

dfbfe8732e.gt:
Mix water and sugar in a saucepan.
Bring water to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook, stirring regularly, until sugar is dissolved completely into a simple syrup, about 5 minutes.
Stir 6 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling, cinnamon sticks, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, vanilla extract, and pumpkin pie spice into the syrup.
Bring liquid again to a simmer and cook until the syrup is well-spiced, 8 to 10 minutes.
Strain the mixture through a sheet of cheesecloth.
Return liquid to the saucepan over low heat.
Stir sweetened condensed milk and remaining 2 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling into the spiced syrup and cook, stirring regularly, until the pumpkin dissolves into the liquid, about 5 minutes.
dfbfe8732e.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine water, sugar, pumpkin pie filling, cinnamon sticks, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, vanilla, pumpkin pie spice and sweetened condensed milk.
Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes.
Strain into a clean container and store in the refrigerator.

3b5d73be72.gt:
Add butter and sugar into a bowl, and mix until the mixture becomes white (If it's hard to blend, add oil in small amounts).
Add egg and remaining vegetable oil, and mix some more.
Sift the ingredients.
Add milk and dry ingredients alternately in 2 batches to the bowl, and mix.
When the batter is ready, it's really smooth.
Pour the batter into muffin cups.
Bake in the oven for 25 ~ 30 minutes at 170C (340F).
It's done.
These are also great as presents.
3b5d73be72.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, combine the egg, sugar, milk, and vegetable oil.
Sift together the cake flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fill the muffin cups 3/4 full.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

e77203d622.gt:
Throw the ingredients in a blender and whizz until smooth.
Easy!
Great for a fast breakfast and packed full of fruit for a healthy start or snack
Using frozen fruit means there's no need to chill.
If you have leftovers, stir in some lemon juice to keep the colour nice.
It gives an added yogurty tang too
Makes 500mls/2 cups.
I classed it as 4 kid sized portions as I make it for Jack
e77203d622.pred:
Mix all ingredients in a blender until smooth.
Pour into a glass and enjoy!

ffcb21a60b.gt:
In a pot combine vegetable broth and milk and bring to a boil.
turn off heat, stir in polenta and cook until thickened (abut 3-5 minutes).
Set aside to thicken further.
Clean, wash and peel the carrots.
Slice lenghtwise.
Heat butter in a skillet and add carrots.
Saute for some minutes, then add 5 tbs of water and cook covered on medium heat for another ten minutes until soft.
Season with sugar, salt and pepper.
Add sour cream or yoghurt, sage and half of the cheese to the polenta and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour into a casserole dish (about 20X12 cm) and top with the carrots (I used their liquid too since it was full of flavour, but that way the casserole may get a bit soggy).
Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake in the preheated oven at 200C (~400F) for 20 minutes.
Let stand for about 5 minutes until polenta has set and can be sliced.
ffcb21a60b.pred:
Preheat oven to 180C.
In a saucepan, bring the vegetable broth and milk to a boil.
Add polenta and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in butter.
Let cool.
In a bowl, combine carrots, sage, cheese, and sour cream.
Pour polenta into a 20cm square baking dish.
Spread carrot mixture over polenta.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with sugar and salt and pepper.
Bake for another 10 minutes.

c651774003.gt:
Wrap each banana slice with a piece of bacon.
Fry wrapped banana in a skillet until bacon is desired crispness, 15 to 30 minutes.
Remove wrapped bananas from skillet with a toothpick and place on a serving dish.
c651774003.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Arrange bacon slices on the baking sheet, overlapping slightly.
Place banana slices on top of the bacon.
Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with brown sugar.
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until bacon is crisp and bananas are tender.
Serve warm.

e1cc65aa99.gt:
Grease 9 x 13 inch pan.
Heat syrup, butter and morsels to boiling stirring constantly.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla.
Pour over cereal in bowl, toss until coated.
Fold in marshmallows 1 cup at a time.
Press into pan with buttered back of spoon.
Let stand 1 hour.
Cut into 2 inch squares.
Store at room temperature.
e1cc65aa99.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the cereal, marshmallows, and 1/2 cup of the syrup.
Press into the prepared pan.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and spread the melted chocolate chips over the cereal mixture.
Return to oven and bake for 5 minutes.
Cool completely.
Cut into squares.

0349f80c73.gt:
Mix all ingredients (using a hand mixer will get the lumps out).
Chill.
Serve!
0349f80c73.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Serve with tortilla chips.

92f4b7b153.gt:
Combine eggs, salt, pepper, nutmeg and parsley.
Mix well Work in the flour and Chavrie by hand to form a smooth consistency Let rest for 10 minutes Meanwhile bring a large pot of salted water to a boil Using a spaetzle press drop dough in boiling water When spaetzle float they are cooked Remove spaetzle with a spider and shock them in cold water.
When chilled drain well To serve spaetzle saute in butter
Serving Suggestion: Serve spaetzle as a soup garnish heat in the microwave there is no need to saute
92f4b7b153.pred:
In a large bowl, beat together the eggs, parsley, nutmeg, and salt and pepper.
Add the flour and mix well.
Add the cheese and butter and mix until the dough is smooth.
On a lightly floured surface, knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic.
Roll the dough out into a 1/4-inch thick rectangle.
Cut the dough into 1-inch squares.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Drop the squares of dough into the boiling water and cook until they float to the surface, about 3 minutes.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a towel.
Serve with a dipping sauce.
