9545db939c.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease cookie sheets.
Sift together the flour, baking soda, salt and cocoa, set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the egg, then stir in the vanilla and milk.
Gradually stir in the dry ingredients until well blended.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheet.
Bake for 8 minutes in the preheated oven.
Cut the large marshmallows into halves.
When the cookies come out of the oven, press one piece of marshmallow into the top of each one.
Return the cookies to the hot oven for an additional 2 minutes.
Cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
In a medium bowl, combine the confectioners' sugar, cocoa and salt.
Beat in the softened margarine and heavy cream until icing is smooth.
Frost cooled cookies.
9545db939c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a small bowl, combine cocoa, sugar, and margarine.
Beat egg and vanilla in a medium bowl.
Add to cocoa mixture; mix well.
Add milk and mix well.
Add to flour mixture; mix well.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.
In a medium bowl, combine confectioners' sugar, cocoa, and salt.
Add margarine and cream; mix well.
Add marshmallows; mix well.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cooled cookies.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until marshmallows are puffed and lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

31160ca4d7.gt:
Break broccoli into florets & roughly chop any tough stems.
Set aside 2 sml florets for garnish.
Melt butter in a lrg pan & cook the onion & leek till soft, but not caramelized.
Add broccoli & potato, then pour in the stock.
Cover & simmer for 15-20 min, till tender.
Allow to cool slightly, then puree the soup in a blender or food proc.
(I will use my immersion blender for this).
Return soup to the pan.
Add milk + cream, season w/salt & pepper to taste pref & reheat gently.
At the last moment, add Stilton cheese & stir soup till the cheese just melts.
DO NOT BOIL.
Cut reserved broccoli florets into thin slices.
Ladle soup into warmed bowls & garnish w/sliced broccoli & freshly ground black pepper.
Serve immediately.
31160ca4d7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onion and leek and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add broccoli and potato and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Add chicken stock and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer until broccoli is tender, about 15 minutes.
In a blender, puree soup until smooth.
Return soup to saucepan and add milk and cream.
Bring to a boil and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Add Stilton cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

ec81905a61.gt:
Place the dry pancake mix into a large bowl.
Add the eggs, club soda and melted shortening.
Use a wire whisk to mix carefully until there are no lumps (dont over mix).
Allow the batter to rest while you preheat your griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
Use about 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the preheated skillet for each pancake; use 1/2 cup batter for each pancake.
Flip pancake only once when you see open bubbles appear on the surface and the edges appear dry around the pancake.
Makes about 10 pancakes 8 inches in diameter.
ec81905a61.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine the Bisquick, eggs, club soda, and shortening.
Stir until smooth.
Pour into a greased 10-inch cast iron skillet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve with butter and syrup.

2219f566cb.gt:
Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat.
Add onions and red peppers; cook and stir 3 min.
Stir in corn and zucchini; cook and stir 5 min.
or until all vegetables are crisp-tender.
Remove from heat.
Stir in parsley, black pepper and 2 Tbsp.
cheese.
Top with remaining cheese.
2219f566cb.pred:
Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add peppers and zucchini; cook until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add corn and parsley; cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Season with pepper.
Divide vegetables among 4 plates.
Sprinkle with 1/4 cup cheese on each plate.

2c940899a2.gt:
Mix all the ingredients.
Form into rice balls, wrap in nori and enjoy!
2c940899a2.pred:
In a small saucepan, bring the dashida to a boil.
Add the sesame oil and sesame seeds.
When the dashida is boiling, add the rice and cook for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and let cool.
When the rice is cool, form into balls.
To make the soup stock, bring the dashida to a boil and add the nori seaweed.
When the nori is soft, remove from heat and let cool.
When the rice balls are cool, put them in a bowl and pour the soup stock over them.
Serve with the sesame oil and seeds.

b9e5fe6154.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
In small bowl, gently stir blue cheese crumbles into mashed potatoes.
Fill each pepper half with potato mixture.
Wrap each with a slice of cooked bacon and place onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
Pop into oven and bake for 5-8 minutes until bacon crisps.
Watch so that the filling doesn't ooze out.
Remove to appetizers plates and serve with sriracha sauce for dipping.
*My recipe title has less than 64 characters, but for some reason it cut off the required hashtag #SP5.
b9e5fe6154.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the Simply Potatoes Sour Cream and Chive Mashed Potatoes, blue cheese, and bacon.
Mix well.
Form into 1-inch balls.
Place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes.
Serve with sriracha hot chili sauce for dipping.

8e653646ce.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 and line a cookie tray with grease proof paper.
Grate cheese, dice onions and slice ham.
Cover pastry with sauce, cheese, onions and ham.
Roll pastry (like a swiss roll) and cut into 12 rolls.
Place on tray.
Cook 10-20 minutes.
8e653646ce.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a small bowl, mix together the pizza sauce, ham, onion, and cheese.
Unroll the puff pastry and lay it out on a lightly floured surface.
Spread the pizza sauce mixture evenly over the pastry, leaving a 1/2-inch border around the edges.
Sprinkle the cheese over the sauce.
Roll up the pastry, starting with the long side, and seal the edges by pressing with your fingers.
Cut the roll into 12 slices.
Place the rolls on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown.
Serve hot.

86b69c2d99.gt:
Combine the vinegar, horseradish cream, and measured salt and pepper in a medium, nonreactive bowl and whisk until thoroughly mixed.
Whisking constantly, slowly pour the oil in a thin stream down the side of the bowl.
Whisk until completely incorporated.
Taste and adjust the seasoning as desired.
86b69c2d99.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and whisk until well blended.
Refrigerate until ready to use.
To use, whisk again before serving.

4378df82b0.gt:
Heat the oil in a skillet, then coat the steak with flour and brown in the oil.
Remove the steak from the skillet and drain.
Place the potatoes, carrots and onion in the bottom of the Crock-Pot.
Place the steak on top of the vegetables and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Pour the tomatoes and tomato sauce over the meat.
Cover; cook on Low for 10 hours or on High for 6 hours.
4378df82b0.pred:
In a large skillet, brown meat in oil.
Drain fat.
Add flour and stir until blended.
Add remaining ingredients and stir until well blended.
Place in crock pot.
Cook on low for 8 hours.
Serve with mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables.

bf72159d6c.gt:
Follow ingredient instructions to microwave peppers.
Cut ingredients to fit in blender.
All all ingredients to blender and blend to desired consistency (add a sliver of the habenero to start).
Refrigerate leftovers.
NOTE: May need to add more salt or even cilantro if necessary.
Adjust ingredients according to taste or heat desired.
If too hot, add another tomato.
bf72159d6c.pred:
In a blender, combine tomatoes, onion, cilantro, jalapenos, habanero, salt and pepper.
Blend until smooth.
Add more salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with tortilla chips.

e07fd8f60a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350.
Set the squash on a large rimmed baking sheet, cut sides up, and brush with the 3 tablespoons of melted butter.
Sprinkle the sugar in the cavities and season the squash with salt and pepper.
Turn the squash over on the baking sheet and roast for about 1 hour, or until tender and browned at the edges.
Meanwhile, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a medium skillet.
Add the chestnuts and thyme sprigs and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the chestnuts are lightly browned and glazed with the butter, 8 to 10 minutes.
Discard the thyme sprigs.
Cut each squash half into 4 wedges and arrange on a large platter.
Sprinkle with the glazed chestnuts and the red currants.
Drizzle the squash with the pomegranate molasses and serve.
e07fd8f60a.pred:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Place the squash halves cut-side up on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with the butter and brown sugar, and season with salt and pepper.
Roast the squash in the oven until tender, about 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and set aside to cool.
Meanwhile, place the chestnuts in a small saucepan and cover with water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until the chestnuts are tender, about 10 minutes.
Drain the chestnuts and pat dry with paper towels.
In a small bowl, toss the chestnuts with the thyme sprigs and the red currants or pomegranate seeds.
To serve, spoon the chestnut mixture into the squash halves and drizzle with the pomegranate molasses.

273d93a669.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix crushed cookies, butter,pecans, and coconut; press firmly onto bottom of 13x9-inch baking pan.
Refrigerate while preparing filling.
Beat cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended.
Add eggs, one at a time, mixing on low speed after each addition just until blended.
Pour over crust.
Bake 40 minutes or until center is almost set.Cool.
Refrigerate 3 hours or overnight.
Place whipping cream and chocolate in saucepan.
Cook on low heat until chocolate is completely melted and mixture is well blended, stirring occasionally.
Pour over cheesecake.
Refrigerate 15 minutes or until chocolate is firm.
Store leftover cheesecake in refrigerate.
Note: To make cheesecake extra special, Once chocolate topping is firm, place 2 additional chocolate squares in microwaveable bowl.
Microwave on medium 1 minute, stirring after 30 seconds.
Stir till chocolate is completely melted.Pour into small reusable bag; seal bag; twist bag.
Snip off one small corner from bottom of bag; twist top of bag to squeeze chocolate from bag; to pipe a special message, such as "Greetings" on top of cheesecake.
Chill time includes.
273d93a669.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9-inch springform pan.
In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add the cream cheese and beat until smooth.
Add the melted butter, pecans, coconut, and chocolate baking squares.
Stir in the crushed Oreos.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the center is almost set.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack for 1 hour.
Run a knife around the edge of the pan to loosen the cheesecake.
Carefully remove the springform pan and place on a serving plate.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

75b28019b4.gt:
Heat oil in medium skillet on medium-high heat.
Add chicken; cook 7 min.
on each side or until cooked through (170F).
Meanwhile, prepare Dinner as directed on package, substituting large skillet for the saucepan.
Add tomatoes, onions and parsley to prepared dinner; mix lightly.
Top with the chicken.
75b28019b4.pred:
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Add the Macaroni and Cheese Dinner to the skillet and stir to coat with oil.
Add the tomatoes and green onions and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Return the chicken to the skillet and stir to combine.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

b69844d37b.gt:
Chill 4 Martini glasses in freezer 30 minutes.
Combine all liquors in cocktail shaker; add ice cubes and shake to chill.
Strain mixture into cold glasses.
Garnish each with orange peel strip.
b69844d37b.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake well.
Strain into a chilled coupe.
Garnish with an orange twist.

522f19c745.gt:
Place flat bread or shell on 14 inch pizza pan (or lightly grease a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Unroll the pizza dough onto the greased pan, using your hands to press the dough into a 14x 9 inch rectangle, build up the edges slightly.
Bake pizza dough in a 425F oven for 5 minutes.
remove from oven).
In a mixing bowl combine chicken and barbecue sauce, toss to coat.
Spread chicken mixture evenly over pizza crust.
Sprinkle with cheese and chopped spinach.
Bake in a 425F oven for 10 minutes or until crust edge is lightly browned.
Cut flat bread or bread shell into wedges (or cut rectangular pizza into squares.
522f19c745.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
Spread sauce evenly over crust.
Top with chicken, cheese and spinach.
Bake for 10-15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

5a55d2d191.gt:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C).
Line a baking sheet with paper towels.
Fill a bowl with lightly-salted water.
Rinse the grated sweet potato in the water, and drain into a sieve.
Pat the grated sweet potato dry with a cloth or paper towels, then place into a bowl.
Squeeze excess moisture from the grated onion, and place into the bowl with the sweet potato.
Stir the eggs and pepper into the mixture until well combined.
Heat the olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat until it shimmers, and spoon about 1 heaping tablespoon of the potato mixture per patty into the hot oil.
Flatten the patties with a fork, and fry until golden brown and crisp on the bottom, 5 to 8 minutes.
Flip and cook on the other side, sprinkle with salt, then set the cooked patties aside on the prepared baking sheet in the preheated oven while you finish cooking the latkes.
Stir the potato mixture before cooking each batch of patties.
Serve hot with applesauce and yogurt.
5a55d2d191.pred:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees F.
Place the grated sweet potato in a bowl.
Add the onion, eggs, black pepper, olive oil, and salt.
Mix well.
Form the mixture into 6 patties.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add the patties and cook until golden brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side.
Serve with applesauce and yogurt.

9001c0cfc6.gt:
FRIED POUNDED PASTE FOR BASE
in pan with oil saute pounded paste till fragrant and lightly but not burn then drain excess oil
MAKE THAI CURRY NOODLE
in pan with 1 tbsp of oil saute thai red curry paste for half minute then add fried pounded paste with water and bring to a boil
put flat udon noodle and simmer for 13 minutes and add dash of fish sauce or light soy sauce then stir often to prevent burn bottom and sauce start thickening
add tomato and off heat
serve thai curry udon noodle with eggs
9001c0cfc6.pred:
In a large pot, bring water to a boil.
Add the egg and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the flat udon noodles and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the tomato and cook for 1 minute.
Add the fish sauce or soy sauce and brown sugar.
Add the thai red curry paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the pounded garlic and shallot and cook for 1 minute.
Add the pounded dried prawn and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve with a side of steamed rice.

b9d49b2792.gt:
Marinade lamb in lemon juice, oil, garlic and chopped rosemary for at least an hour.
Combine lemon, onion, garlic and rosemary sprigs in a baking dish and place lamb rack with marinade on top.
Bake at 180 C for 35-40 mins or until cooked to your preference.
Remove lamb to a plate & keep warm.
Discard pan ingredients but reserve pan juices.
Heat pan juices and blend in flour.
Cook for 1 minute.
Gradually blend in stock and wine until smooth.
Cook stirring until sauce boils and thickens, Season to taste.
Serve roast, sliced into cutlets with sauce and vegetables of your choice.
b9d49b2792.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place lamb rack in a roasting pan.
Combine lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, rosemary, and 1/2 teaspoon salt and pepper in a small bowl.
Brush lamb rack with half of the marinade.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Remove lamb rack from marinade and brush with remaining marinade.
Place lamb rack in the roasting pan and roast for 1 hour.
Turn lamb rack over and roast for 1 hour more.
Remove lamb rack from pan and let rest for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, until golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Add stock, wine, rosemary sprig, and remaining salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer until thickened, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice.
Slice lamb rack and serve with sauce.

aaf069b0ba.gt:
Prepare coffee T DISC in mug or large heatproof glass.
Add brown sugar and light cream; stir.
Top with thawed whipped topping and a light sprinkling of ground cinnamon.
Add cinnamon stick.

bfebd12211.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with foil (enough to go up the sides) then spray the foil with cooking spray.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat butter until smooth and creamy.
Add the sugars and salt and beat until well incorporated.
Beat in the egg and vanilla extract until smooth.
With the mixer on low speed, slowly add the flour, baking powder, and baking soda, stirring until incorporated.
The mixture will be thick.
Scoop the mixture into the prepared pan and use your fingers to press it into an even layer.
Bake in the preheated oven for 22 minutes, or until golden, puffed, and slightly cracked.
Remove the cookie layer from the oven and immediately spread the chopped chocolate evenly over the top.
Return to the oven for 2-3 minutes or until chocolate begins to melt.
Remove from the oven and use a spatula to smooth the chocolate over the top.
Cover the chocolate with the chips and marshmallows (or other toppings like toasted coconut or chopped nuts, peppermints, or other candies) and gently press them into the chocolate.
Allow bars to cool, then use the foil to pull them from the pan.
Slice and serve.
Recipe adapted from Bon Appetit.
bfebd12211.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugars with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy.
Add the egg and vanilla and beat until combined.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Stir in the chocolate and topping.
Spread the batter evenly into the prepared baking dish.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack.
Cut into squares and serve.

d3a8a169dd.gt:
For crust, preheat oven to 275F; crumble ingredients together until well mixed; Press into a greased 9x13 pan and bake in a slow oven (275F) for 8 minutes; increase temp to 375F and top with second mixture and continue baking.
For topping: Mix all ingredients well; spread mixture over the partially baked crust and continue baking in a moderate oven (375F) until well set and slightly browned, about 30 minutes; cool and cut into squares.
d3a8a169dd.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease a 9x13 pan.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add flour, brown sugar, coconut, and walnuts; mix well.
Beat in eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Stir in baking powder.
Spread batter in prepared pan.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.
Cut into squares.

75465ac6f9.gt:
Heat grill to medium-high heat.
Toss meat with 2 Tbsp.
A.1.
; let stand 10 min.
Meanwhile, mix remaining A.1., barbecue sauce and mustard until blended.
Thread meat onto 8 skewers.
Grill 6 min.
or until meat is done, turning after 3 min.
and brushing occasionally with barbecue sauce mixture.
75465ac6f9.pred:
Heat grill to medium heat.
Place beef on skewers.
Brush with 1/4 cup A.1.
Grill for 3-4 minutes on each side.
Turn skewers and brush with 1/4 cup KRAFT Original Barbecue Sauce.
Grill for 2-3 minutes on each side.
Turn skewers and brush with 1/4 cup GREY POUPON Dijon Mustard.
Grill for 1-2 minutes on each side.
Serve hot.

4ecdf46b58.gt:
Heat frying pan and fry bacon until lightly browned
Spoon baked beans onto base of muffin halves, top with cooked bacon and squirt tomato sauce on bacon if you wish and top each muffin with cheese
Place muffins under grill and cook for a few minutes until cheese has melted
4ecdf46b58.pred:
Preheat oven to 200C/400F.
Place English muffin halves on a baking sheet.
Top each with a slice of bacon, cheese, and baked beans.
Drizzle with tomato sauce.
Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve with a side salad.

c3ac924e63.gt:
Light a grill.
Shape the meat into 4 patties and season on both sides with salt and pepper.
Wrap each hamburger with 2 slices of pancetta.
Grill the burgers over a medium-hot fire for about 4 minutes, or until nicely browned on the bottom.
Flip the burgers and top them with the Gorgonzola.
Grill for about 4 minutes longer, or until nicely browned and cooked through.
Meanwhile, brush the cut sides of the buns with the butter and grill them, cut side down, until lightly toasted.
Set the burgers on the bun bottoms and top with the lettuce, tomato and onion.
Serve at once.
c3ac924e63.pred:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the ground sirloin, salt and pepper.
Form into 4 patties.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the pancetta and cook until crisp, about 3 minutes.
Remove the pancetta from the skillet and drain on paper towels.
Add the burgers to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side.
Remove the burgers from the skillet and place on a plate.
Top each burger with 1 1/2 ounces of Gorgonzola cheese.
Place the burgers under the broiler until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 1 minute.
Place the burgers on the buns and top with lettuce, tomato and onion.

68d4e3063b.gt:
Preheat oven to 400F
Clean wing sections, salt and pepper, I stay light on the salt because the sauce adds some also.
Spread wings out on baking sheet, place in preheated oven for about 45 minutes.
About 5 minutes before the wings are done, in a small container (I use a coffee mug) mix the sauce ingredients.
I put a little sauce in a big enough bowl to hold the wings and mix them.
Add about 1/3 wings, about 1/3 sauce, same thing twice more.
I find that just makes it easier to evenly coat the wings.
If you want to add a little chart to the coating, you can broil the wings for a minute per side, keep an eye on them do you don't over do it.
My daughter does not like it that way, so we skip this step when she is home.
Serve immediately.
68d4e3063b.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the wing sections, pepper, salt, sesame oil, soy sauce, ranch dressing, and BBQ sauce.
Mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with foil.
Place the wings on the baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes.
Turn the wings over and bake for 30 more minutes.
Serve with ranch dressing.

d070cb5476.gt:
In a small bowl, mix together rosemary, thyme, marjoram, salt, and pepper.
Rub herb mixture over tenderloin.
Place in a container, and pour hard cider over roast.
Add water until pork is completely submerged.
Cover, and refrigerate 6 to 8 hours, or overnight.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Place roast in a roasting pan, elevated from the bottom, and pour marinade around the meat.
Bake for 1 hour in preheated oven.
In a large bowl, mix apples and onion.
Put mixture around and on top of roast.
Spoon brown sugar over entire pan evenly.
Place roast back into oven, and continue to cook for 1 hour more, or until meat reaches 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
Transfer roast, apples, and onion to a serving platter.
For the gravy, brown flour in a skillet.
Pour the marinade/drippings mixture into the skillet.
Stir in syrup.
Cook and stir over high heat until liquid has thickened to desired consistency.
Slice roast, and serve with gravy.
d070cb5476.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine the dried rosemary, thyme, marjoram, salt and pepper.
Rub the pork tenderloin with the spice mixture.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the pork and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Transfer the pork to a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, combine the brown sugar, flour, and maple syrup.
Cook over medium heat, stirring, until the sugar dissolves.
Add the apples and onion to the saucepan and cook until the apples are tender, about 5 minutes.
Pour the sauce over the pork and bake for 10 minutes more.
Serve hot.

7384993dda.gt:
Mix gin, rum, vodka, tequila, triple sec, Midori, blue curacao and sour mix together.
Shake well and pour into Hurricane glass.
Then add a splash of 7-up to the top and serve.
7384993dda.pred:
Mix all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice.
Strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lemon wheel.

0fa7e0e5ac.gt:
In a large bowl, whip heavy whipping cream until firm peaks form.
Spoon into a separate bowl and set aside.
In the same bowl you just whipped the cream in, stir pumpkin, ricotta, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla together.
Scrape sides and whip 1 minute.
Carefully fold in whipped cream.
Spoon or pipe into sugar cones and top with chocolate chips and walnuts.
Serve.
0fa7e0e5ac.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the pumpkin, ricotta, and cream.
In a separate bowl, mix the sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla extract.
Add the pumpkin mixture to the sugar mixture and mix well.
Place 1/2 cup of the pumpkin mixture into each of the 18 sugar cones.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the cones are golden brown.
Remove from oven and cool.
In a small bowl, melt the chocolate chips and walnuts.
Drizzle the chocolate mixture over the cooled cones.

c78e924f69.gt:
Whisk mayonnaise, yogurt, vinegar and crushed red pepper to taste in a medium bowl.
Add pineapple and coleslaw mix and stir to combine.
Place cornmeal in a shallow dish.
Sprinkle both sides of fish with Cajun seasoning and salt.
Dredge the fish in the cornmeal.
Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add half the fish and cook until golden, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate and repeat with the remaining 2 teaspoons oil and fish, adjusting heat as needed to prevent burning.
Top toasted bread with the fish and pineapple slaw to make sandwiches.
Serve immediately.
c78e924f69.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Combine mayonnaise, yogurt, vinegar, pepper flakes, pineapple, and coleslaw mix in a large bowl.
Season fish with cajun seasoning and salt.
Heat 2 teaspoons of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add fish and cook 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Transfer fish to a baking sheet and bake 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, toast bread or buns.
To assemble sandwiches, spread 1 teaspoon of the remaining oil on the bottom of each bun.
Fill buns with fish, pineapple slaw, and top with the remaining bun.
Serve immediately.

35d5f29f3c.gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Meanwhile, saute onion in the olive oil, along with the dried basil.
Saute over medium heat and stir frequently so the basil does not burn.
Cook until onions are tender and translucent.
Add salt to taste.
When pasta is done, drain and add onion basil mixture.
Add cheese and toss to coat.
Serve warm.
Add salt to taste if needed.
35d5f29f3c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large saucepan, cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add basil and cook 1 minute.
Add cheese and stir until melted.
Add pasta and toss to coat.
Transfer to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake 15 minutes, or until heated through.

3af2ae11f5.gt:
Combine salt, pepper, chili powder and bay leaves.
Rub meat completely with liquid Smoke.
Place meat, fat side up, in a large roasting pan.
Sprinkle dry seasoning mixture on top.
Cover tightly.
Bake for 3 1/2 to 4 hours at 325 degrees.
Scrape seasoning off meat and cut in very thin slices across the grain.
Serve with barbecue sauce.
To make sauce, combine all ingredients.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Cook for 10 minutes.
Serve with sliced brisket.
3af2ae11f5.pred:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the salt, pepper, chili powder, bay leaf, liquid smoke, and catsup.
Place the beef brisket in a roasting pan and rub the seasoning mixture all over the meat.
Cover the pan with foil and place in the oven.
Roast for 3 hours, or until the meat is tender.
Remove the brisket from the oven and let it rest for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, combine the brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, celery seeds, and cayenne pepper.
Stir in the butter and bring to a boil.
Pour the sauce over the meat and serve.

f44011121d.gt:
In a large enameled cast-iron casserole, heat the oil until shimmering.
Add the onion, garlic, ginger and chiles and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the curry powder and turmeric and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the broth and coconut milk and season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the potatoes and cook over moderate heat until barely tender, 5 minutes.
Add the cauliflower and squash, cover partially and cook over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, 15 minutes.
Add the chicken to the casserole, season with salt and pepper and cook just until white throughout, about 5 minutes.
Serve over rice, with lemon wedges.
f44011121d.pred:
In a large, deep skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring, until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the ginger and chiles and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Add the curry powder, turmeric, chicken broth, coconut milk, salt and pepper and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Add the potatoes, cauliflower, squash and simmer until the vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Serve over rice and garnish with lemon wedges.

8afb34ca7c.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Quarter the large strawberries and halve the smaller ones.
Place the strawberries in a 9-inch pie plate or 8x8 baking dish.
Sprinkle the sugar over the strawberries and toss several times.
Roast the strawberries for 15-20 minutes, stirring once during the baking time.
The strawberries are done when they have softened and the juices are thick and bubbly.
Cool completely and store in the fridge.
8afb34ca7c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place strawberries in a shallow baking dish.
In a small bowl, combine sugar and 1 tablespoon water.
Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Pour sugar mixture over strawberries.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and stir.
Bake for another 15 minutes.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

c33ce732c6.gt:
Add a pinch of salt to a pot of boiling water.
Cut the broccoli into small florets and boil for 40 seconds to a minute!
* Do not over boil and drain in a sieve.
Finely chop the bacon and garlic.
Pour a generous amount of oil into a pan and fry the bacon until it is brown and crispy.
Add the garlic.
When the garlic is fragrant, add the broccoli.
Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste.
Allow the flavours to blend and it's done!
c33ce732c6.pred:
In a large skillet, heat olive oil (or vegetable oil) over medium heat.
Add the broccoli, and cook for 5 minutes, or until it is tender.
Add the bacon and garlic, and cook for 2 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.

92214874b7.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Cook lasagna in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 8 minutes.
Drain.
Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; stir cream cheese into hot butter until it begins to melt, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt, onion powder, and black pepper.
Whisk warm milk gradually into cream cheese until smooth; stir in 1 1/2 cup Swiss cheese.
Bring sauce to a simmer, stirring constantly, until cheese has melted and sauce has thickened, 5 to 10 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Spread 3/4 cup of cheese sauce into bottom of a 9x9-inch baking dish.
Arrange 1/3 of the lasagna noodles over the sauce and spread half the cooked chicken and half the ham over the noodles.
Pour 1 cup sauce over chicken and ham.
Repeat layers starting with half the remaining lasagna noodles, remaining chicken, remaining ham, and 1 more cup of cheese sauce.
Finish by layering remaining lasagna noodles, remaining sauce, 1/2 cup Swiss cheese, and bread crumbs; sprinkle top with Italian seasoning.
Cover dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is bubbling, about 25 minutes.
Remove foil and continue to bake until crumbs are browned, about 10 more minutes.
Let casserole stand 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
92214874b7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the noodles, butter, cream cheese, salt, onion powder, and black pepper.
Spread 1/2 cup of the noodle mixture in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Layer 1/2 of the chicken, 1/2 of the ham, 1/2 cup of the Swiss cheese, and 1/2 cup of the bread crumbs.
Repeat with remaining noodle mixture, chicken, ham, Swiss cheese, and bread crumbs.
Pour the warm milk over the top.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

24452e5a07.gt:
Stir the cream cheese, sour cream, jalapeno pepper, salsa verde, red salsa, onion, lime juice, and chili powder seasoning together in a bowl until well blended.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
24452e5a07.pred:
In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, jalapeno pepper, salsa verde, red salsa, onion, and lime juice.
Mix well.
Season with the chili powder.
Serve with tortilla chips.

a0e261ef2d.gt:
Stir liquid soap into baking soda.
Add the water, and stir to be as smooth as possible.
Add the vinegar and stir again.
Pour into a squeeze bottle.
(A clean, empty ketchup or syrup bottle works well.)
Shake well before using, and keep tightly closed between uses.
a0e261ef2d.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Stir until the baking soda and vinegar are completely dissolved.
Store in a tightly sealed container.
Use 1/4 cup of the mixture per load.
Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.
Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.
Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.
Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.
Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.

Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.
Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.

Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.

Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.
