Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.
Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.
Add 1/4 cup of the mixture to your laundry washer.
Add 1/4 cup of the

43d8c95718.gt:
Brew coffee using a ratio of about 1 1/2 tablespoons coffee per cup of water.
(We used a single brew coffee maker and used the espresso strength setting that uses less water and brews a stronger coffee.)
Set the coffee aside to reach room temperature or place it in the refrigerator for 10-15 minutes to cool quickly.
Add the room temperature coffee, creamer, raspberry and hazelnut syrups, and the ice into a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour the drink into a tall glass and enjoy!
Optional garnishes: top with whipped cream, shaved chocolate, mint leaves and a raspberry.
43d8c95718.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour into a tall glass and enjoy!

a87b593bc7.gt:
Set oven to 325 degrees.
Prepare an ungreased 10-inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking powder and salt, then sift one more time, then beat in oil, egg YOLKS, 1/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons lemon juice, water and lemon peel with an electric mixer at low speed for about 3 minutes.
In a large dry copper or stainless steel bowl beat the room temperature egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff but not dry.
Fold in about 1/4 of the whites into the batter to lighten, the gently fold in the remaining whites.
Pour the batter into the ungreased tube pan.
Tap on the counter to release any air pockets.
Bake for about 1-1/4 hours, or until the cake is springy to the touch.
Immediately invert cake in pan over neck of a bottle (I use an empty beer bottle for this).
Cool the cake completely while inverted.
Remove the cake from the bottle and place on the counter.
Run a knife around the edges of the pan to loosen cake.
Transfer the cake to a serving plate.
Dust with powdered sugar.
a87b593bc7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease and flour 2 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large bowl, combine cake flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and lemon peel.
In a separate bowl, beat eggs and lemon juice.
Add water and oil to egg mixture and beat well.
Add to dry ingredients and mix well.
Pour into prepared pans and bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes.
Remove from pans and cool completely on a wire rack.
For the frosting, beat cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar and lemon juice until light and fluffy.
Frost cake and serve.

96679eee56.gt:
Blend four, 1 cup sugar, 3 tbsp melted butter, and milk until smooth.
Pour into greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish.
Pour fruit on top of batter.
Sprinkle remaining sugar on top.
Dot with remaining butter.
Bake on 375 for 45 min or until golden brown on top.
NOTE: If using fresh fruit, boil fruit with 1/4 cup water and 1 tbsp sugar until water is reduced to a syrup.
96679eee56.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt.
Add the milk and stir until smooth.
Cover and let stand for 10 minutes.
In a 9x13 inch baking dish, layer the peaches in the bottom.
Pour the batter over the peaches.
Bake for 45 minutes or until the cobbler is golden brown.
Serve warm.

b4e6dfe29e.gt:
Place all shake ingredients in a blender in the order listed.
Blend until it's as smooth as you like it.
Pour into a large parfait glass.
Top with whipped cream, sprinkle with chocolate sprinkles, green colored sugar, then place the cherry on top.
Insert a long-handled (parfait) spoon, two straws, and a candy cane.
Serve cuddled by the fireside listening to your favorite Christmas carols and watching your holiday tree glisten.
Just like two turtle doves.
Enjoy!
b4e6dfe29e.pred:
In a blender, combine the milk, ice cream, chocolate chips, Oreo cookies, Baileys Irish Cream, sugar, chocolate sprinkles, and maraschino cherry.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and garnish with a candy cane.

024ad1d04e.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, whisk all dry ingredients together to combine.
Form a well in the middle of the dry ingredients.
Measure and pour the remaining wet ingredients into the well.
Slowly and gently mix the wet into the dry until just combined.
Scoop into 12 greased or paper-lined muffin tins.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted.
024ad1d04e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg.
In a separate bowl, mix together the brown sugar, oil, and applesauce.
Add the carrots and eggs to the sugar mixture and stir until just combined.
Pour the batter into the muffin cups and bake for 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.

bc714d6f9c.gt:
Heat oil in medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add onion; cook 2 to 3 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.
Add rice; cook 1 to 2 minutes more or until rice is browned lightly, stirring frequently.
Add broth, drained tomatoes, chili powder and cumin to saucepan; stir to combine.
Bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
bc714d6f9c.pred:
Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion; cook and stir 5 minutes or until tender.
Stir in rice; cook 5 minutes or until rice is opaque.
Add broth and tomatoes; bring to boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer 15 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Stir in chili powder and cumin; cook 1 minute.
Serve warm.

7e8b44a915.gt:
Mix chicken, carrots, broth, ginger root, brown sugar, soy sauce, allspice and pepper sauce in a 4-5 quart crock pot, slow cooker Cover and cook on low heat setting 7-9 hours or until veggies are tender and chicken is no longer pink in centre.
Mix cornstarch and reserved pineapple juice, gradually stir into chicken mixture.
Stir in pineapple and bell pepper.
Cover and cook on high heat setting about 15 minutes longer or until slightly thickened and bubbly.
7e8b44a915.pred:
In a large skillet, brown chicken in 1 tablespoon oil.
Remove chicken from skillet; set aside.
Add remaining oil to skillet.
Add carrots, gingerroot, brown sugar, soy sauce, allspice, red pepper sauce, and cornstarch.
Stir and cook until carrots are tender.
Add chicken and pineapple; stir.
Add chicken broth; bring to a boil.
Cover and cook in a crock pot on low for 6-8 hours or until chicken is tender.
Remove chicken and vegetables from crock pot; set aside.
Stir together reserved pineapple juice and cornstarch.
Add juice mixture to crock pot; stir.
Cook on high for 15 minutes or until thickened.
Serve over rice.

27f4409414.gt:
In a large bowl, combine chicken broth with 3 cups ice.
Add chicken; chill 1 hour.
Meanwhile, in a resealable bag, combine bread crumbs, flour, salt, cayenne, oregano, garlic, parsley, and pepper; shake.
Preheat oven to 400F Coat a large baking sheet with vegetable or olive oil spray; set aside.
Place yogurt in a medium bowl.
Remove chicken from broth.
One piece at a time, dip chicken into yogurt, then place in bread crumb mixture and shake.
Place breaded chicken on baking sheet.
Spray tops of chicken with vegetable spray.
Bake 45 to 50 minutes, until golden brown.
Serve hot or at room temperature.
27f4409414.pred:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the chicken broth, chicken, panko breadcrumbs, flour, salt, cayenne pepper, oregano, garlic, parsley, and pepper.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium-high heat.
Form the chicken mixture into 4 patties, each about 3/4 inch thick.
Fry the chicken patties in the skillet until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
Transfer the chicken to a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven until cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil and the yogurt.
Serve the chicken with the yogurt sauce.

1156557bd2.gt:
To make vinaigrette, whisk together mustard, vinegar, and 1 tablespoon oil in a medium bowl.
Season with salt and pepper.
Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add asparagus, and season with salt and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium-low.
Cook, stirring frequently, until asparagus are just tender, 10-12 minutes.
(If the spears begin to brown, reduce heat to low.
).
Transfer aspargus to serving dish.
Drizzle with the vinaigrette, toss, and serve immediately.
1156557bd2.pred:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
In a small bowl, whisk together the mustard and vinegar.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the asparagus and cook, stirring occasionally, until it is just tender, about 3 minutes.
Transfer the asparagus to a baking sheet and roast in the oven until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in the skillet over medium heat.
Add the mustard mixture and cook, stirring, until the vinaigrette is reduced to a glaze, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve the asparagus warm, drizzled with the glaze.

af2aa1a2fd.gt:
Heat a skillet over medium heat.
Cook sausages in hot skillet, turning regularly, until no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).
Transfer to a cutting board and slice.
Heat olive oil in a separate skillet over medium heat.
Cook and stir onion, bell pepper, and garlic in hot oil until tender, about 5 minutes; season with red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper and cook 1 minute more.
Add sliced sausage, crushed tomatoes, and sliced zucchini; bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and continue cooking until the zucchini is tender, about 10 minutes.
af2aa1a2fd.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion and green pepper; saute 3 minutes.
Add sausage and garlic; cook 5 minutes or until sausage is browned.
Stir in tomatoes, salt, and pepper; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low; simmer 10 minutes.
Add zucchini; cook 5 minutes or until zucchini is tender.
Transfer to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, 20 minutes.

dcc524d157.gt:
Brown hamburger and onions in the oil.
Combine all other ingredients in the crockpot (Except for the cheese)
Cover and cook 1 hour on high then turn your crockpot to low and cook for an additional 4 hours.
When finished cooking sprinkle the cheese on top and let sit in the cooker for about 5-10 more minutes until its all melted through.
dcc524d157.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat.
Drain fat.
Add onion and cook until tender.
Stir in spaghetti sauce, macaroni, corn, beef broth, salt, pepper, chili powder, brown sugar, and cheese.
Transfer to a crock pot and cook on low for 6-8 hours.

b305dd0b36.gt:
Combine and store in an air-tight container.
Notes: To make taco meat, brown 1 lb ground beef in skillet; drain.
Add seasoning mix and 3/4 cup of water.
Bring to a boil then reduce heat.
Simmer uncovered, 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
b305dd0b36.pred:
In a small bowl, mix together the flour, cornstarch, onion flakes, bouillon granules, garlic salt, cumin, paprika, chili powder, onion salt, cayenne pepper, and sugar.
Store in an airtight container.
To use, sprinkle a small amount of the seasoning mix on your taco meat or tofu, and then add your favorite taco ingredients.

d0702f3d7d.gt:
Put cole slaw mix into bowl.
Mix together the oil, vinegar, sugar, salt & pepper.
Pour over cole slaw mix.
Toast almonds on cookie sheet at 350 degrees for 5 minutes.
Put almonds and craisins into slaw mix and toss.
d0702f3d7d.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Stir well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve chilled.

449991b9b4.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix first 9 ingredients in large bowl until well blended.
Fill pepper halves with sausage mixture, dividing equally and mounding slightly.
Arrange in 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.
(Can be made 1 day ahead.
Cover; chill.)
Bake peppers uncovered until tops are browned and thermometer inserted into filling registers 165F, about 1 hour.
Transfer peppers to platter.
Garnish with rosemary sprigs and serve.
449991b9b4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook sausage, onion, and parsley over medium heat until sausage is no longer pink; drain.
Stir in breadcrumbs, egg, pepper, salt, and rosemary.
Stuff peppers with sausage mixture.
Place peppers in a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Bake, covered, for 1 hour or until peppers are tender.
Sprinkle with rosemary sprigs and serve.

52ceec4747.gt:
Combine all ingredients except tomatoes, in mixing bowl and whisk till combined.
Place tomatoes in zip top bag.
Pour mixture over tomatoes.
Seal and refrigerate for 6 hours.
Lay lettuce on serving platter.
Drain tomatoes and reserve marinade.
Place tomatoes on lettuce and serve marinade on the side for dipping.
52ceec4747.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, oil, vinegar, salt, basil, tarragon, pepper and let stand for 1 hour.
Serve on lettuce leaves.

5b23053aa4.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Combine flours, Splenda, cocoa, and baking soda.
Add bananas, yogurt, egg whites, vanilla, and 1/2 cup walnuts.
Stir.
Coat a 9" x 13" cake pan with cooking spray.
Pour batter into pan, spreading evenly.
Bake about 35 minutes.
Cool.
Raise oven to 375F.
Toast remaining 1/4 cup walnuts 6 minutes.
To make frosting, pour 1/4 cup milk into a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Stir in Splenda, cocoa, and cornstarch.
Slowly add remaining 3/4 cup milk and bring to a low boil, stirring continuously until thick.
Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla.
Cool and spread over cake.
Sprinkle walnuts over cake.
5b23053aa4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a 9-inch square baking pan with foil, extending foil over the sides.
Combine flours, Splenda, baking soda, cocoa, cornstarch, and salt in a large bowl.
In a small bowl, combine yogurt, egg whites, vanilla, and 1/4 cup Splenda.
Add wet ingredients to dry and stir until just combined.
Fold in walnuts.
Spray a 9-inch square baking pan with vegetable oil cooking spray.
Pour batter into pan and bake for 30 minutes.
Cool cake in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool completely.
Cut into 16 squares.

7106d13160.gt:
preheat oven to 350
cream together brown sugar, butter, milk and eggs
mix in bisquick
in pieces add bananas 1 at a time until incorporated
pour batter into greased bread pan or baking dish of choice (i use an 8x10 casserole because i dont have a bread pan)
bake at 350 for 45-55 minutes
remove from oven, cool for 5 minutes for easier removal from pan
7106d13160.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a greased 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

3182df418c.pred:
In a medium bowl, combine the watermelon, cucumbers, onions, cilantro, dressing, and chiles.
Mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

894be65c73.gt:
Heat oven to 425 degrees F.
Combine spices and brown sugar; rub on chicken.
Add chicken, onions and garlic to roasting pan sprayed with cooking spray.
Squeeze juice from lemon halves and combine with dressing; pour over chicken.
Add lemon halves to pan.
Bake chicken 30 min.
or until done (165 degrees F).
894be65c73.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place chicken in a roasting pan.
Sprinkle with paprika, curry powder, brown sugar, and garlic.
Place onion slices on top of chicken.
Sprinkle with lemon juice.
Pour dressing over chicken and onions.
Bake for 1 1/2 hours.
Serve with rice.

f37cddfed9.gt:
I've listed 1 rice cooker cup worth (before cooking) of rice, but use as much as you need depending on how much you need.
Incidentally, I filled a 880 ml and 500 ml capacity bento box (excluding the spaces for the sides) with 650 g of rice!
To prevent the rice from getting greasy, stir fry the ingredients with just a little oil (use anything you like).
Add the ketchup.
Stir fry while making sure you don't scorch it.
I think you will need about 2 tablespoons of ketchup per 1 rice cooker cup worth of rice (350 g when cooked).
Throw in the rice!
!
The rice will turn ketchup-colored.
Add the chicken soup stock granules to finish.
Add 1 tablespoon per 1 rice cooker cup worth of rice.
If you add too much ketchup, the rice will be soggy.
The ketchup will just lightly color the rice.
The chicken stock granules will flavor the rice.
Other dishes you could pack in your bento along with the rice is this mentsuyu katsudon (pork cutlets on rice with sauce).
The rice won't become soggy.
Make omurice with scrambled eggs.
f37cddfed9.pred:
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Add onion and saute until soft.
Add wiener sausages and cook until browned.
Add ketchup and chicken soup stock granules.
Add hot cooked rice and mixed frozen vegetables.
Stir until rice is heated through.
Serve with ketchup and chili sauce, if desired.

bbff2a5297.gt:
Clean the shrimp and pat dry.
Slice and toast the baguette.
Peel all the garlic and mince finely.
Add to a pan over medium low heat with the olive oil.
We have a clay pot from Spain, but any pan will work.
Keep stirring, allowing the garlic to sizzle lightly (you want to make sure not to burn the garlic) for a few minutes.
Add the paprika, salt and pepper, and stir.
Bring the heat up to medium and add the shrimp to the pan.
Let the shrimp cook for 90 seconds, flip, and add the white wine.
Let everything cook together for another 2 minutes, or until the shrimp is just cooked through.
Place shrimp on toasted bread, drizzle with garlic oil, and garnish with parsley.
bbff2a5297.pred:
Heat oven to 400F.
Place shrimp in a bowl, add olive oil, paprika, smoked paprika, salt, pepper, wine and parsley.
Toss to coat.
Place shrimp on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Serve with sliced baguette.

ae1b5ff73e.gt:
FOR SALSA: Place all the ingrediens in medium bowl and stir gently to combine.
Cover and set aside.
FOR SWEETCORN CAKES: Combine 2 cups of the corn, onion, eggs, cilantro, flour, baking powder, salt and pepper in a food processor.
Process until well mixed.
Add the remaining 1/2 cup corn into the mixture and mix well.
Heat a large skillet at medium heat and brush with oil.
Spoon 2 heaping tablespoons of the mixture for each corn cake onto griddle.
Cook each side for 1 to 2 minutes.
Cook in batches.
Keep the cooked corn cakes warm in a 200F preheated oven.
Serve with salsa.
Makes 15 cakes.
ae1b5ff73e.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the corn, avocado, cilantro, lime juice, green onions, hot sauce, salt and pepper.
In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt and pepper.
Add the flour mixture to the corn mixture and stir until combined.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Drop the batter by the tablespoonful into the skillet, flattening each cake with the back of a spoon.
Cook until the cakes are golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.
Transfer the cakes to a baking sheet and keep warm in the oven while you cook the remaining cakes.
Serve with Avocado Salsa.

e8b69ecf30.gt:
Combine flour, salt and ricotta; mix thoroughly.
Knead dough on lightly floured board until dough is smooth.
Set dough aside on corned of floured board.
Cut small pieces from dough and quickly roll dough into a "finger thin" roll, and cut into pieces about 1/2 inch long.
Flatten each piece gently with thumb and bring long sides together to form a hollow tube or shell shape.
Arrange the gnocchi on a lightly floured cloth or board, dust them lightly with flour.
After shaping all the dough, gently drop the gnocchi into a large pot of boiling, salted water.
Cook them about 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
When they rise to the surface, remove them from the pot with a strainer.
Place in a heated bowl.
Serve with your favorite pasta sauce and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
e8b69ecf30.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt.
Make a well in the center of the flour and add the ricotta cheese.
Using a fork, gradually work the flour into the ricotta until it forms a dough.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
Divide the dough into 4 equal pieces and roll each piece into a rope.
Cut each rope into 1-inch pieces.
Place the gnocchi on a lightly floured baking sheet and bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.
Serve with your favorite sauce.

a3f1abf485.gt:
Mix the Italian seasoning with 1 tsp olive oil and rub over chicken.
Refrigerate for 4-24 hours.
In a saucepan over medium-low heat add the tomatoes, 2 tsp olive oil, 2 tsp balsamic vinegar, and seasoning as desired.
In a large pan bring 6 cups of water to a boil and cook the pasta according the package directions.
Allow the tomatoes to simmer for 20 minutes, then add the mixed veggies and continue to simmer for another 10 minutes (I used a frozen blend).
Grill the chicken until an internal temp of 165 F is reached (approx.
7 minutes per side).
Pour the tomatoes over the pasta and top with a chicken breast.
a3f1abf485.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, Italian seasoning and salt and pepper.
Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour the marinade over them.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until cooked through.
Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to package directions.
Drain the pasta and return to the pot.
Add the diced tomatoes and vegetables and toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Serve the chicken breasts over the pasta and vegetables.

66d695cd65.gt:
For the butter: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Slice the head of garlic in half crosswise and place it on a sheet of aluminum foil.
Drizzle with the olive oil and wrap the foil around the garlic tightly to seal.
Roast for about 1 hour, until the garlic is soft and caramelized.
Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
Squeeze the garlic cloves into the bowl of a food processor with the butter and salt and blend until smooth.
For the steaks: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Stir together the pepper and salt in a shallow dish and press both sides of each steak into the mixture to coat.
Add the steaks to the pan and cook for 4 to 5 minutes per side, or until cooked to your liking.
Transfer to a cutting board and let steaks rest for 10 minutes.
Slice the steaks into thin slices and spoon the garlic butter over the top.
66d695cd65.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place the garlic head in a small bowl and drizzle with olive oil.
Cover with plastic wrap and microwave for 2 minutes.
Remove from microwave and let stand for 10 minutes.
Peel the garlic cloves and mash with a fork.
Place the garlic in a small bowl and add the butter.
Mash with a fork until the butter is incorporated.
Season with salt and pepper.
Place the steaks on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the steaks and cook for 5 minutes on each side.
Remove from the skillet and place on the baking sheet.
Spread the garlic butter on the steaks and sprinkle with the peppercorns.
Place the baking sheet in the oven and cook for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

1666f024c2.gt:
Toss pasta with mixed vegetables, chickpeas, artichokes, onions, parsley and olives in large bowl.
Whisk pasta sauce with oil, vinegar, mustard and garlic until blended.
Add to pasta mixture; toss until evenly coated.
Refrigerate 1 hour.
Spoon pasta mixture onto large platter; surround with tomatoes, cheese and salami.
1666f024c2.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the pasta, vegetables, chickpeas, artichoke hearts, green onions, parsley, black olives, tomato sauce, olive oil, vinegar, mustard, garlic, tomatoes, and provolone cheese.
Toss well.
Sprinkle salami strips over the top and serve.

107091523c.gt:
Put a large heavy baking sheet in middle of oven and preheat oven to 425F.
Bring piloncillo, water, zest, spices, and 1/8 teaspoon salt to a boil in a small heavy saucepan, covered, stirring occasionally until piloncillo has dissolved.
Remove lid and boil over medium-low heat until syrup is thickened and reduced to about 3/4 cup, 6 to 10 minutes.
Discard zest and cool syrup slightly.
Meanwhile, peel and core apples, then cut into 1/2-inch-wide wedges.
Toss apples with flour, then with syrup.
Roll out 1 piece of dough (keeping remaining piece chilled) on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 13-inch round, then fit into a 9-inch pie plate.
Trim edge, leaving a 1/2-inch overhang, and chill shell.
Roll out remaining piece of dough on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 16-by 11-inch rectangle.
Cut dough crosswise into 11 (1 1/4-inch-wide) strips.
Stir apple mixture, then spoon evenly into pie shell.
Weave a tight lattice pattern over pie with pastry strips.
Trim all strips flush with edge of pie plate.
Fold bottom crust up over edge of lattice and crimp.
Brush lattice (but not edge) with milk and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake pie on hot baking sheet 20 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 375F and bake until crust is golden and filling is bubbling, 50 to 60 minutes more.
Cool pie to warm or room temperature, about 1 1/2 hours.
107091523c.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Combine piloncillo and water in a small saucepan; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in orange zest, cinnamon, and allspice.
Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
Peel, core and slice apples.
Combine apples, flour and milk in a large bowl; toss to coat.
Roll out pastry dough on a lightly floured surface to a 12-inch round.
Place in a 9-inch pie plate.
Pour apple mixture into pastry shell.
Cover with top crust.
Seal edges.
Cut several slits in top crust to allow steam to escape.
Bake 30 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350 degrees F and bake 30 minutes longer, or until apples are tender.
Cool on a wire rack.
Serve with rum ice cream.

42aebc99ee.gt:
Chop strawberries.
Divide 260g (1 cup) vanilla yoghurt among four serving glasses.
Divide one-third of the strawberries among the glasses.
Sprinkle 2 tsp Milo over the strawberries in each glass.
Continue layering with 520g (2 cups) vanilla yoghurt, the remaining strawberries and 40g (1/3 cup) Milo.
Serve.
42aebc99ee.pred: Mix all ingredients together and pour into a sundae glass.

26e693a67f.gt:
Heat oven to 425F.
Spray pie pan with cooking spray.
Place crust in pan and crimp edges.
Toss apples with lemon juice.
Stir in sugars and flour.
Pour into prepared crust.
Mix sugar into oatmeal.
Cut margarine into oatmeal, I do this with my fingers, you can use two forks or pastry blender.
Sprinkle oatmeal mixture on apples.
Place in oven for about 25 minutes Then take out and place foil around edges and put back in oven for about 20 minutes more.
Allow to cool before serving at least 15 minutes.
26e693a67f.pred:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the pie crust, apples, lemon juice, sugar, flour, oatmeal, and spices.
Roll out the pie crust and place it in a 9-inch pie plate.
Pour the apple mixture into the pie crust.
Bake for 45 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the apples are tender.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

df541b69a3.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Coat baking sheet once with cooking spray.
Set aside.
Coat large skillet with cooking spray and place over low heat.
Add onion; cook, stirring often, until just softened, about 3 minutes.
Add garlic and stir 30 seconds.
Add soy meat, breaking it up with a wooden spoon.
Stir in tomatoes, roasted jalapeno, chili powder and cumin.
Mix well.
Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, stack tortillas, wrap in foil and bake until warm and pliable, 8 to 10 minutes.
(Alternatively, using tongs, heat each tortilla over an open flame.)
Place tortillas on work surface and spoon about 3/4 cup meat filling in center of each.
Fold in sides and roll up, jelly-roll style.
Place on prepared baking sheet, seam side down.
Bake until chimichangas are lightly browned, about 30 minutes.
Serve hot with salsa.
df541b69a3.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook onion and garlic in hot oil until onion is tender.
Add soy "meat", tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, chili powder, and cumin.
Cook and stir until heated through.
Remove from heat.
Spoon soy "meat" mixture into tortillas.
Fold in half and seal edges.
Place on baking sheet.
Bake 10 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve with Fresh Tomato Salsa.

856a830dc7.gt:
Soak cucumber in cold salted (1 tsp) water for 5 minutes.
Drain and squeeze well.
Bring the water to a boil, add beanstarch vermicelli and cook according to the directions on the package.
Cut into bite sized pieces.
Mix all ingredients and marinate.
856a830dc7.pred:
Combine all ingredients except the vermicelli in a bowl.
Marinate the vermicelli in the mixture for 30 minutes.
Drain and rinse the vermicelli.
Combine the vermicelli with the marinade and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

b65ea7e6a7.gt:
Boil the pasta according to the instructions on the package.
In a large frying pan, heat the oil and over a medium heat, soften the garlic.
After a couple of minutes, add the tomatoes, tomato puree and sugar, and leave to stew over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
Add the mascarpone and stir until it has melted into the sauce.
Add the parsley or basil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
When it is ready, drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the sauce.
Mix well and then serve.
b65ea7e6a7.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat the oil and add the garlic.
Cook over medium heat for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the tomato puree and sugar.
Stir in the mascarpone cheese and parsley.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook for 5 minutes.
Serve over the pasta.

0ac257a346.gt:
In large plastic bag, mix flour and salt.
Add flounder fillets and shake to coat with flour mixture.
In nonstick 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat, in 1 tablespoon hot salad oil, cook 2 flounder fillets 6 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork, turning fillets once with pancake turner.
Remove fillets to platter.
Repeat with remaining fillets.
Meanwhile, in small saucepan, heat sweet and sour cabbage.
To serve, with slotted spoon, spoon half of cabbage over fillets; top with diced cucumber.
Serve with remaining cabbage.
0ac257a346.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine flour and salt.
Dredge flounder fillets in flour mixture and shake off excess.
In a large skillet, heat salad oil over medium-high heat.
Add flounder fillets and cook until browned on both sides, about 2 minutes per side.
Remove fillets from skillet and place on a baking sheet.
Bake in oven for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine sweet and sour red cabbage and cucumber.
Serve flounder fillets with sweet and sour cabbage and cucumber salad.

2cf467b3f7.gt:
Season all sides of the beef with a fair amount of salt and pepper.
In a large Dutch oven, or other heavy pot that has a tight cover, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over moderately high heat.
Add the garlic and the beef to the pot, browning the meat on all sides, taking the time to get a nice crust on the outside.
Add the onion and allow to lightly brown, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the crushed tomatoes, plus 1 tomato can of water, spices, season with salt and pepper, to taste, and add enough water to cover the meat.
Bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer with a lid for 3 hours, or until the meat is fork tender.
Let meat cool some in the liquid.
Shred meat and place in store bought taco shells, make your own taco shells, or even roll up in warm flour tortillas.
Garnish with lettuce, cheese and chopped tomatoes--if desired.
2cf467b3f7.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large Dutch oven, brown the beef in the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Season the beef with salt and pepper.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, chile powder, cayenne, cumin, and bay leaves.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 2 hours.
Uncover and simmer for 30 minutes longer, or until the beef is tender.
Remove the bay leaves.
Serve with tortillas and toppings of your choice.

bf025fd805.gt:
Break up the chocolate bars into small pieces with your hands and put in a heat resistant bowl.
Microwave for 3-4 minutes to melt.
Add the vegetable oil.
Put the eggs and sugar in a food processor, then process for 2 to 3 minutes on full strength.
Add the yogurt to Step 2 and blend for 2 minutes.
Pour the mixture from Step 3 into a rice cooker bowl, sift in the combined ingredients.
Fold in with a rubber spatula, while turning the bowl.
When the batter is no more floury, place in the rice cooker and turn the switch!
Press "Cook" 2-3 times and let the batter bake through a couple cycles until a bamboo skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.
When it's done, remove the cake from the rice cooker bowl and cool on a cooling rack.
The cake comes right out of the bowl if you run a rubber spatula between the cake and bowl to loosen it.
You can eat it straight a way, but it tastes even better the next day.
It's also delicious decorated!
bf025fd805.pred:
Preheat oven to 180C.
Butter-Free Rice Cooker Chocolate Cake:
1.
Preheat oven to 180C.
2.
Grease a 20cm round cake tin with vegetable oil.
3.
In a bowl, mix together the cake flour, sugar, baking powder, and cocoa powder.
4.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, yogurt, and vegetable oil.
5.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
6.
Pour the batter into the prepared cake tin and bake for 30 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean.
7.
Allow the cake to cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
8.
To make the frosting, mix together the sugar and cocoa powder in a bowl.
Add the butter and mix until smooth.
9.
Spread the frosting over the top of the cake.

51cc9f173e.gt:
Mix the egg, sugar and shiro-dashi in a small bowl.
Place some oil in a heated frying pan and pour in the egg.
When it is half-cooked, move it over to one side of the frying pan, and shape it into a log.
Turn the heat to low.
When it is browned, flip it over and cook the other side.
Place the cooked egg onto cling film.
Wrap it up and fold over the edges.
Remove it from the cling film after about 2 minutes and slice.
51cc9f173e.pred:
Preheat the pan.
Add a little bit of oil to the pan.
Pour in the egg and let it cook for a few seconds.
Add the shiro-dashi and sugar.
Stir the egg mixture.
When the egg starts to set, pour in the vegetable oil.
Continue to stir until the egg mixture is thick and creamy.
Flip the tamagoyaki and cook on the other side.
When the tamagoyaki is cooked through, remove it from the pan and serve.

495600903f.gt:
Heat oven to 300 degrees F.
Place 2-L casserole dish in oven to warm.
Melt butter in large skillet on medium heat.
Add onions and garlic; cook 2 to 3 min.
or until crisp-tender, stirring frequently.
Add rice; cook and stir 2 min.
Stir in wine; cook and stir 1 min.
or until absorbed.
Add chicken and broth; stir.
Bring just to boil.
Spoon into warmed casserole dish; cover.
Bake 30 min.
or until rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
Add spinach; stir just until wilted.
Add cheese; stir until melted.
495600903f.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat.
Add onion and garlic; cook 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add rice; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add wine; cook until absorbed.
Add chicken; cook 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in broth, 1/2 cup at a time, until absorbed.
Add spinach; cook 1 minute, until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to prepared baking dish.
Bake 20 minutes, until chicken is cooked through and rice is tender.
Sprinkle with cheese; bake 5 minutes, until cheese is melted.

19f9c7d91d.gt:
Note for quick method of cooking sweet potatoes -- I put the sweet potatoes in a baking dish and add 1/4 cup of water.
Put a lid on and microwave for approximately 20 minutes.
After they have cooled, peel and mash.
Mix all 8 ingredients for sweet potato mixture.
Pour into a greased casserole dish.
Bake in a 350 degree oven for 35 minutes and see below for crunchy topping.
Mix all 4 ingredients for topping and sprinkle over potatoes.
Bake for an additional 8 minutes and remove from oven.
Enjoy!
19f9c7d91d.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix together the sugar, milk, egg, and spices.
Grease a 9x13 baking dish.
Spread the mashed sweet potatoes in the bottom of the dish.
Pour the sugar mixture over the sweet potatoes.
Sprinkle the crushed corn flakes and chopped nuts over the top.
Bake for 45 minutes.

9181bac2c8.gt:
Place the onion, parsley, vinegar, mustard, mayonnaise, honey, salt, pepper, and lime zest in the bowl of a small food processor or blender.
Process until thoroughly blended.
Serve immediately, or place in a covered container and refrigerate until needed.
9181bac2c8.pred:
In a small bowl, whisk together the onion, parsley, vinegar, mustard, mayonnaise, honey, lime zest, salt and pepper.
Whisk until the honey is dissolved.
Add the salad dressing to the salad and toss to coat.

b4fd5e004b.gt:
Drain the yogurt to 1 1/2 cups: Line a strainer w/a coffee filter, add yogurt & set aside about 1 hour.
Cut off all but 1 inch of the beet stalks and leave the roots intact.
Rinse the beets well but do not peel.
Cook the beets in boiling salted water until tender, 25 to 35 minutes.
Drain, slip off the skins under cold running water, and cut away the root ends and stalks.
Coarsely grate the beets, using the shredding disk of a food processor or the large holes of a hand grater (latex gloves are recommended for the latter or you'll look like an axe murderer!
).
Combine the garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a medium bowl.
Add the beets and yogurt and blend well.
Taste and add a pinch of sugar if desired.
Transfer to a serving dish, cover and refrigerate until well chilled, about 1 hour.
Garnish with sprigs of fresh mint just before serving.
b4fd5e004b.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the yogurt, beets, garlic, salt, lemon juice, pepper, sugar and mint.
Mix well.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Serve with a sprinkle of fresh mint.

aab95edcba.gt:
Pre heat oven to 160*C.
Peal and grated spuds.
Drain by pressing paper towel- as much water out as you can.
Add egg yolks, onion powder, paprika, garlic salt, oregano and pepper.
Mix and scoop onto cutlets to coat.
Shallow fry on med heat until golden brown both sides (2 or 3 mins a side) and finish in oven for 5 minutes.
Sea salt to taste- serve with lemon wedge, spicy sour cream and salad.
For cream, use some sour cream with horseradish - or Dijon.
Maybe some fresh chopped chives or parsley.. Whatever you like.
Bloody ripper of a dish.
Little bit of prep (I suggest you buy your lamb pre-frenched!)
but absolutely delicious.
Enjoy!
aab95edcba.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, egg yolk, onion powder, sweet paprika, dried oregano, garlic salt, cracked black pepper, and sea salt.
Mix well.
Form the mixture into 6 patties.
Heat the sunflower oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the patties and cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
Remove from the skillet and drain on paper towels.
To serve, place the lamb cutlets on a plate and drizzle with lemon juice.
Serve with a dollop of spicy sour cream and a sprinkle of sea salt flakes.

f4a5f6209b.gt:
preheat oven to 450F
mix together dry ingredients.
in a seperate bowl, mix wet.
slowly add the wet to the dry, and combine until just mixed.
roll out on a lightly floured surface, and use a cutter of choice to create shapes (i used the top of a drinking glass).
bake for about 15 minutes.
f4a5f6209b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the teff flour, amaranth flour, tapioca starch, cornstarch, baking powder, xanthan gum, and salt.
Stir in the vanilla extract and jam.
In a small bowl, whisk the soymilk and oil.
Add the soymilk mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until a dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes.
Roll out the dough to a 1/2-inch thickness and cut out biscuits with a 2 1/2-inch round cutter.
Place the biscuits on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve warm with strawberry-pineapple jam.

d255a02fb6.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease 24 muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners.
Whisk 3 cups flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl.
Stir white sugar, applesauce, and eggs together in another bowl.
Add sugar mixture to flour mixture and stir until batter is just combined.
Fold peaches and cranberries into batter.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
Stir brown sugar and 2 tablespoons flour together in a small bowl.
Sprinkle brown sugar mixture over the tops of the muffins.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 25 minutes.
Cool for 10 minutes before transferring muffins to a wire rack to cool completely.
d255a02fb6.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt.
In a medium bowl, combine sugar, applesauce, eggs, and peaches.
Add to dry ingredients and stir just until moistened.
Fold in cranberries.
Spoon batter into 12 greased muffin cups.
Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until tops are golden brown.

ce99fab83f.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Cream together butter, sugar, egg and vanilla extract until well combined.
Add flour, baking soda, and salt to mixture.
Fold in puffed rice cereal gently so as not to break up the puffs.
Incorporate chocolate chips.
Bake for 10 15 minutes.
ce99fab83f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar.
Add the egg and vanilla; mix well.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into the butter mixture.
Stir in the cereal and chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

c1e7a519f3.gt:
Place graham squares, side by side, in single layer in ungreased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Microwave caramels and water in microwavable bowl on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes or until caramels are completely melted, stirring after each minute.
Pour over grahams; spread to evenly cover graham squares.
Sprinkle immediately with marshmallows, chocolate and peanuts; press gently into caramel mixture with back of spoon to secure.
Cool completely.
Cut into 24 squares to serve.
c1e7a519f3.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine graham crackers, caramels, water and marshmallows.
Microwave on HIGH 1 minute; stir.
Microwave on HIGH 1 minute; stir.
Microwave on HIGH 1 minute; stir.
Spread into prepared pan.
Bake 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with peanuts.
Bake 5 minutes.
Cool completely.
Cut into bars.

9141916c8a.gt:
Cream butter and flour together, add to hot juice.
Stir quickly or use egg beater to smooth.
Cook until it thickens.
Heat milk until slight scum forms, lower heat, add tomato mixture slowly, stirring constantly.
Salt to taste.
Serve hot with buttered popcorn or crackers.
9141916c8a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add flour and stir until smooth.
Cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes.
Add milk, 1 cup at a time, stirring constantly until each cup is incorporated.
When all milk is added, bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in tomato juice.
Pour into a large bowl and let cool for 10 minutes.
Pour into a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour into a clean saucepan and heat over medium heat until hot.
Serve immediately.

4b78e53c53.gt:
In a bowl beat eggs and mix in all ingredients except beef.
Mix in beef and shape into six 1/2-inch patties.
Cook over medium heat, about 5 minutes per side.
Add cheese during the last 3 minutes of cooking.
4b78e53c53.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine egg, bread crumbs, salsa, green onions, red pepper, garlic, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and hot pepper sauce.
Form into 4 patties.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon of oil to the skillet.
Add patties and cook 4 minutes on each side or until browned.
Place patties on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Top each patty with 1 slice of cheese and bake for 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.

91e966c057.gt:
Wash, scrape and slice carrots into 1/4 inch thick rounds.
Bring water to a boil in a heavy saucepan.
Add carrots and garlic, cover, and cook about 15 minutes, or until tender (but still firm).
Drain carrots and place in serving bowl.
Mix remaining ingredients and pour over the carrots.
Toss, then cover with plastic wrap and set aside for about 30 minutes before serving at room temperature.
91e966c057.pred:
Combine carrots, water, garlic, paprika, cumin, olive oil, vinegar, parsley, salt and pepper in a large bowl.
Mix well, cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

608984ae45.gt:
Melt butter in 1-quart saucepan until sizzling; add onion.
Cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, 2-3 minutes or until softened.
Stir in flour, thyme and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium; stir in chicken broth and half & half.
Cook, stirring occasionally, 2-4 minutes or until smooth and bubbly.
Serve gravy over chicken, biscuits and/or potatoes.
608984ae45.pred:
In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute.
Add the chicken broth and whisk until smooth.
Add the half & half and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove from the heat and stir in the thyme.
Serve over your favorite dish.

b188749dcd.gt:
Combine fennel seeds, cumin seeds, caraway seeds, cracked wheat, butter or margarine, molasses or barley malt, and orange zest in 1 1/3 cup of boiling water.
Soak for 1 hour.
(This pre-soaks the cracked wheat and pre-releases the other flavors.)
Add seed mixture along with baking soda, whole wheat or rye flour, high-gluten bread flour, dry yeast, gluten, and buttermilk powder into the pan of a bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer.
Select the cycle for White Bread and the Light Crust setting.
Start.
b188749dcd.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the boiling water, fennel seed, cumin seeds, caraway seed, cracked wheat, butter, molasses, orange zest, baking soda, rye flour, bread flour, yeast, and gluten flour.
Stir until the ingredients are well combined.
Cover and let the dough rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until it has doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface.
Knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
Divide the dough into 2 equal pieces.
Shape each piece into a ball and place them into two 8-inch-square baking pans that have been coated with cooking spray.
Cover the pans with plastic wrap and let the dough rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until it has doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Bake the bread for 30 minutes, or until the loaves are golden brown and sound hollow when tapped.
Remove the bread from the pans and cool on a wire rack.

2989cc6886.gt:
Dredge the well drained oysters in some starch and toss them very gently in a bowl till the liquid turns dark.
Wash out the darkened liquid with cold water until the water becomes clear.
Drain well.
Place the oysters between paper towels and dry.
Coat the oysters lightly with some flour (not listed in the ingredients above).
Heat some salad oil in a non-stick frying pan, add garlic, stir fry till they become golden over medium heat.
Add oysters cook until golden.
Turn over, add the Sake and cover.
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes over low heat.
Add and melt the butter.
Add soy sauce and green onion and stir to coat the oysters with sauce.
Serve hot.
Washing oysters with starch to purify the taste is a method I learned from Chinese recipe while traditionalist Japanese chefs use graded Daikon radish juice.
Buttered ride recipe is available in my blog.
http://kcocoangela.blog132.fc2.com/blog-entry-6.html
2989cc6886.pred:
In a bowl, combine the oysters, starch, garlic, and green onion.
Mix well.
Heat the oil and butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
Add the oysters and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the sake or white wine and soy sauce and cook for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and serve.

50ae7ae60c.gt:
For this soup, I use 1/2 lb button, 1/4 lb cremini and 1/4 lb shitake mushrooms.
In a large pot, sautee mushrooms in olive oil until browned.
Add onions, carrots, celery and garlic and sautee until tender.
Add flour and thyme and cook for 3-4 mins until flour is cooked into the vegetables.
Add stock, bay leaf and rice and bring to a boil.
Simmer soup covered for 45-60 mins until rice is tender.
Add salt and pepper to taste and balsamic vinegar if desired.
50ae7ae60c.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion, carrots, celery, and garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms and thyme; cook, stirring occasionally, until mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir in flour; cook, stirring constantly, until flour is lightly browned, about 1 minute.
Add rice, stock, salt, and pepper; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender, about 45 minutes.
Remove bay leaf.
Stir in balsamic vinegar.
Serve hot.

2893fcfb35.gt:
Heat a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
Spray with nonstick cooking spray.
Add the diced onion and saute until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the diced apple and saute until tender, about 3 minutes.
Then remove from heat and set aside for the moment.
In a medium sized mixing bowl, melt the butter (you can do this in the microwave, heating for 30 seconds, stirring, then heating for additional 30 second increments if needed).
Then add the bread crumbs to the melted butter and toss to coat.
Into the bread crumb mixture, mix in the onion and apple.
Add the shredded cheese and mix to thoroughly combine.
Slice the pork chops lengthwise leaving about 1/2 an inch on one side still intact (you are basically making a pocket for the filling mixture).
Stuff pork chops with bread crumb mixture.
Secure the pork chops closed using toothpicks.
Spray each side of the pork chops with nonstick cooking spray and season with salt and pepper.
Grill the pork chops (or cook on a skillet) over medium to medium high heat until the juices run clear, about 20-25 minutes.
Remove from the grill and let rest about 5 minutes.
Remove toothpicks.
Serve and enjoy!
!
2893fcfb35.pred:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, combine bread crumbs, cheese, salt and pepper.
Dip pork chops in butter, then coat with bread crumb mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until pork chops are cooked through.
Serve with apples and onions.

615e73ba74.gt:
The best way to capture the elusive flavor of summertime.
Ben and Jerry prefer small peaches because they have more flavor and less water than the larger ones.
Combine the peaches, 1/2 cup of the sugar, and the lemon juice in a bowl.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours, stirring the mixture every 30 minutes.
Remove the peaches from the refrigerator and drain the juice into another bowl.
Return the peaches to the refrigerator.
Whisk the eggs in a mixing bowl until light and fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes.
Whisk in the remaining 3/4 cup sugar, a little at a time, then continue whisking until completely blended, about 1 minute more.
Pour in the cream and milk and whisk to blend.
Add the peach juice and blend.
Transfer the mixture to an ice cream maker and freeze following manufacturer's instructions.
After the ice cream stiffens (about 2 minutes before if is done) add the peaches, then continue freezing until the ice cream is ready.
Makes 1 generous quart.
615e73ba74.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Combine peaches, sugar, lemon juice, eggs, cream, milk and whipping cream in a large bowl.
Beat until smooth.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool completely.
Freeze for 2 hours.
Process in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions.
Serve immediately.

91eb1e20fb.gt:
Put the rice in a small sauce pan.
I like to rinse my rice by placing in a sieve and running under cold water.
This rids the rice of excess starch powder and broken rice which makes the cooked rice mushy and sticky.
Add just enough water to cover the top of the rice by 1/2 inch (approx.
3 cups) Cover the pot with the lid.
Place over medium to medium high heat and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low.
Simmer, covered, for at least another 10 minutes, until the water is completely absorbed.
Turn off burner and allow rice to sit, covered, for at least another 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with half of the salt and pepper and stir to fluff.
IN THE MEANTIME, sprinkle the fish with the rest of the salt and pepper, and dredge in flour.
Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add fish to pan; cook 2 1/2 minutes on each side (less for thinner filets) or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.
Add wine, juice, and capers to the pan; cook one minute.
Add butter to pan, stirring until butter melts.
Remove fish and sauce from pan; keep warm.
Wipe pan clean with paper towel, add spinach and saute one minute or until wilted.
Place 1/4 of the rice on each of 4 plates.
Top each serving with 1/4 of the spinach, one fish filet, and 1/4 of the sauce.
91eb1e20fb.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat coconut oil over medium-high heat.
Season halibut with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Add halibut to skillet and cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
Remove halibut from skillet and set aside.
Add flour to skillet and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add wine and cook until reduced by half, about 2 minutes.
Add lemon juice and capers and cook until liquid is reduced by half, about 2 minutes.
Add butter and stir until melted.
Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute.
Season with salt and pepper.
Place halibut on spinach mixture and spoon sauce over halibut.
Transfer skillet to oven and bake until fish is just cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Serve with rice.

89a10ab4d0.gt:
Soak chiles in hot water 15 min.
or until softened.
Drain chiles, reserving 1/4 cup of the soaking water; place chiles and reserved water in blender container.
Cover.
Blend on medium speed until smooth; set aside.
Heat dressing in large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add pork; cook and stir 5 min.
or until evenly browned.
Remove pork from skillet; set aside.
Add alcaparrado condiment, cloves and chile puree to skillet; cook 2 min.
Return pork to skillet.
Stir in broth; bring to boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat to medium-low; cover.
Simmer 30 min.
Add potatoes and peanuts; cover.
Cook 45 min.
until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally.
Top each serving with egg slices.
89a10ab4d0.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large saucepan, combine the dried guajillo chiles, hot water, and dressing.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 10 minutes.
Add the pork and alcaparrado condiment, and simmer 10 minutes.
Add the beef broth, potatoes, peanuts, and cloves.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 1 hour.
Add the eggs and simmer 10 minutes.

7bf3659a3a.gt:
Place tomatoes, onions, celery, parsley and bay leaves in a large pot and cook, covered, on low heat for 1 to 2 hours, until quite soft and fragrant.
Remove bay leaves and blend tomato mixture in batches in a food processor or blender, then run through a sieve and return juice to pot.
Stir in salt, sugar, seasoning salt, pepper and garlic salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cook, uncovered, 1 to 2 hours, until thickened.
7bf3659a3a.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine all ingredients except the salt and sugar.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes.
Strain through a sieve into a large bowl, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
Discard the solids.
Stir in the salt and sugar.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Serve hot.

25cf1f8952.gt:
Add the oil to the pan and put heat on to medium high.
Add the rice and saute until golden brown approximately 10 - 15 minutes.
Add the onion and bell pepper and saute another 5 - 10 minutes.
The important thing is to make sure the rice is toasted to a nice golden brown.
Using a garlic press, add the minced fresh garlic by squeezing the press and cutting off
the garlic as it comes out, with a knife.
Continue to saute for an additional 3 minutes.
You will notice a wonderful garlic aroma.
Add the tomato puree, chicken broth and salt.
Stir and turn heat up to high.
Bring to a full boil while stirring.
Continue to boil for 2 minutes.
Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
When it's done, turn off the heat, remove the lid and stir in the peas.
wait 5 minutes before serving.
25cf1f8952.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion and bell pepper and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree, salt, and broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add peas and cook for 10 minutes.
Stir in rice and cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.

f2251c8a98.gt:
Mix together ground pork, kosher salt, black pepper, sage, thyme, rosemary, nutmeg, cayenne pepper, and red pepper flakes in a bowl.
Knead with hands until thoroughly incorporated.
Form into 8 patties.
Place patties into a skillet over medium heat; cook until browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
Flip patties and continue to cook until fully cooked through, 5 to 8 more minutes.
f2251c8a98.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients.
Form into 4 patties.
Place patties on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.
Turn sausages over and bake for 10 minutes more.
Serve with eggs and toast.

7112e492e4.gt:
Heat oil and slowly cook onion, carrot and celery over medium heat for approx 8 min until soft.
Add zest of lemon and rice.
Stir.
Add chicken broth and boil on low for approx 20 min until vegetables are tender.
Add peas, chicken, lemon juice and parsley 5 minutes before serving.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
7112e492e4.pred:
In a large saucepan, saute onion in oil until tender.
Add carrots and celery and saute until tender.
Add chicken, rice, broth, peas, lemon zest, lemon juice, parsley and season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with a lemon wedge.

eb0fd599e7.gt:
Mix together all dry ingredients, then add the wet ingredients gradually and stir in until the consistency is like that of smooth thick cream
Heat a lightly oiled frying pan and spoon the batter in ladlefulls
Cook until bubbles form then start to pop then flip over and lightly brown the other side
You can change the vanilla for any other flavouring you like such as strawberry, add some cocoa powder and some orange essence for chocolate orange, add blueberries or chocolate chips to the batter, the possibilities are endless!
eb0fd599e7.pred:
Preheat oven to 200C.
Mix all ingredients together.
Heat a frying pan over medium heat.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into the pan.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface and edges are dry.
Flip and cook until golden brown.
Repeat with remaining batter.
Serve with maple syrup.

5e36bf8c5c.gt:
Preheat a nonstick skillet over medium-low heat.
In a bowl whisk together the eggs, cream and powdered sugar.
Set aside.
Take 2 slices of the Texas toast and spread 1 tablespoon of Nutella on each one.
Sandwich them together and dip both sides of the sandwich in the custard mixture.
Grill on each side until brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Remove from heat and serve immediately with maple syrup while you repeat with the other ingredients.
5e36bf8c5c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, heavy cream, and powdered sugar.
Slice Texas toast into 1/4-inch thick slices.
Dip each slice into the egg mixture, then place on a baking sheet.
Spread 1 tablespoon of Nutella on each slice.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm with Nutella sauce.

93fa251248.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
Whisk eggs, oil, and brown sugar together in a bowl until brown sugar is dissolved.
Combine oats, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a separate bowl; stir into egg mixture just until moistened.
Spoon oat mixture into prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.
93fa251248.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, oil, brown sugar, oats, baking powder, cinnamon and salt.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until golden brown and set.
Serve warm with your favorite toppings.

59d1144ae9.gt:
Pour 1 quart of hot water into a large saucepan, and dissolve the gelatin.
Allow to cool.
Pour the cooled gelatin into a large punch bowl.
Stir in: pineapple juice, orange juice concentrate, sugar, and 4 1/2 cups of cold water.
Just before serving, pour in the Ginger Ale.
59d1144ae9.pred:
In a large bowl, dissolve 1 package of lime gelatin in 1 quart of hot water.
Stir in 1 cup sugar, if desired.
Add 2 liters of ginger ale and stir.
Pour into a punch bowl and refrigerate until ready to serve.
To serve, pour 1/2 cup of the punch into each of 4 tall glasses.
Garnish with lime wedges and serve.

9c55f0ed34.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Toss first 4 ingredients in large baking dish.
Mix remaining ingredients; pour over vegetables.
Bake 50 min.
or until vegetables are tender.
9c55f0ed34.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Place vegetables in a large bowl and toss with dressing.
Spread vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until vegetables are tender and lightly browned.
Serve warm.

fc1f93e1ef.gt:
Preheat oven to 325F.
Crumble the ginger snaps in a food processor and add the melted butter.
Use this mixture to line a deep pie plate or spring form pan.
Bake this at 325F for 19 minutes.
Beat the egg yolks well, and add the sugar.
Soak the gelatin in the cold water and heat gently over low flame until fully dissolved.
Pour over sugar and egg mixture, stirring briskly.
Whip the cream until stiff.
Fold in the egg mixture and flavor with the rum.
Cool in the refrigerator until mixture begins to set and pour into the pie shell.
Chill until firm and garnish with chocolate curls and chopped nuts.
fc1f93e1ef.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, combine the ginger snaps and melted butter; mix well.
Press mixture into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool.
In a large bowl, beat egg yolks, sugar, and gelatin until thick and creamy.
Stir in the cold water.
In a small bowl, whisk the double cream until soft peaks form.
Fold the cream into the egg mixture.
Pour mixture into the crust.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool.
Stir in the rum.
Chill for 4 hours or overnight.
Garnish with chocolate curls and chopped nuts.

97692d5fc3.gt:
Spread tortilla with dressing and mustard; top with remaining ingredients.
Fold in opposite sides of tortilla, then roll up from one end, leaving top end open.
Place on microwaveable plate.
Microwave on HIGH 1 min.
or until heated through.
97692d5fc3.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Wrap ham and stuffing in tortilla.
Roll up.
Enjoy.

8dfa9a04cc.gt:
In shallow bowl, mix flour, egg, vanilla, milk, and lemon jce.
Dip rings to cover.
In deep skillet heat oil to about 375*.
Fry rings, in batches of 3 or 4 for 2 1/2 minutes or until golden brown.
Place on paper towels and dust with sugar on both sides.
8dfa9a04cc.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, egg, vanilla, and milk.
Stir until smooth.
Add lemon juice and mix well.
Place apple rings in a greased baking dish.
Pour batter over the apples.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until apples are tender.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Dip apple rings in the batter again, then fry in hot oil until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar.

00b1995e31.gt:
Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Season pork ribs with salt and pepper.
Working in two batches, sear the pork until light golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
As each batch of pork is seared, place it in the bottom of the crockpot.
Pour out all but 1 tablespoon of the drippings.
Add shallots and garlic to the pot.
Saute until the shallots are light golden brown.
Add tomato paste and cook until the paste becomes dark red, approximately 3 minutes.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, red wine, and fish sauce.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Pour the tomato sauce into the crockpot.
Add cannellini beans to the crockpot.
Cook on low heat for 6 to 8 hours, or until the pork is tender.
Remove the pork from the crockpot and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Return the pork to the crockpot and keep warm until ready to serve over rice or pasta (I use egg noodles).
Garnish with chopped fresh Italian parsley and grated Parmesan cheese.
00b1995e31.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add ribs and brown on all sides.
Transfer ribs to crockpot.
In same skillet, saute shallots, garlic, and tomato paste until softened.
Add tomatoes, wine, fish sauce, and beans.
Stir to combine.
Pour over ribs in crockpot.
Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours.
Remove ribs from crockpot and place on a platter.
Skim fat from sauce and serve over ribs.
Garnish with parsley.

723f2696fa.gt:
Preheat the broiler and position a rack 6 inches from the heat.
In a food processor, combine the ricotta with the 2 tablespoons of honey and puree until very smooth.
Arrange the figs cut side up on a rimmed baking sheet.
Dollop 2 teaspoons of the ricotta puree on each fig and lightly drizzle with honey.
Broil for about 2 minutes, until just browned in spots and the ricotta is barely melted; serve warm or at room temperature.
723f2696fa.pred:
Preheat broiler.
Place figs, cut side down, on a baking sheet.
Brush figs with honey.
Broil figs 3-4 inches from heat until the honey caramelizes and the figs are tender, about 3 minutes.
Serve figs with ricotta and drizzle with more honey.

d4da80f96c.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine 3/4 cup sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, cinnamon, cloves and salt.
Stir in milk, melted butter and vanilla, beating until smooth.
Pour batter into an ungreased 9-inch squre baking pan.
Stir together remaining 1/2 cup sugar, brown sugar, remaining 1/4 cup cocoa and cinnamon.
Sprinkle this evenly over batter in baking dish.
Combine hot water and rum; pour this over top of sugar-cocoa mixture in dish; do not stir.
Bake 35 to 40 minutes at 350 degrees F until center is almost set.
Remove from oven and let stand 15 minutes.
Serve, spooning sauce from bottom of pan over top.
Delicious with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream!
d4da80f96c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x13-inch pan.
In a large bowl, combine the sugar, flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, cinnamon, cloves and salt.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the milk, butter and vanilla.
Add the milk mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool completely.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, combine the sugar, cinnamon and rum.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves.
Pour the sauce over the cake and let cool completely.

6a483319ff.gt:
Wash the enoki mushrooms, cut off the stem ends and put on a plate.
Put a pat of butter (or margarine) on top.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Top with cheese (I used sliced cheese) and cover loosely with plastic wrap.
Microwave for about a minute and it's done.
Add a little soy sauce or ponzu sauce before eating.
Enjoy piping hot!
6a483319ff.pred:
Combine all ingredients except the butter in a microwave-safe bowl.
Microwave on high for 1 minute.
Add the butter and stir.
Microwave on high for 30 seconds.
Stir again.
Microwave on high for 1 minute.
Stir.
Microwave on high for 30 seconds.
Stir.
Microwave on high for 1 minute.
Stir.
Microwave on high for 30 seconds.
Stir.
Microwave on high for 1 minute.
Stir.

Stir.

Stir.

Stir.

Stir.

Stir.

Stir.
Microwave on high for 1 minute.
Stir.
Microwave on high for 30 seconds.
Stir.
