Bake at 350F for 35 to 40 minutes or until cream cheese mixture is lightly browned.
Cool; cut into squares.
Note: Do not use brownie mixes that include syrup pouch.
91d53e8b2a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 9x13 inch pan.
Mix brownie mix, cream cheese, sugar, egg and vanilla in a bowl.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool completely.
Cut into bars.

7a6c6f2959.gt:
Dressing:.
Place the almonds and water into a blender or food proccesor and turn on high speed to puree.
Add remaining ingredients, except for oil, and run to blend and whip thoroughly.
With the motor running, slowly pour in oil and run until the dressing is thick and creamy.
(dressing can be prepared and refrigerated for up to 1 week.
).
As stated in the description, you may use 3/4 cup oil and 1/4 cup water or apple juice(or liquid of choice) and get a little thinner dressing.
Let sit for a few minutes to thicken up.
Salad:.
Put 1/2 cup of the dressing in the bottom of your salad bowl.
Add all ingredients, except lettuce, and toss to coat.
Serve:.
Put several lettuce leaves on each plate and add dressed salad.
Serve extra dressing on the side.
Enjoy!
7a6c6f2959.pred:
In a large bowl, whisk together the oil, lemon juice, honey, salt, basil, dill, pepper, and lemon zest.
Add the broccoli, mushrooms, onions, avocado, tomatoes, and lettuce.
Toss to coat with the dressing.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

e6bf3951b6.gt:
Cook meat and onion and green pepper until meat is browned and vegetables under tender.
Drain.
Stir in remaining ingredients and cover and simmer for 1 hour.
Remove Bay leaf when finished.
e6bf3951b6.pred:
In a large pot, brown the ground beef and onion.
Add the green pepper, stewed tomatoes, kidney beans, tomato sauce, salt, chili powder, and bay leaf.
Cover and simmer for 1 hour.
Remove the bay leaf.
Serve with toppings of your choice.

064cb6c3cf.gt:
In a large Dutch oven, cook green beans and ham on medium heat with water up just over the beans.
Cook for 20-30 minutes.
Add potatoes and salt, cover and turn heat down to low, cook another 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are done when pierced with a fork.
Note: Amount of ham and salt can be adjusted to your taste.
064cb6c3cf.pred:
In a large pot, combine the green beans, bacon, ham, salt pork, and potatoes.
Add enough water to cover the ingredients.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes.
Drain the water and add the salt.
Return the pot to the stove and cook for another 10 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
Serve immediately.

5e144fbd37.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of a 9"x13" casserole.
Cover with a layer of noodles (3 or 4 noodles should be enough).
Place ricotta in a bowl and add about 1/4 cup of water, stirring until blended.
Spread 1/3 of this mixture over the pasta (you can use a cake spatula).
Spread 1/3 of the remaining pasta sauce over the cheese.
Spread 1/3 of the vegetables over the sauce.
Sprinkle 1/3 of the mozzarella over the veggies.
Repeat twice starting with the noodles and ending with the mozzarella.
Cover and bake until the noodles are tender (35 to 40 minutes).
Remove cover and bake 5 minutes until cheese starts to become golden.
Remove from oven and allow to stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.
5e144fbd37.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine ricotta cheese, vegetables, and mozzarella cheese.
Spread 1/2 cup of pasta sauce in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Layer 1/3 of the pasta, 1/3 of the ricotta mixture, 1/3 of the pasta, and 1/3 of the ricotta mixture.
Repeat layers, ending with pasta.
Spread remaining pasta sauce over the top.
Bake for 45 minutes or until heated through and bubbly.
Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

9168e15a37.gt:
Heat 3 tablespoons of the olive oil in a heavy soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, and add the onions.
Cook, stirring, until very tender, about eight minutes.
Add a pinch of salt and the garlic, and stir for another minute or so until fragrant.
Stir in the tomatoes, with their liquid, and bring to a simmer.
Simmer about eight minutes until cooked down and fragrant, and add the cauliflower to the pot.
Stir together, and add the bay leaf, rosemary, pepper, dissolved tomato paste and wine.
Bring to a simmer, and add salt to taste.
Cover, reduce the heat and simmer 30 to 40 minutes until the cauliflower is very tender.
Stir in the olives and vinegar if using, and adjust salt and pepper.
Remove from the heat, and stir in the remaining olive oil.
Serve hot or warm.
9168e15a37.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and saute until golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes, cauliflower, bay leaf, rosemary, and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper.
Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the tomato paste dissolved in water and the red wine.
Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the olives and vinegar.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot.

feb5ca6df3.gt:
Brown sausage in a medium skillet over medium high heat, stirring to break apart.
Drain, and place in a bowl.
Stir in softened cream cheese, drained sauerkraut, and mustard until thoroughly combined.
Cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place beaten eggs and crushed crackers in separate bowls.
Roll sausage mixture into small balls and dip first into egg, then roll in cracker crumbs to coat.
Arrange on a sheet pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, turning once for even browning.
Serve warm.
feb5ca6df3.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Form into 1 inch balls.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.

ffd5e1942a.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F. Spray an 8x8 baking pan with cooking spray and set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together cream cheese and butter until light and fluffy with a electric hand mixer.
Add in egg and cake mix and beat until combined.
Fold in white chocolate chips and sprinkles.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until bars turn golden brown.
Remove from oven and let them cool completely.
Cut into bars and serve.
Enjoy!
Note: Funfetti cake batter bars will keep covered for about five days.
ffd5e1942a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 13x9-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and butter with an electric mixer on medium speed until well blended.
Add the egg and beat until combined.
Add the cake mix and white chocolate chips and beat until well blended.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan.
Sprinkle the colored sprinkles on top, if desired.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before cutting into bars.

c089da7346.gt:
In a food processor or blender, blend berries and sugar until completely pureed, about 5 minutes.
Scrape mixture into a 9 -x-9" loaf pan and freeze until solid, at least 4 hours.
c089da7346.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the berries and sugar.
Mash the berries with a fork until they are broken down and the sugar has dissolved.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Strain the berries and sugar through a fine mesh strainer.
Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and freeze according to the manufacturer's instructions.
When the sorbet is frozen, scoop it into a container and place in the freezer until ready to serve.

ed226be03e.gt:
Heat oil in a small frying pan over low heat until hot, about 1 minute.
Add chile flakes and remove from heat.
Let cool to room temperature.
Strain through a fine mesh strainer if desired, then transfer to a container and cover until ready to use.
Heat half of a gas or charcoal grill to high (about 400 degrees F) and the other half to low (about 300 degrees F).
Divide dough in 1/2 and roll into 2 rounds about 1/4 inch thick and 10 inches in diameter.
Brush the top of 1 round with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Lay dough oiled side down on the hotter half of the grill and brush the top with oil and sprinkle with salt.
Grill without moving until grill marks form on the bottom of the dough, about 2 minutes.
Flip dough with a spatula or tongs to the cooler half of grill.
Spread 1/2 of the sauce evenly over the dough, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the Parmesan cheese over the sauce, then top with 1/2 of the peppers, 1/2 of the sausage, and 1/2 of the mozzarella.
Cover and grill, rotating if necessary to avoid any hot spots, until dough is lightly charred and cheese is melted, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer pizza to a cutting board, sprinkle 1 tablespoon more of the Parmesan over top, drizzle with desired amount of chile oil, slice, and serve.
Repeat with second round of dough and remaining toppings.
ed226be03e.pred:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Brush the pizza dough with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Place the dough on a pizza stone or baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and brush with olive oil.
Spread the pizza sauce over the dough and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Top with the roasted peppers, sausage, and mozzarella.
Bake for 10 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted.

4ff0a3ff39.gt:
In a large bowl, combine flour, granulated sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
Make a well in the center of flour mixture.
In medium bowl, combine egg, buttermilk, orange juice concentrate and melted butter; add all at once to flour mixture.
Stir just until moistened (batter should be lumpy).
Fold in walnuts.
Line twelve 2-1/2-inch muffin cups with paper bake cups.
Fill the cups 3/4 full with batter.
Bake in a 400 degree F. oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until muffins are golden.
Remove the muffins from the pans.
In a small bowl, combine powdered sugar, orange peel and enough orange juice (2 to 3 teaspoons) to make a drizzling consistency.
Drizzle over warm muffins.
4ff0a3ff39.pred:
Preheat oven to 375F.
Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
In a medium bowl, whisk together egg, buttermilk, orange juice concentrate, butter, and walnuts.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and stir just until moistened.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar.
Store in an airtight container.

84fd3c9208.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees, cut top off of squash and remove pulp and seeds, place upside down on cookie sheet and fill pan 1/2 way up with water, cover with foil and bake 45 minutes, remove and make sure it is fork tender, if not continue cooking in 10 minute intervals, leave on pan to cool.
While it is baking, in rice cooker cook rice with 2 cups vegetable broth, diced zucchini, 1 diced carrot, chopped parsley, and about 1/2 cup water.
When rice is done cooking, stir it well and add the raw tomato, pepper and 1/2 of the onion diced.
In a Large skillet add olive oil and brown 1/2 of the diced onion, when brown add the ground turkey, sage, garlic and mushrooms -- continue cooking until meat is done -- add the rice mixture to the meat mixture and stir well, use the remaining vegetable broth to deglaze pan and get moisture level up for oven baking.
Remove about 3/4 of the squash meat and puree for pie or freeze for later use.
Fill squash with the rice/meat mixture about 1/2 full then add 1/2 the cheese, then layer remaining rice mixture on top and top it all with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes just to get the cheese melted and the flavors melded.
Makes a great presentation to the table with the squash full of the meal!
84fd3c9208.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Cut squash in half lengthwise, scoop out seeds and pulp.
Place squash cut side up on baking sheet.
Bake for 45 minutes or until tender.
Meanwhile, cook rice according to package directions.
When squash is done, remove from oven and let cool.
In a large skillet, brown turkey, mushrooms, and onion.
Add garlic and cook 1 minute.
Add rice, broth, water, parsley, pepper, sage, and tomato.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes.
Stir in parmesan cheese.
Spoon rice mixture into squash.
Replace top and bake 10 minutes.

d069fb1925.gt:
Cut off the stem of the shiitake mushrooms and cut into bite size pieces.
Put water and the seasoning ingredients in a pot and let it boil.
Then, add the shiitake mushrooms, cover with a drop lid, and cook it for about 10 minutes on low heat.
Stir the pot sometimes.
Take off the drop lid when the liquid boils down and remove from the heat when the liquid has almost gone.
When it has cooled down a little, it is done.
You can keep it in the fridge for about 3 days so make some and keep it for bento lunch box.
It will be an extra dish for dinner if you keep some in the fridge.
d069fb1925.pred:
In a small saucepan, bring the water to a boil.
Add the mushrooms and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool.
In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar.
Pour the mixture over the mushrooms and let sit for 15 minutes.
Serve.

fda9c36818.gt:
Put all of the ingredients in a jar for the dressing and shake to mix throughly.
That's all.
It keeps up to 1 week.
Thinly cut daikon radish into match sticks.
Add sliced onions.
Wakame seaweed.
Pour the dressing over the salad.
Daikon radish & carrot with crispy boiled and chirimen jako salad.The combination is great.
I found this salad dressing container at a 100 yen shop.
Perfect for storing liquids!
Cheap and convenient!
Just put all the ingredients to shake it up.
fda9c36818.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and mix well.
Serve over salad greens or as a dip for sushi.

292b683c3f.gt:
Blend ice first just a tad.
Then add your milk, hot coffee(don't worry it won't melt anything that much at all.
), oreos and everything else.
Blend for about 1 minute and a half and pour it in a glass.
Enjoy guys.
Please don't get mad if u don't like it.
I was just experimenting and it actually came out pretty good.
Wish I had whipped cream and syrup or it'd be amazing.
I had no heavy cream so I couldn't make it..
If u don't like it though just make whatever changes or additions you feel and tell me what u did and post ur pics.
Thank u all.
Some people may add more oreos or sweetener.
That's up to u. I ran out of my sugar syrup so I didn't add any sugar.
Enjoy everyone.
292b683c3f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Spray a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine the cocoa, cinnamon, vanilla, coffee extract, and nutmeg.
Add the eggs and stir until well blended.
Add the flour, sugar, and baking powder and stir until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Cool completely before frosting.
For the frosting, in a large bowl, beat the butter until smooth.
Add the cream and beat until fluffy.
Add the cocoa powder and beat until smooth.
Add the vanilla and beat until combined.
Frost the cake with the frosting.
Sprinkle with the cinnamon and nutmeg.

d859113e86.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Grease and flour a loaf pan and set aside.
Combine the eggs, oil, pumpkin and water in a large bowl.
Sift the dry ingredients together and stir into the pumpkin mixture.
Stir in walnuts.
Pour into the prepared loaf pan and bake for one hour or until a tester inserted near the center comes out clean.
d859113e86.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour 2 loaf pans.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, oil, pumpkin, water, sugar, flour, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, and baking soda.
Beat at medium speed until well blended.
Stir in the chopped Black Walnuts.
Pour batter into prepared pans.
Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes.
Remove from pans and cool completely on wire racks.

dafbe725ac.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
Mix ingredients well in the order given.
Drop by teaspoon on cookie sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
Under bake for a chewy cookie.
dafbe725ac.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease cookie sheets.
In a large bowl, cream together brown sugar, butter, and white sugar.
Add flour, baking soda, and salt; mix well.
Stir in eggs, baking powder, and vanilla.
Stir in raisins and coconut.
Stir in cereal.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

c7ae046d51.gt:
Place buttermilk, butter or margarine, sugar, salt, flour, whole wheat flour, and yeast into pan of bread machine.
Bake on White Bread setting.
Cool on wire racks before slicing.
c7ae046d51.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Buttermilk Bread I:
In a large bowl, combine the buttermilk, margarine, sugar, salt, and yeast.
Stir until the yeast is dissolved.
Add the flours and stir until the dough comes together.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
Place the dough in a large, lightly oiled bowl and cover with a clean kitchen towel.
Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface.
Divide the dough into 2 equal pieces and shape each piece into a loaf.
Place the loaves in two greased 9x5-inch loaf pans and cover with a clean kitchen towel.
Let rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Bake the loaves for 30 minutes, or until they are golden brown and sound hollow when tapped.
Remove from the pans and cool on a wire rack.

491516b698.gt:
peel banana and cut off ends.
slice banana diagonally so u get oval shaped pieces.
u need 12 slices.
thickness to ur liking.
arange 4 banana slices on a plate.
two on two.
top two pointing upwards and bottom two pointing downward.
they should touch in the middle( it should resemble butterfly wings or a four leaf clover)
arrange 4 dried cranberries in the middle of the wings going up and down.
this is the body.
arrange 3 raisins on top wins and 2 raisins on bottom wings.
take the icing or gel and make 2 long feelers coming out of the top half of the dried cranberry.
repeat with rest of ingredients.
feel free to exsperiment wih different fruits.
good ones to work with are (strawberries, kiwi for the wings) pieces pineapple, chocolate chips, for decorating the wings (pretzel sticks or almond slivers for the feelers) get creative with the kids and have fun!
enjoy!
:)
makes 3 butterflies
491516b698.pred:
Combine the banana, cranberries, raisins, and icing in a bowl.
Mix well and then spread on a cookie sheet.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Let cool and then cut into butterfly shapes.
Serve with a side of vanilla ice cream.

c2277ff083.gt:
In a large pot, bring the water and salt to a boil; add the lentils, reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 30 minutes or until the lentils are tender but not overcooked; drain.
In a colander, rinse the cooked lentils under cold water until slightly cool, then place them in a bowl.
Whisk together the remaining ingredients; pour over the lentils and combine well.
Chill for 1 to 2 hours and serve cold.
c2277ff083.pred:
In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Add the lentils and salt.
Cover and simmer over low heat for 20 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
Drain and rinse the lentils with cold water.
In a large bowl, combine the lentils, olive oil, vinegar, cumin, coriander, cayenne, and salt.
Toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate until chilled.

3ac2a22c5f.gt:
Throughly mix together all ingredients.
Spoon sauce over meatloaf.
Bake for one hour at 350F.
For vegan, omit the Worcestershire sauce and use vegan alternative.
3ac2a22c5f.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the tomato sauce, water, vinegar, brown sugar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, parsley, basil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Stir well.
Add the mushrooms, and stir again.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the mixture in a 9x13 inch baking dish, and bake for 1 hour.
Serve hot.

1ebd581dca.gt:
In a large mixing bowl combine rhubarb, strawberries, sugar, lemon juice, cornstarch and the pinch of salt, stirring together well.
Spoon mixture into an 8x8 in (20x20 cm) glass baking dish.
In a second bowl, combine brown sugar, oats, cinnamon, nutmeg and butter, and stir with a fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle this mixture over the fruit mixture.
If using oven, place in a 325F preheated oven, and bake uncovered for 20-25 minutes until golden brown on top and fruit is tender.
If using an outdoor grill, position the pan on a cool side of the grill (that means for a gas grill no heat directly underneath).
Maintain the heat to a medium-low temperature (around 300F).
Close lid of grill and cook 25-30 minutes.
Make sure to rotate the baking dish on the grill about every 8 minutes for even cooking.
Either way, the fruit should be tender and the juices bubbling when finished cooking.
I love serving with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or frozen yogurt.
1ebd581dca.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine rhubarb, strawberries, sugar, lemon juice, cornstarch, salt, brown sugar, oats, cinnamon and nutmeg.
Mix well.
Pour into a 9x13 baking dish.
Cut butter into cubes and distribute evenly over the top of the fruit mixture.
Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the fruit is bubbly and the top is golden brown.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

1d309c893f.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken, soup, cheese, milk, salt, pepper and butter.
Mix together and pour mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 5 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly, and casserole is hot in the center.
1d309c893f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a 2-quart casserole dish, combine chicken, soup, cheese, milk, salt, and pepper.
Bake, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until heated through.
Top with melted butter and bake for 5 minutes more.

b4e4245834.gt:
Slice bananas and lay them out on cookie sheets, put into freezer for about 2 hours.
Take them from the freezer to your food processor or blender and blend them up, stopping every few min or so to scrap the sides down.
It does take a lil while but once it reaches the creaminess u like you can serve it as is and it will be more like a custard or put into a container and put into freezer til nice and thick like ice cream.
Update: If planning to keep this for a few days or so add a crushed vitamin C tablet and give it a good stir!
That's it!!!
Enjoy!!
!
b4e4245834.pred:
Peel the bananas and cut them into small pieces.
Add the pieces to a blender.
Puree the bananas until smooth.
Add 1/2 cup of milk and blend again.
Pour the mixture into a freezer-safe container and freeze for at least 2 hours.
When ready to serve, remove the container from the freezer and let it sit at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

6a6db8c9e3.gt:
trim away middle of bun
put 1 Cheddar cheese and 1tbsp of jam
add 3 hazelnut on each bun and bake 180 C for 5 minute till cheese melted
6a6db8c9e3.pred:
Preheat oven to 200C.
Place the buns on a baking tray and toast in the oven for 5 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool.
Place the cheese on top of the toasted buns.
Spread the blueberry jam on the cheese.
Sprinkle the hazelnuts on top of the jam.
Place the buns in the oven and bake for 5 minutes.
Serve hot.

6f4d1ffc76.gt:
In la deep pot, bring water, a pinch of salt and oil to a boil.
Rinse rice a couple of times.
Add to boiling water.
Reduce heat to low, cover and cook until water evaporates (1520 minutes).
Fluff with fork, let it cool to room temperature or refrigerate until ready to use.
When ready to serve, add chopped cilantro and lime juice.
Season with salt.
6f4d1ffc76.pred:
In a large pot, bring water and oil to a boil.
Add rice and salt.
Reduce heat to low and cover.
Simmer for 20 minutes, or until water is absorbed and rice is tender.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
Fluff rice with a fork.
Stir in cilantro and lime juice.
Serve immediately.

c7e9cae7ae.gt:
In a large saucepan with boiling salted water, cook pasta 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente.
Drain and put back in the saucepan.
Meanwhile, in another saucepan, bring to boil heavy cream and dry onion flakes.
Add asparagus and smoked salmon, cook at low heat until warm.
Remove from the heat, add 1/2 cup of parmigiano reggiano and stir.
Add salt and pepper.
Add sauce to the pasta and stir to coat well.
Sprinkle each serving with remaining parmigiano reggiano.
c7e9cae7ae.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add cream and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until sauce is thickened, about 10 minutes.
Stir in asparagus and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in salmon, cheese, and salt and pepper.
Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake until bubbly and lightly browned, about 20 minutes.
Serve with linguine.

1690800ec2.gt:
Peel and quarter the potatoes, then wash them thoroughly.
Place the potatoes in a large pot with enough cold, salted water to cover them and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 min, or until cooked through, and drain.
Meanwhile put butter, lemon and garlic in a saucepan over very, very low.
Let it simmer for 20-30 minutes.
Discard lemon and garlic.
When potatoes are done, drain and mashed to your liking.
Fold in avocado and butter.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
If you like creamer mashed potatoes, you can add some milk.
1690800ec2.pred:
In a large pot, melt 12 lbs of butter.
Add the lemon, quartered, and garlic cloves.
Cut the avocados into small pieces and add to the pot.
Peel and cut the potatoes into small pieces and add to the pot.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook over medium heat until the potatoes are tender.
Serve immediately.

4a46bab1e9.gt:
Mix all ingredients together, I use my stand mixer with the dough hook.
Let mixer kneed the dough for about 5 minutes.
Dough should be moist and pliable but not sticky, if it is dry add more water, if it is too sticky add a little extra flour.
Coat a bowl with a little oil place dough in the bowl and cover with cling wrap and leave for about 1 hour or till doubled in size.
Once doubled in size dust bench lightly with flour turn out dough and lightly press down to remove a little of the air.
Form into your choice of loaf, I like to use a proofing basket, but you could use a tin or free form.
Let the loaf rise for another 40 min to 1 hour.
Pre heat your oven to super hot 450 F/ 250C.
I use a pizza stone but it can go straight in the oven on a tray if you don't have one.
Leave oven temp on high for 10 min then reduce to 375 F/ 190 C for a further 20 minute.
Enjoy!
4a46bab1e9.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, white bread flour, honey, salt, and yeast.
In a small bowl, stir together the Greek yogurt and water.
Add the yogurt mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until combined.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and divide into 2 equal pieces.
On a lightly floured surface, roll each piece into a 12-inch-long rope.
Place the ropes on a greased baking sheet, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Bake the bread for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack.

3ffc1f8ead.gt:
Follow instructions on pizza crust package
After flattening the mix on round cookie sheet, add the pasta sauce in circular motions starting from middle with spoon (leaving 2 inches on the outer ring for crust)
Add the cheese evenly across sauce
Add the pepperoni
Cook for 10-14 minutes or until crust is golden brown
3ffc1f8ead.pred:
Mix all ingredients together and form into a ball.
Roll out dough on a floured surface to about 1/8 inch thick.
Spread sauce evenly over dough.
Top with cheese and pepperoni.
Bake at 400 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

cab917403f.gt:
Mix all ingredients together and place in a clean jar with a tight lid.
Use 2 T.
per pound of meat.
cab917403f.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Store in an airtight container.
Use 1/4 cup of seasoning mix for every 1 pound of meat.
Mix with 1/4 cup of water.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Use immediately.

fefd0facd1.gt:
Trim the bottoms of the asparagus and place in a shallow dish.
Pour the olive oil, salt, pepper and lime juice over the asparagus and toss well to coat thoroughly.
Grill over hot coals for 2 to 3 minutes, or until tender.
Serve immediately.
fefd0facd1.pred:
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Cut the asparagus into 1-inch pieces.
In a large bowl, toss the asparagus with the olive oil, salt and pepper.
Place the asparagus on the grill and cook for 5 minutes, turning frequently.
Add the lime juice and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve immediately.

b4611b4385.gt:
Heat should be medium-high and rack about 4 inches from fire.
Put shrimp and garlic in a food processor and pulse until just chopped; remove to a large bowl.
Working in batches, grind pork fat until just chopped (be careful not to overprocess).
Add to bowl.
Then grind meat until just chopped, again being careful not to overprocess; add to bowl.
Mix shrimp, pork fat and meat with soy sauce, scallions, cilantro, chili and ginger; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Shape into 8 patties.
Grill about 4 minutes, then turn and cook for a total of 8 to 10 minutes, or until nicely browned and cooked through.
Garnish with scallions, cilantro, cabbage and pickled pepper, to taste.
b4611b4385.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, pork, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and scallions.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix well and let stand for 15 minutes.
Form into 4 patties.
Heat a grill pan or outdoor grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the patties for 3 minutes on each side, or until cooked through.
Serve on buns with cabbage and pickled pepper.

0787add592.gt:
Fry the egg and season with salt and pepper.
Add all other ingredients to a bowl and top with warm egg.
Drizzle with balsamic syrup.
0787add592.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve immediately.

a777a9be09.gt:
In a wide mouth 1 quart jar, layer the barley, peas, rice and lentils.
Then layer around the edges the onion, parsley, salt, lemon pepper, bouillon and the alphabet pasta.
Fill the rest of the jar with the twist macaroni.
Seal and attach a gift card.
The gift card should read: Add contents of jar to 3 quarts of water, 2 stalks of chopped celery, 2 sliced carrots, 1 cup of shredded cabbage (optional) and 2 cups diced tomatoes.
Over medium low heat, cover and simmer about 1 hour, or until vegetables are tender.
a777a9be09.pred:
In a large saucepan, bring 3 cups of water to a boil.
Add the barley, split peas, rice, lentils, onion, parsley, salt, lemon pepper, and beef bouillon granules.
Stir well.
Cover and simmer for 45 minutes, or until the barley is tender.
Remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes.
Stir in the pasta and macaroni.
Cover and let stand for 10 minutes.
Serve.

f7ca0c32fa.gt:
Place greens on serving plate.
Top with chicken and corn.
Drizzle with salsa, then dressing.
f7ca0c32fa.pred:
Mix dressing and salsa together.
Add chicken and corn to salad greens; toss to coat.

4aec361465.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F. Put the chickpeas into a bowl.
Coat the chickpeas with the olive oil, garlic powder and whichever spice you prefer.
Place on a sheet pan that youve lined with parchment paper and roast at 400 F for approximately 20 minutes.
Toss in the fresh chives, adjust the seasoning as needed and serve.
If you choose to saute them on the stovetop, use a cast iron or aluminum pan on medium heat and stir frequently for approximately 15-20 minutes.
4aec361465.pred:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add chickpeas, garlic powder, spice, and chives.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until chickpeas are heated through and spices are fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

524529d38b.gt:
Add ingredients (except for cornmeal) to machine bread pan in order as per manufacturer's instructions.
Set to "Dough" cycle.
Lightly grease one 9 x 13-inch pan and sprinkle with cornmeal.
When the dough cycle is complete, roll out dough and place in pan.
Let rest in pans for 10-15 minutes.
Add toppings of your choice.
Bake at 350F until done (approximately 20 minutes, depending on the thickness of toppings).
I make the pizza in 9x13 rectangular pans rather than the round pizza pans, because the squares pieces are easier to reheat and pack in school lunches.
524529d38b.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
Place dough in bread machine and set to dough cycle.
When dough cycle is complete, remove dough from machine and place on floured surface.
Roll dough into a 12 inch circle.
Place dough on a lightly floured baking sheet.
Spread with 1/2 cup pizza sauce.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Sprinkle with toppings.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

3ba549830f.gt:
Mix sauce, peppers and walnuts in saucepan; cook on medium heat until heated through, stirring occasionally.
Pour over hot ravioli in large serving bowl; toss to coat.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley, if desired.
3ba549830f.pred:
Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the roasted red peppers and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the walnuts and toast until golden, about 2 minutes.
Add the Alfredo sauce and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Add the cooked ravioli and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

05096fc3ad.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Coat a standard (12 cup) muffin tin with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, whisk egg whites, sugar, cocoa and salt until combined.
Add coconut; mix until well coated.
***I would add the sliced almonds in at this point with the coconut.
They didn't want to stick to the tops of the cookies!
***.
Dividing evenly, spoon mixture into muffin tin and pat in gently with moistened fingers.
Sprinkle with almonds and pat on gently.
***See note above***.
Bake until almonds are golden, 20-25 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool in tin for 5-10 minutes.
Run a thin metal spatula around the edges to loosen from pan.
Turn out onto rack to cool completely.
Cookies keep in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
05096fc3ad.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.
Gradually add sugar, cocoa powder, and coconut.
Mix well.
Fold in almonds.
Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls into ungreased muffin cups.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool in pan 5 minutes.
Remove to wire racks to cool completely.
Store in airtight container.

d75096ee18.gt:
place a small pot on medium heat and add heavy cream.
Bring to a low boil.
Pour over chocolate chips and mix until thoroughly melted.
Add in butter and vanilla extract.
d75096ee18.pred:
Combine chocolate chips, cream, butter and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat.
Stir until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth.
Pour into a bowl and refrigerate until thickened, about 1 hour.

61afcadcb1.gt:
1.
In a small bowl, combine almonds and brown sugar; set aside.
2.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Beat in the almond extract.
3.
Combine flour, baking soda and baking powder.
Add this to the creamed mixture alternately with bananas and sour cream.
Fold in the vanilla or white chips.
4.
Spread into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan.
Sprinkle with reserved almond and brown sugar mixture.
5.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.
61afcadcb1.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add eggs, almond extract, and bananas.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture and mix well.
Spread batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes.
Invert onto a serving plate.
Serve warm.

5045cde8e5.gt:
Desand the clams.
Boil the water and add the dashi.
Add the clams.
Once the shells have opened up, add the ingredients.
Garnish with mitsuba or thin green onion and it's done!
5045cde8e5.pred:
In a small saucepan, bring the water to a boil.
Add the clams and cook for 3 minutes.
Remove the clams from the water and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix the mentsuyu, salt, and bonito dashi stock granules.
Add the clams and mentsuyu mixture to the water and bring to a boil.
Add the mitsuba and small green onion and simmer for 3 minutes.
Serve immediately.

07f2c36b9b.gt:
Heat bacon for 30 seconds in the microwave between two pieces of paper towel to soak up excess grease
Spread honey mustard on tortilla then lay cheese on top of honey mustard, then add chicken, then add the bacon.
Spread the guacamole on top of the bacon then lay lettuce leaves on top of guacamole
Roll up and devour!
07f2c36b9b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a small bowl, mix together the chicken, cheese, bacon and guacamole.
Spread the mixture evenly on one side of the tortilla.
Top with the lettuce and mustard.
Fold the tortilla in half to enclose the filling.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted.
Serve warm.

a5230cef43.gt:
With and Electric mixer, beat butter & Icing sugar until it stands up like egg whites.
In a seperate medium bowl, combine flour and corn starch.
Add slowly to butter and icing sugar mixture.
(I find when your mixer starts to power out, then use a wooden spoon to take over, but please try to use the mixer as long as possible).
Drop from teaspoon onto cookie sheet about 2 inches apart.
Top cookies with jub-jubs, bar cherries, or anything really.
My oldest son loves smarties on his.
Imagination is up to you.
Bake at 300 for approx 30 minutes until bottom edges turn a light brown.
(Because all ovens vary please start checking them at about 20-25 minutes).
a5230cef43.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Line a 9x13 baking pan with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and icing sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the flour and cornstarch and mix until well combined.
Press dough into the bottom of the prepared pan.
Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool completely in the pan.
Cut into squares and serve.

02b1542927.gt:
Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced.
line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place thighs on a work surface, open out and generously spread tapenade inside each.
Fold fillets back into shape.
Cut pastry sheets in half.
Place chicken at one end of the sheet fold edges in, fold pastry over chicken and roll to make a neat parcel.
Pinch sides to seal.
Place, seam-side down, on a prepared tray.
Brush with egg to glaze.
Sprinkle with basil.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and pastry is golden brown.
Serve with vegetables.
02b1542927.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the chicken thigh fillets with the basil and parmesan tapenade.
Mix well.
Place the mixture on top of the frozen butter puff pastry and spread it out evenly.
Cut the pastry into 4 -6 squares.
Place a square on a baking sheet and bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly.
Whisk the egg and brush it over the top of the pastry.
Sprinkle dried basil leaves over the top.
Bake for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve with steamed green & yellow vegetables.

b067e71075.gt:
Heat the oven to 450 degrees F and arrange a rack in the middle.
Place a baking sheet upside down in the oven while its heating.
Remove chorizo from its casing and place in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 7 minutes.
Remove to a plate and set aside.
Add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil to the pan.
Add mushrooms and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Cook, stirring rarely, until beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough to a 10-inch round, remove the hot baking sheet from the oven, drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, and carefully place dough on the upside-down baking sheet.
Scatter chorizo, mushrooms, Jack cheese, and Parmesan cheese on top.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake until cheese is melted and crust is crisp and browned, about 15 minutes.
b067e71075.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
Place a large baking sheet in the oven to preheat.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chorizo and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and drain on paper towels.
Place the pizza dough on a lightly floured work surface and roll out to a 12-inch round.
Transfer to a pizza pan.
Spread the chorizo and mushroom mixture evenly over the dough.
Sprinkle the Jack cheese over the top.
Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese over the top.
Bake until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly, 12 to 15 minutes.
Let cool for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

1432c540ac.gt:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. In a bowl, whisk the canola oil, vinegar, miso, ginger, sesame oil, honey, lime zest, and lime juice until smooth.
Season with salt.
On a rimmed baking sheet, toss the tomatoes with 3 tablespoons of the miso dressing and season with salt.
Roast for 20 minutes, stirring, until the tomatoes are charred in spots.
Scrape into a large bowl.
Cook the soba noodles in boiling water just until al dente, 4 minutes.
Drain and cool the noodles under cold running water.
Add the soba noodles, scallions, and half of the remaining dressing to the tomatoes and toss well.
Season with salt, transfer to a platter, and garnish with the sesame seeds.
Serve with the remaining dressing.Looking for vegetable recipes?
Try our best asparagus recipes, eggplant recipes, or zucchini recipes.
1432c540ac.pred:
In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the ginger and toasted sesame oil, and cook for 1 minute.
Add the miso and vinegar, and stir to combine.
Add the tomatoes and scallions, and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the soba noodles and cook for 3 minutes, until the noodles are tender.
Add the lime zest, lime juice, and salt.
Stir to combine.
Serve with the toasted sesame seeds.

aa904a4678.gt:
Place your jello shot cups on a cookie sheet (that you know will fit in your fridge).
This will make for easy transport.
Place 2 cups VERY hot water (but not boiling) in a pitcher.
Slowly pour in contents of jello packages while stirring constantly.
Stir until completely mixed (about 2 minutes).
Add in the remaining ingredients and stir well.
Pour into plastic jello shot cups or you can use a 9x13 pan if you don't have the cups.
Chill 4 hours or more until set.
If you are using a cake pan, simply cut the set jello into squares and place on individual cupcake cups for serving.
If you want to get silly, top each one with a small dollop of whip cream just before serving!
aa904a4678.pred:
In a large bowl, stir together the blue Jello and very hot water.
Stir until the Jello is completely dissolved.
Pour the coconut rum and blue schnapps into the bowl and stir to combine.
Add the pineapple juice and stir until the mixture is well blended.
Refrigerate until the Jello is set, about 2 hours.
Pour the mixture into shot glasses and serve.

32d7fb7310.gt:
To roast vegetables: Preheat oven to 400.
Wrap peeled garlic cloves together in foil with a few drops of olive oil and put in oven for the same time you will be roasting the peppers and potatoes, around 35 minutes.
Cut potatoes in half and cut red peppers into half inch pieces.
In a large bowl, toss potatoes, bell peppers and 3 TBS olive oil, along with salt and pepper to taste.
Arrange potatoes and bell peppers in one layer, divided amongst 2 shallow baking pans.
Roast in the middle and lower third of the oven, switching positions of the pans halfway through the roasting time, for a total of 35 minutes, or until potatoes are golden brown and tender.
To make salad: After potatoes are done,remove pans from oven and immediately toss roasted potatoes and peppers with 2 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Cool and remove garlic from foil.
Squeeze cloves into a small bowl and mash with a fork with remaining 1/2 TBS olive oil and 1 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Toss together with potatoes and peppers.
Just before serving, add fresh basil.
Serve at room temperature.
Optional items you could add for a main dish meal: goat cheese, toasted pine nuts, grilled chicken, grilled tuna, etc.
32d7fb7310.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place potatoes, garlic, and 1/2 cup water in a large roasting pan.
Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour.
Remove garlic and potatoes from oven and cool slightly.
Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes.
Place potatoes in a large bowl.
Add bell peppers, 1/2 cup olive oil, 1/2 cup balsamic vinegar, basil, salt and pepper.
Toss to combine.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

e2b5a77d87.gt:
Heat oil in pan on low to medium heat, then throw in onion and sugar.
Cook for a couple of minutes, stirring from time to time.
Throw in mustard, stir to combine, and cook until onion is done to your liking, stirring as necessary.
Combine eggs, salt, pepper and cream cheese - don't worry if the cheese doesn't incorporate, it will once it's heated - and throw into pan, stirring everything together.
If mixture is too thick, add a little milk.
Add tomatoes, stirring and cooking until eggs are almost done, then add grated cheese and stir to melt and heat through.
Add extra salt & pepper if desired.
e2b5a77d87.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and cook until they begin to break down, about 10 minutes.
Add the cream cheese and cook until melted.
Add the eggs, mustard, sugar, and milk.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are cooked to your liking.
Serve hot.

0213dcf418.gt:
Heat non stick skillet.
Tear a circle out of the center of bread.
Spread a very, very thin layer of mayo to both sides of bread.
Place the bread in the skillet; add a very small amount of butter in the hole.
Crack the egg into the hole in the bread.
Cook egg till set and bread is browned turn over and brown the other side and egg is done to your desire.
Salt and pepper to taste and enjoy!
J.R. liked to put a little maple syrup on his.
You can also toast the holes you tear out of the bread in the pan while egg is cooking and serve on the side.
0213dcf418.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Shape into a ball.
Roll in bread crumbs.
Fry in butter until golden brown.
Serve with ketchup.

ea0c63b401.gt:
In a medium saute pan, bring the stock to a boil.
Add the orzo and cook for 7 to 8 minutes until liquid is almost absorbed and orzo is tender.
Turn off heat.
Stir in the remaining ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.
Enjoy!
ea0c63b401.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large saucepan, bring the stock to a boil.
Add the orzo and cook for 8 minutes, or until al dente.
Drain and set aside.
In a small saucepan, heat the cream and lemon juice over medium heat.
Add the cream cheese and butter and stir until smooth.
Add the parmesan cheese and stir until melted.
Add the orzo and toss to coat.
Transfer to a 9x13 baking dish.
Sprinkle with chives and pepper.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until heated through.
Serve immediately.

8a8c406a8c.gt:
Cook pasta as directed, adding vegetables to the boiling water for the last 2 minutes of the pasta cooking time.
Meanwhile, Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet.
Add meat; cook 4 minutes or until browned on all sides, stirring occasionally.
Stir in dressing and teriyaki sauce; cook 2 minutes or until sauce is thickened, stirring occasionally.
Drain pasta mixture; Place in a large serving bowl.
Add meat mixture; toss to coat.
8a8c406a8c.pred:
Combine linguine, broccoli, carrots, oil, beef, and dressing in a large bowl.
Stir to coat the beef with the dressing.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Serve over hot cooked noodles.

6970e8f99b.gt:
Preheat oven to 300F and grease an 8x8 baking pan.
Combine unsweetened chocolate and butter in a medium saucepan and melt over medium low heat, stirring constantly until pieces are almost melted.
Remove from the heat and stir until smooth.
In a large bowl using an electric mixer on medium speed, beat eggs until light yellow in color--about 5 minutes.
Add sugar and blend on low until thoroughly combined.
Add vanilla and melted chocolate to the egg sugar mixture.
Blend on low until smooth.
Add the flour and mix thoroughly.
Pour batter into greased pan.
Smooth surface with a spatula, and sprinkle uniformly with chocolate chips.
Bake on center rack of oven for 45-55 minutes.
The batter should be set and a toothpick inserted into the center should come out clean.
Do not overbake.
Cool to room temperature.
Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour.
Cut and serve chilled.
6970e8f99b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the unsweetened baking chocolate, butter, eggs, sugar, and vanilla.
Stir until well blended.
Add the flour and chocolate chips; stir until well blended.
Pour into the prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before cutting into bars.

9a2f1c9bd7.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease 9x13 pan.
Saute onion in butter til tender, don't brown.
Mix all ingredients together in bowl including onions and butter.
Pour potato mixture in pan and cover,bake aprox.
1 hour.
uncover last 10 minute.
9a2f1c9bd7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350.
Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 15 minutes.
Drain and return to pot.
Add soup and sour cream.
Mash with a potato masher or fork until smooth.
Add butter, pepper, and cheese.
Mix well.
Add optional ingredients.
Pour into a 9x13 baking dish.
Bake for 25-30 minutes.

f69122a346.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Melt the butter or margarine in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the garlic, bay leaves, onion and green bell pepper and saute for about 5 minutes.
Add the meat and saute until slightly browned on all sides.
Transfer mixture to a 2 quart casserole dish and pour the tomatoes over the mixture.
Cover and bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for about 2 hours.
(Note: Also can be done in a slow cooker on low setting for 6 to 8 hours.)
f69122a346.pred:
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onions, garlic, and bay leaves; cook until onions are translucent.
Add the green pepper and steak; cook until steak is browned on all sides.
Add the tomatoes; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer for 1 hour.
Serve over rice.

a7c636c1f0.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large pot over medium-high heat, melt butter.
Add mushrooms and cook until soft, about 10 minutes.
Add celery and onions, and cook until soft, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Add 2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, and remaining ingredients; toss to combine.
Transfer to a buttered 3-quart casserole dish, cover with a piece of aluminum foil, and bake for 45 minutes.
Remove foil and bake until hot and browned on top, about 20 minutes more.
a7c636c1f0.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the butter, mushrooms, celery, onions, salt, and pepper.
Stir to mix.
Add the bread and broth and stir until the bread is broken down.
Add the parsley, thyme, sage, and rosemary and stir to combine.
Transfer the stuffing to a 1 1/2 qt. baking dish and bake for 25 minutes.

acfdff90be.gt:
Cut the meat into strips along the grain.
Put the chicken and all the ingredients up to the soy sauce and honey in a bowl and rub in well with your hands.
Leave to marinate for 30 minutes.
After 30 minutes, wipe the excess moisture off the chicken pieces and add 1 tablespoon of cake flour.
That way the batter will stick well to the chicken.
To make the batter: Put the panko in a resealable bag and crush into a fine powder by rolling a rolling pin over the bag.
You can also do this in a food mill or food processor.
Put the crushed panko and the remaining ingredients marked with in a bowl and mix to combine.
Add 250 ml of beer and mix until blended.
The batter should be about the consistency of heavy cream.
If it's too thick add a little more beer, mixing between additions.
Pour cooking oil in a frying pan and heat over medium to about 170C.
Coat each piece of chicken in batter and deep fry.
To avoid the batter from cracking and falling off, turn the pieces over gently after about 30 seconds even if the surface has not hardened.
When the pieces are golden brown, take them out and drain off the oil very well to finish.
acfdff90be.pred:
Preheat oven to 200C.
Cut chicken into 1 cm cubes.
Mix all ingredients together.
Roll chicken in flour, then in the mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with a side of honey mustard sauce.

e10d62e4d9.gt:
To make the crust, preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Crust cookies in a food processor (or smash in a Ziploc bag with a rolling pin).
Stir in melted butter until all combined.
Pour into a regular pie pan and press crumbs all over the pan and up the sides.
Bake for 3 to 4 minutesjust long enough for it to set.
Cool crust completely.
Place raspberries on a plate or in an empty pan.
Smash them with a fork, then sprinkle on 3 tablespoons of sugar.
Stir together and allow to sit for 15 minutes.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, combine raspberry yogurt with the instant vanilla pudding mix (just the powder itself.)
Beat on low until combined, about 1 minute.
Pour in heavy cream and whip on low for 30 seconds.
Stop the mixer and scrape down the bowl with a rubber spatula.
Turn mixer on medium-high speed and beat for two minutes, or until mixture is thick.
Turn off mixer, then fold in raspberries until just combined.
Pour into cooled pie pan and spread evenly.
Freeze for two hours, or until very firm.
Cut into slices and top each slice with cookie crumbs, dollops of whipped cream, and extra raspberries.
Keep in freezer, allowing time to thaw before serving.
e10d62e4d9.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a food processor, pulse the cookies until they are in fine crumbs.
Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Stir in the sugar and raspberries.
Cook until the berries are soft and the sugar has dissolved.
Remove from heat and stir in the yogurt, pudding mix, and cream.
Pour into a 9-inch pie plate.
Refrigerate until set, about 2 hours.
Garnish with extra raspberries.

55412fa6ca.gt:
Combine butter, sugar, corn syrup and spices in a saucepan.
Over low-medium heat, stir ingredients constantly until ingredients look like they are about to boil.
Remove from heat and transfer to a mixing bowl.
Allow sugar mixture to cool to room temperature.
Stirring occasionally might help speed up this process.
Stir eggs into cooled sugar mixture.
Sift flour and baking soda together and add to sugar mixture.
Mix well.
Roll dough into a ball.
Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 8-12 hours or overnight.
Split dough into 2 parts; Roll dough about 1/4-inch thick on a clean, floured surface.
Cut into desired shapes.
Bake in preheated oven at 350F for about 10-15 minutes, or until firm to the touch.
Cookies can be left plain, or decorated with pipped icing.
NOTE: This makes a crisp cookie, if a softer cookie is desired you may substitute brown sugar for the granulated sugar.
55412fa6ca.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add corn syrup, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, allspice, orange zest, and beaten eggs.
Mix well.
Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add to butter mixture and mix until well blended.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

613e75a520.gt:
In a large bowl, mix mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, sugar and salt until combined.
Add cabbage mix, apples, celery and raisins to bowl with dressing, toss well.
Cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes to allow cabbage to soften.
To serve, sprinkle with walnuts.
Garnish with radishes.
613e75a520.pred:
In a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, sugar, and salt.
Add the coleslaw mix, apples, and celery.
Toss to coat.
Add the raisins and walnuts.
Toss again.
Garnish with radishes and serve.

96d86ade02.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Spray baking dish with cooking spray.
Add chicken pieces and season with garlic powder and onion powder.
Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes.
In a bowl, mix barbecue sauce, honey, ginger, and Worcestershire sauce.
Pour evenly over chicken and bake uncovered for 20-25 additional minutes or until sauce thickens and internal temperature is 180F.
96d86ade02.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine barbecue sauce, honey, ginger, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and onion powder in a large bowl.
Place chicken pieces in a large roasting pan and pour sauce mixture over top.
Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Serve with rice and vegetables.

9f341bf6c9.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Grease a 9x9" pan.
Melt white chocolate and butter in the top of a double boiler, or in microwave on med power.
Set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, beat eggs until foamy.
Gradually add the sugar and vanilla, mixing constantly.
Drizzle in the melted white chocolate mixture.
Combine the flour and salt and fold into the white chocolate mixture.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Do not over-bake.
4.
Serve heated.
Top with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, some real whipped cream and a drizzle of chocolate sauce.
9f341bf6c9.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the butter, white chocolate, vanilla, and sugar.
Beat until smooth.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the flour, salt, and chocolate chips.
Spread the batter in the prepared pan.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before cutting into squares.

5af1409bc9.gt:
Pick over the lentils, discarding any misshapen lentils or stones.
Rinse the lentils until the water runs clear, then drain.
In a saucepan over high heat, combine the lentils, water, turmeric and the 1 teaspoon ghee.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Reduce the heat to medium, cover and simmer until the lentils are soft and tender, about 30 minutes.
In a frying pan over medium-high heat, warm the remaining 2 tablespoons ghee.
When hot, add the mustard seeds and fry until they turn gray, spatter, and pop, about 2 minutes.
Add the chillies, onion, garlic, ginger and curry leaves and saute until the onion is soft and golden, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the garam masala and tomatoes ad cook for 1 minute.
Pour the onion mixture into the pan of cooked lentils, add the salt and simmer for 5 minutes to blend the flavours.
Transfer to a serving dish and serve.
5af1409bc9.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine lentils, water, turmeric, ghee, mustard seeds, chiles, onion, garlic, ginger, curry leaves, garam masala, and tomatoes.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and serve.

53797b9666.gt:
Mix together the egg, milk, and sugar in a deep bowl or tupperware container.
If you mix up the egg whites to break them up thoroughly, and it'll turn out better.
Cut the frozen bread into 4 pieces.
Use a skewer to poke holes into it.
It's hard for the egg mixture to get absorbed near the crusts, so be sure to poke holes there!
Soak the bread in the egg mixture.
After about two minutes, flip the bread over.
The bread is soft, so if you're worried about breaking it, use a spatula to flip.
Once both sides have completely soaked, fry it up and enjoy!
This is a version made without cutting up the bread.
It might look a bit unappealing with all those holes, but you won't be able to tell at all after it's been fried!
If it's too soft, it can break, but you can use a spatula to safely flip it over.
You can make more french toast with the remaining egg mixture if you like, but I like to pour it over the bread to fill in the holes!
!
53797b9666.pred:
Mix the egg, milk, and sugar together in a bowl.
Add the bread to the mixture and let it sit for 10 minutes.
Heat a frying pan over medium heat.
Dip the bread in the egg mixture and place it in the frying pan.
Cook for 2 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.
Serve with butter and syrup.

20f8403190.gt:
Plunge the tomatoes into boiling water and then into iced water to remove their skins.
Chop the tomatoes and set aside.
In a stockpot, saute the onions and celery in the oil over medium heat until tender, 5 minutes.
Stir in the garlic, zucchini, corn and saute for another 2 minutes.
Add the broth and bring to a boil.
Add the tomatoes, salt and basil.
Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the pasta, cover and simmer for 30 minutes (Seems rather a long time to me!
).
Sprinkle with the pepper & serve hot.
20f8403190.pred:
In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, and celery.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes, zucchini, corn, and stock.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in basil and pasta.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook until pasta is tender, about 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

ce8b9b020c.gt:
Preheat oven to Grill/Broil.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat.
Add chicken and garlic and saute until chicken juices run clear, about 7 to 10 minutes.
Drain fat from skillet and stir in sauce.
Place chicken mixture on a cookie sheet and broil in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until browned.
Let sit about 5 minutes to allow sauce to thicken.
ce8b9b020c.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, oil, and garlic.
Stir to coat the chicken with the oil and garlic.
Set aside.
In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Add the stir-fry sauce and stir to coat the chicken.
Cook for 1 minute, or until the sauce is heated through.
Serve over rice.

6a59d0004a.gt:
Combine potato cubes, carrot pieces, chopped onions and cilantro in large bowl.
In a small bowl whisk together dressing ingredients and pour over salad ingredients.
Gently combine tomato chunks with the rest of the salad.
Chill and allow flavors to blend.
6a59d0004a.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Chill for 1 hour.
Serve with a nice green salad and corn bread.

bf7afbd2d2.gt:
In a large mixing bowl combine lettuce, carrots, cilantro, olive oil, lime juice, and salt and pepper to taste.
Lay out tortillas and divide mixture among tortillas; top with turkey breast strips.
Fold in half and enjoy.
Serves 2.
bf7afbd2d2.pred:
Combine all ingredients except the lime juice and salt and pepper.
Place turkey, carrots, and lettuce in a bowl and toss with the oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Divide turkey mixture evenly among the tortillas.
Top each with a squeeze of lime juice and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

4eef71a937.gt:
Pare and cut eggplant into 1/2 inch slices.
Set oven control at broil and/or 550 degrees.
Place eggplant slices on rack in broiler pan.
Brush butter on slices; season with salt and pepper.
Broil with tops about 3 inches from heat until eggplant is hot and tender.
about 6 minutes.
In a small saucepan, heat tomato sauce and garlic powder, stirring occasionally.
Serve on eggplant slices.
4eef71a937.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut eggplant into 1/2 inch slices.
Place eggplant slices in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Brush with butter or margarine.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and brush with tomato sauce.
Sprinkle with garlic powder, pepper and salt.
Bake for 10 minutes more.

daa0bc21ff.gt:
Preheat oven to 350
Mix cake mix as directed on box.grease and flour pan.
Pour batter into pan.13 x 9 " cake pan.
Mix other 3 ing.
Creme well.swirl cheese in cake.
Top with rest of chips
Bake 350 for about 25 to 35 min.
daa0bc21ff.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix cake mix, creme cheese, egg and sugar until well blended.
Stir in choc chips.
Spread batter into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before cutting into squares.

16241b3374.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and move a rack to the middle of the oven.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.
Combine the peanut butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, vanilla extract and egg in a large bowl and stir until fully combined.
Form 24 balls, 1-inch in diameter, and set evenly spaced apart on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake until lightly browned and crisp on the edges, 15 minutes.
Remove the cookies from the oven, and cool for 5 minutes.
Use your thumb or the back of a spoon to press into the middle of each cookie to create an indent about 1/4-inch deep.
Spoon 1/2 teaspoon of the chocolate-hazelnut spread into each cookie indent, refrigerate until the chocolate-hazelnut filling is no longer runny, 10 to 15 minutes.
Cook's Notes: These tasty cookies last for up to 2 weeks.
16241b3374.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together peanut butter, sugars, and vanilla.
Beat in egg.
Stir in chocolate hazelnut spread.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls.
Place on a baking sheet.
Press thumb into center of each ball.
Bake 10-12 minutes or until edges are golden brown.
Cool 5 minutes on baking sheet.
Remove to wire racks to cool completely.

82cd89c4d9.gt:
To steam the chicken tenders: Arrange the chicken on a plate and sprinkle on the ingredients marked with in order.
Place the rosemary (or other herb) on top, wrap it with plastic wrap and cook it at 700W for 1 minute and 30 seconds.
Turn the chicken over and cook it for another 1 minute.
The cooking time depends on the size of the chicken.
Check the chicken when you turn it over, and adjust the cooking time if necessary.
Leave the chicken, with the plastic on, until they are cool.
Shred the chicken from Step 2 with your hand.
Onions: Thinly slice the onion and soak it in water for about 10 minutes.
Drain in a colander and pat dry with paper towels.
Daikon sprout: Cut in half lengths.
In a bowl, mix the ingredients marked with to make the dressing.
Mix the chicken from Step 3 and onion from Step 4 with the dressing.
Add the daikon sprout and toss them evenly.
Serve it on a plate and garnish with the bonito flakes.
I used Cinzano Dry Vermouth; a blend of white wine with essences of herbs and spices, instead of white wine.
This flavorful drink is good for cooking and drinking.
82cd89c4d9.pred:
In a microwave safe bowl, combine the chicken tenders, shio-koji, pepper, and wine.
Microwave on high for 2 minutes.
Remove and stir.
Microwave for 1 minute more.
Let cool.
Combine the olive oil, rosemary, onion, and bonito flakes in a small bowl.
Microwave on high for 1 minute.
Remove and stir.
Microwave for 1 minute more.
Let cool.
Combine the daikon sprouts, ponzu, sugar, salt and pepper in a small bowl.
Microwave on high for 1 minute.
Remove and stir.
Microwave for 1 minute more.
Let cool.
Put the chicken tenders in a serving bowl and top with the daikon sprout mixture.

6a73994e58.gt:
Grease 13x9 inch pan.
Mix butter or margarine, sugar, vanilla, egg in medium bowl with hand mixer.
Dont over mix.
Stir in flour and baking powder until dough forms.
Pat evenly into pan.
Spread jam or jelly on top of dough.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes at 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Top with powder sugar glaze.
6a73994e58.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease 13x9x2 inch pan.
In large bowl, beat butter and sugar with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy.
Add vanilla and egg; beat well.
In medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add flour mixture to butter mixture; beat on low speed until well blended.
Spread batter evenly in prepared pan.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool completely in pan on wire rack.
Cut into bars.

8237def972.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 375.2.
To prepare cake, combine rhubarb and 2 tablespoons flour in a medium bowl; toss well to coat.3.
Place brown sugar and 5 tablespoons butter in a large bowl; beat with a mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add sour cream, rind, and vanilla; beat until well combined.4.
Lightly spoon 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour and whole wheat flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife.
Combine flours, baking soda, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and salt, stirring with a whisk.
Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture, beating at low speed just until combined.
Fold in rhubarb mixture.
Spread batter into a 9-inch square baking pan coated with cooking spray.5.
To prepare streusel, combine turbinado sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in a small bowl.
Cut in 2 tablespoons butter with a pastry blender or 2 forks until mixture is crumbly; stir in nuts.
Sprinkle streusel evenly over batter.
Bake at 375 for 50 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8237def972.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine the rhubarb, flour, brown sugar, butter, eggs, sour cream, orange rind, vanilla, and 1 cup flour.
Stir until well blended.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool completely.
In a small bowl, combine the turbinado sugar, cinnamon, and butter.
Cut the cake into 8 slices.
Place 1 slice on each plate.
Sprinkle with streusel.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

ff146bd853.gt:
NOTES: You MUST use butter or oil; margarine will not work.
A large cast-iron skillet works best for this, but any large non-stick skillet will work.
This recipe will work with nearly any type of boneless fish fillets, but catfish seems to be one of the tastiest.
This recipe produces a LOT of smoke, so make sure you have a good vent above your stove, or open some doors and/or windows.
Mix all dry ingredients together.
Coat fillets evenly with mixture.
Heat small amount of butter or oil in skillet until hot.
Place fillets in skillet.
Cook 3-5 minutes on each side.
Change butter or oil if it gets too black.
ff146bd853.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place catfish in a baking dish.
Mix together black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, parsley flakes, ground red pepper, salt, oregano, and thyme.
Pour butter or oil over the catfish and sprinkle with the spice mixture.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with a side of rice and a green vegetable.

820cb37cdd.gt:
1.
Brown the onion in the olive oil until turning translucent.
Add the garlic.
2.
Add both sausage and beef, break into very small pieces and cook through.
3.
Add spices and seasonings, remove from heat.
Drain and cool.
In a food processor, add ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg, and the sausage/ground beef mixture.
Process together until it reaches an almost paste-like consistency.
Refrigerate until ready to use.
Can also be frozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the Italian sausage and ground sirloin and cook until browned, about 10 minutes.
Add the paprika, Italian seasoning, fennel, red pepper flakes, and cook for 1 minute.
Add the ricotta and Parmesan cheeses and stir until combined.
Remove from heat and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine the filling ingredients and mix well.
Set aside.
In a large pot of boiling water, cook the ravioli according to package directions.
Drain and place the ravioli on a baking sheet.
Spoon the filling over the ravioli and bake in the preheated oven until the filling is bubbly and the ravioli is cooked through, about 15 minutes.

b9f129d26e.gt:
Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add ham, green chiles, and mushrooms; saute 5 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Wipe pan clean.Place 1 tortilla in pan.
Sprinkle 2 tablespoons cheese over half of tortilla; arrange 1/2 cup ham mixture over cheese.
Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cheese; fold in half.
Cook 1 minute on each side or until cheese melts.
Repeat procedure with remaining tortillas, cheese, and ham mixture.

295fa6c307.gt:
Combine oil and garlic in a small bowl and rub the mushroom caps on all sides with the mixture.
Place caps, top side down, in a circle on an oiled baking sheet.
Season with salt and pepper.
Arrange the cheese, basil, and tomato slices alternately in a circle on top of the mushrooms.
Sprinkle with oregano, if using.
Bake at 450 until the cheese melts, about 3 minutes.
295fa6c307.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
Place the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook until the garlic is golden brown, about 1 minute.
Add the mushrooms and cook until they are soft, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Spread the mushrooms evenly on the portobello mushroom caps.
Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese on top of the mushrooms.
Sprinkle with oregano leaves, if desired.
Place the mushroom caps on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
Slice the pizza into 8 pieces and serve.

ea6256f97c.gt:
Beat margarine or butter and granulated sugar in a medium mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, sour cream, and vanilla; beat until well combined.
Stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add to butter sugar mixture; beat until combined.
Stir in raisins and 2/3 cup of fruit cake mix.
Spread batter evenly into a greased and floured 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Stir together brown sugar, cinnamon, pecans, and 1/3 cup of fruit cake mix.
Sprinkle evenly over batter and pat down.
Bake in a 350F oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
Serve warm or cooled.
ea6256f97c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.
In a large bowl, cream together margarine or butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Beat in sour cream and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with sour cream, beating well after each addition.
Stir in raisins, fruitcake mix, and brown sugar.
Fold in pecans and fruitcake mix.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
Remove from pan; cool completely on wire rack.

56c2b059eb.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In four small cast iron skillets or one medium skillet, crumble half the cookie dough into small pieces, spreading in an even layer over bottom of skillet(s).
Drizzle hot fudge sauce over cookie dough.
Crumble remaining cookie dough on top of hot fudge, making sure to spread in an even layer.
Bake for 1820 minutes, or until top is golden brown and set.
Remove skillet(s) from oven and allow to cool slightly.
Serve with vanilla ice cream and extra hot fudge sauce, if desired.
Enjoy!
56c2b059eb.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Unroll the cookie dough and press it into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and spread hot fudge sauce over the cookie dough.
Sprinkle with vanilla ice cream if desired.
Bake for 10 minutes more.
Serve warm.

30db4ac55b.gt:
Warm milk in a saucepan on medium heat.
add all morsels to milk and mix until smooth, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and whisk in peanut butter until smooth.
Stir in Boiling water.
Serve immediately or keep in small crockpot.
Dip Apple Slices, Pretzel Rods, Marshmallows and even cooked bacon!
30db4ac55b.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the milk, butterscotch chips, peanut butter, and boiling water.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and stir in apple, marshmallows, pretzel rod, and bacon.
Serve warm in a fondue pot or bowl.

3f59ab0d36.gt:
Combine flour, salt, pepper in a ziplock bag .
Add chicken, shake to coat.
Heat oil and butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook until browned on all sides (about 5 mins).
Place in crockpot.
After removing chicken, put stock in the skillet and heat for 5 mins.
Pour into crockpot.
Add lemon juice, mushrooms and garlic to crockpot.
Cook on low for 2 hours.
Mix cornstarch and water, then add to crockpot.
Add remaining seasonings and capers.
Increase to high heat and cook for 30 mins.
Serve over rice and broccoli.
Top with parsley if desired.

Place chicken in crockpot.

Dredge chicken in flour mixture.
Place chicken in crockpot.
Pour chicken stock over chicken.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours.

Place chicken on a plate.

Pour sauce over chicken.
Place chicken in crockpot.

Place chicken on a plate.
