bce4690032.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a baking sheet (or 2) with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, chile powder and salt.
With a stand mixer, beat the butter and reserved bacon fat drippings on medium-high until smooth, about 1 minute.
Beat in the white and brown sugar until creamy, about 4 minutes.
Then add the egg and vanilla and beat until fluffy for about 2 minutes.
Reduce the speed of the mixer to low and add the flour.
Mix until just combined and then add in the chocolate chips and crispy bacon.
Form the cookie dough into 12 even-sized balls and arrange them on the cookie sheet about 2 inches apart from each other.
Flatten the cookie balls with your fingers and then bake for 12-14 minutes until golden brown.
Let the cookies cool for about 2 minutes on the baking sheet before transferring to a cooling rack.
bce4690032.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, chile powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream butter with sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg and vanilla.
Add flour mixture to creamed mixture alternately with reserved bacon drippings, beginning and ending with flour mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips and bacon.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

ad5d547737.gt:
Cut each cheese piece into 4 chunks; cut each cucumber half into 8 chunks.
Thread cheese and cucumbers onto 16 (6-inch) wooden skewers with all remaining ingredients except dressing.
Place on platter.
Drizzle with dressing.
ad5d547737.pred:
Place the cheese, cucumber, tomatoes, olives, and arugula in a large bowl.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Serve on a stick.

bd5e6fafa2.gt:
Stir the eggs and Parmesan cheese together in a bowl; set aside.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook the zucchini in the hot oil until softened and lightly browned, about 7 minutes.
Season the zucchini with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium; pour the egg mixture into the skillet.
Cook, stirring gently, for about 3 minutes.
Remove the skillet from the heat and cover.
Keep covered off the heat until the eggs set, about 2 minutes more.
bd5e6fafa2.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the zucchini and garlic powder and cook until the zucchini is tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the eggs, beating them lightly with a fork.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are set, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot.

ecab1caf21.gt:
Heat a 12 inch skillet over high heat for 4 minutes.
Toss shrimp with 1/2 of the red pepper flakes, 2T oil, 3/4 t salt.
Add shrimp to hot skillet quickly arrange in single layer sear until bottom of shrimp forms small spots of crust about 30 seconds.
Remove from heat and turn shrimp over and add cognac pause until cognac has warmed up slightly about 5 seconds,return to high heat ignite cognac shaking pan when flames are out about 15-30 seconds later pour shrimp into bowl set aside.
Allow skillet to cool return to burner over low heat add 3T oil, 3T garlic; saute until sticky about 7-10 minutes.
Add the rest of the red pepper flakes, 3/4t salt, sugar, tomatoes, and wine; heat on medium high and then simmer until thickened, about 8 minutes.
Stir in shrimp with accumulated juices, remaining 1T garlic and parsley; simmer until shrimp is heated through, about 1 minute.
Take off heat stir in 1T olive oil.
Cook pasta in salted water save 1/3 cup pasta water; drain.
In a pot add pasta 1/2 cup sauce (no shrimp) add 2-3T pasta water toss.
Put some pasta on plates top with sauce and shrimp.
ecab1caf21.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the shrimp and cook, stirring, until they turn pink, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, the crushed red pepper, garlic, sugar, tomatoes, wine, and 1/2 cup water.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour the tomato mixture over the shrimp in the skillet and stir to combine.
Transfer the shrimp mixture to a 13-by-9-inch baking dish and bake until the shrimp are just cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the linguine in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente, about 10 minutes.
Drain the linguine and toss with the shrimp mixture.
Transfer the linguine to the baking dish and bake until the shrimp are cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Sprinkle with the parsley and serve.

12f49a25e6.gt:
Take the meat out of the fridge at least 30 minutes before cooking and pound it to tenderize.
Use your hands to re-shape the meat back into it's original thickness and season with salt and pepper.
In a pan that is hot enough to cause the beef fat to smoke, cook one side of the meat on a strong heat until browned.
Flip it over and cook the other side for 1 minute.
Then flip over again and cook for another 1 minute to finish.
Pour over your choice of sauce and serve.
I recommend this steak sauce,.
By the way, this is the dinner that I made for my husband's birthday.
12f49a25e6.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.
Sprinkle the beef with salt and pepper.
Add the beef tallow (or vegetable oil, butter) to the skillet and heat until the fat is melted.
Place the beef on the skillet and sear for 2 minutes.
Flip the beef and sear for another 2 minutes.
Remove the beef from the skillet and place on a plate.
Pour the sauce over the beef and serve.

0979acfd51.gt:
Slice the sausages diagonally.
Heat the oil in a pan, and fry the sausage until browned.
Sprinkle on a generous amount of cracked black pepper.
The sausages are done when they are close to becoming burnt.
If you have the time, top them with a sunny-side-up egg.
The creaminess of the egg yolk is divine.
0979acfd51.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place fish sausages on a baking sheet.
Drizzle oil over the fish sausages.
Sprinkle cracked black pepper over the fish sausages.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Serve with a side of tartar sauce.

03e7833d34.gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Heat oil in medium skillet on medium heat.
Add ham, peppers and onions; cook 5 to 7 min.
or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Remove from heat.
Stir in salsa.
Beat eggs and sour cream with whisk until blended.
Arrange 6 tortilla halves on bottom of 13x9-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray.
Spread half the vegetable mixture over tortillas; cover with half of the egg mixture and 1/2 cup cheese.
Repeat all layers starting with tortillas.
Top with remaining tortillas.
Let stand 5 min.
Bake 25 min.
Top with remaining cheese; bake 5 min.
or until melted.
03e7833d34.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Mix oil, ham, peppers, onion, and salsa in large bowl.
Add eggs and sour cream; mix well.
Spread 1/2 cup salsa in bottom of 13x9-inch baking dish.
Arrange 3 tortillas on bottom of dish; top with 1/2 of the ham mixture.
Repeat layers.
Bake 30 min.
or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool 5 min.
before cutting into 12 pieces.

0f967b0694.gt:
In a large bowl, toss together the spinach, cranberries, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado and red onion; set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together jam, vinegar, walnut oil, pepper and salt.
Taste, and adjust amounts to suit your liking.
Pour over the salad and toss to coat.
0f967b0694.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the spinach, cranberries, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado, onion, raspberry jam, vinegar, walnut oil, pepper, and salt.
Toss well to combine.

db70371f36.gt:
Sprinkle gelatin over juice in a small heatproof cup and let stand 1 minute to soften.
Puree mangoes with sugar in a blender until very smooth and force through a sieve into a large bowl.
Melt softened gelatin in cup in a pan of simmering water or in a microwave and stir into puree.
Beat cream with an electric mixer until it just holds stiff peaks and gently fold into puree.
Chill fool, covered, at least 8 hours.
db70371f36.pred:
In a small bowl, dissolve the gelatin in the lime juice.
Set aside.
In a blender, puree the mango flesh with the sugar and cream.
Pour into 4 dessert dishes.
Refrigerate until set.
To make the chocolate-anise straws: Melt the chocolate and anise in a double boiler.
Dip the straws in the chocolate-anise mixture.
Place on a waxed paper-lined baking sheet.
Refrigerate until set.
Serve with the mango fool.

3d6a127178.gt:
Combine the ingredients and mix well.
Add the chikuwa sticks and coat.
Pour about 1 cm of oil in a pan, then evenly fry the chikuwa until crisp.
Sprinkle with black pepper while hot.
I recommend wrapping them halfway in parchment paper and munching on them as finger food.
3d6a127178.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the ingredients.
Place the chikuwa in a shallow bowl and pour the curry mixture over it.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 350F.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Remove the chikuwa from the curry mixture and pat dry with paper towels.
Place the chikuwa on the baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Turn the chikuwa over and bake for 10 minutes more.
Serve with the black pepper and parsley.

0ce6309a49.gt:
Preheat the oven broiler.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add linguine, and cook for 9 to 13 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Brush the mushrooms with 1/2 the olive oil, and arrange on a medium baking sheet.
Broil in the prepared oven 6 to 8 minutes, turning frequently, until browned and tender.
Cut the mushrooms into 1/4 inch slices, and place in a medium bowl.
Mix with the remaining olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, basil, rosemary, garlic, and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss together cooked linguine and the mushroom mixture.
0ce6309a49.pred:
Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the olive oil and garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the vinegar and season with salt and pepper.
Cook for 2 minutes.
Add the pasta and toss to coat.
Add the herbs and toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

fb12110aad.gt:
Brown beef strips in 1 tablespoon oil in nonstick skillet; cook 1 to 2 minutes.
Stir in cooking sauce and sour cream.
Simmer 8 minutes or until sauce thickens, stirring occasionally.
Serve over noodles.
fb12110aad.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large skillet and heat through.
Serve over hot cooked noodles.

d8fd0d2fdf.gt:
Heat oven to 375F; Grease cookie sheets.
In large bowl, combine butter and cream cheese; beat until smooth; Add sweetened condensed milk and egg; blend well.
Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off; Add flour and brownie mix; mix well; (Reserve enclosed chocolate-flavored syrup packet for topping) Stir in pecans, coconut and chocolate chips; Drop dough by heaping tablespoonfuls 1 inch apart onto greased cookie sheets.
Bake at 375F for 9 to 12 minutes or until set; Cool 1 minute; remove from cookie sheets; Cool completely.
Cut very small hole in corner of reserved chocolate-flavored syrup packet; lightly drizzle over cooled cookies Store in tightly covered container.
d8fd0d2fdf.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the butter, cream cheese, and sweetened condensed milk.
Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until well blended.
Add the egg and beat until smooth.
Stir in the flour, brownie mix, pecans, coconut, and chocolate chips.
Spread the batter in the prepared pan.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before cutting into bars.

c3b113f071.gt:
Cook bacon and set aside.
Fry beef with mushrooms and salt and pepper (or seasoning of your choice).
Unroll crescent triangles on baking sheet.
Add a thick slice of cheese, bacon, beef mixture and green onions to each triangle and roll up.
Place a thin piece of cheese on top of roll.
Cook stuffed crescent rolls as per the package instructions and ENJOY!
!
c3b113f071.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, brown beef over medium heat.
Drain and add to a bowl.
Add in the bacon, cheese, green onion, mushrooms, salt and pepper.
Mix together.
Unroll crescent rolls and place on a baking sheet.
Spoon beef mixture down the center of each roll.
Roll up and place seam side down on the baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.

dc27b2826e.gt:
Mix cream cheese and sugar well with mixer.
Add vanilla and Cool Whip; mix well.
MUST be refrigerated, except when serving.
Ices 1 triple layer cake or 2 other cakes.
When using on layers just ice top of layers and let icing ooze over sides.
It's easy and attractive to take somewhere.
Hi Tankers, Thanks so much for your honest review, what went wrong for you on making this?
A comment about what didn't work would help.
Maybe this recipe needs some tweaking.
Thanks,.
Teresa M.
dc27b2826e.pred:
In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth.
Add vanilla and beat until well blended.
Fold in Cool Whip and mix until well combined.
Pour over cake and spread evenly.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

400bc3b0e1.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Place baking mix, granulated sugar, sour cream, egg, water and extract in large bowl.
Beat with electric mixer on low speed just until moistened, stopping frequently to scrape bottom and side of bowl.
Beat on medium speed 2 min.
; set aside.
Melt butter in small saucepan on medium heat.
Add brown sugar; cook 1 min.
or until completely dissolved, stirring constantly.
Pour into 9-inch round cake pan.
Top with apricot slices; sprinkle with almonds.
Cover with batter.
Bake 30 to 35 min.
or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Immediately run knife or metal spatula around rim of pan to loosen cake; invert onto serving plate.
Cool completely.
400bc3b0e1.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease a 9-inch springform pan.
In a large bowl, combine the baking mix, sugar, sour cream, egg, water and almond extract.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed until blended.
Pour into the prepared pan.
Bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
Invert the cake onto a serving plate.
Sprinkle with the brown sugar and almonds.

91462bb341.gt:
Preheat oven to 400.
Combine bread crumbs, Italian seasoning and garlic powder in shallow dish.
Dip chicken in egg, then crumb mixture; turn to coat.
Arrange chicken in 13 x 9-inch baking dish.
Bake 20 minutes.
Pour Sauce over chicken; top with cheese.
Bake an additional 10 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked.
Serve over spaghetti.
91462bb341.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Spread breadcrumbs on a plate.
Dip chicken in egg, then coat with breadcrumbs.
Place chicken on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with sauce.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake for 5 minutes longer.

836615e74d.gt:
Place all ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until tamarind is broken up.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved and mixture just comes to a boil, about 10 minutes.
Turn off heat and let cool slightly, at least 10 minutes.
Once cool, strain mixture into a container with a tightfitting lid; discard solids.
Store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
836615e74d.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool.
Store in an airtight container.

0a98a1820b.gt:
In a large pot, bring 2 cups of dry split peas and 6 cups of water to a full boil.
Add the sage and salt.
Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook covered for 40-50 minutes, until peas are soft and soup is thickened and creamy.
Preheat the oven to 400 F. Cut the eggplants in half lengthwise, drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil and some salt on the cut side flesh.
Place the eggplants skin-side up on a baking sheet.
Bake for 30 minutes or until the flesh is very soft.
While the eggplant is roasting and split peas are cooking, put the onion and 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook onions until soft and browned, about 15 minutes.
Then remove from heat and set aside.
Add the cooked split peas into a blender and blend until creamy.
Transfer the split peas back into the large pot.
Scoop the eggplant flesh into the blender and discard the skin.
Add the sauteed onion and a cup of the vegetable broth in with the eggplant and blend until smooth.
Transfer the eggplant mixture into the large pot with the split peas.
Add the remaining vegetable stock and bring to a gentle boil so that everything is heated through.
Then remove from heat.
Serve with shredded cheese on top.
0a98a1820b.pred:
In a large pot, combine the split peas, water, sage, salt, and olive oil.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes.
Add the eggplant, onion, and vegetable broth.
Simmer for 45 minutes, or until the eggplant is tender.
Cool slightly.
Puree the soup in a blender or food processor.
Return the soup to the pot and reheat.
Serve with a drizzle of olive oil and fresh sage leaves, if desired.

9204d73f68.gt:
Chop parsley and put aside.
Juice lemon and put aside.
Melt 2 tbs.
butter and the olive oil in non-stick skillet
Lightly dust fish fillets in flour, season if desired with salt and pepper.
When butter stops bubbling, add fish and saute 3-4 min on first side.
Turn and finish second side 3-4 min, until done and flaky.
Remove to plate and keep warm.
Add remaining 2tbs.
butter to skillet and melt.
Stir in lemon juice and parsley quickly and pour immediately over fish.
Serve and enjoy.
9204d73f68.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, 1/4 cup of the parsley, 1/2 tablespoon of the butter, and 1/2 tablespoon of the olive oil.
Set aside.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the butter over medium heat.
Add the fish and cook for 3 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Remove from skillet and keep warm.
In a small bowl, combine the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of the butter, the flour, and the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of the olive oil.
Stir until smooth.
Add the remaining 1/4 cup parsley and the lemon juice mixture.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Add the remaining 1/4 cup parsley and serve over the fish.

dbe7c0f305.gt:
Bring water to a boil.
Add the salt.
Gradually whisk in cornmeal, then reduce to low heat and cook until thick and tender (about 15 minutes).
Remove from heat and stir in the parmesan, milk, butter, herbs, and pepper.
dbe7c0f305.pred:
In a large saucepan, bring the water to a boil.
Add the salt, cornmeal, and milk.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and the cornmeal is tender.
Remove from heat and stir in the butter, parsley, rosemary, thyme, and pepper.
Serve hot.

59f0023fcf.gt:
Cut tops off peppers and remove insides
Mix ground beef, rice, and taco seasoning in mixing bowl
Fill peppers with mix.
You shouldn't have any left over.
Stuff them!
Place filled peppers in crock pot
Spoon a little rotel on top of each pepper.
Pour remainder into bottom of crockpot (gives a little extra juice)
Cook on low 6-8 hours and high 3-4 hours.
(The uncooked meat will cook the pepper.
No need to precook the beef or add any liquid)
20-30 minutes before meal time add cheese on top of each pepper.
Enjoy!
59f0023fcf.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Cut bell peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds and membranes.
Place peppers in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat.
Drain off fat.
Stir in spanish rice, rotel, taco seasoning and 1 cup of cheese.
Spoon mixture into peppers.
Top with remaining cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour.
Uncover and bake for 15 minutes more or until peppers are tender.

a0ea3e1280.gt:
Combine sugar, cream, half-and-half, milk, and instant espresso in a bowl and stir until sugar is completely dissolved.
Turn on your ice cream machine before pouring the ice cream mix into it.
Then pour it in and churn according to the manufacturers instructions.
Add toffee and chocolate chips about 2 minutes before the end of the churning cycle.
Serve right away if you want it soft or transfer to an airtight container and store in the freezer for at least 2 hours.
Use within 3 days.
Recipe makes about 1 1/2 quarts.
a0ea3e1280.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, whisk together the sugar and cream.
Add the half-and-half and whisk until combined.
Add the milk and espresso powder and whisk until smooth.
Fold in the toffee bits and mini chocolate chips.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes or until the edges are set and the center is still slightly jiggly.
Cool completely before serving.

aff56897c3.gt:
Combine all ingredients and stir.
Serve with sprinkled Parmesan cheese on top.
aff56897c3.pred:
In a large pot, combine the rice and peas.
Add the butter and stir until melted.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in the salt and pepper.
Add the bacon and stir until heated through.
Serve immediately.

e3d298ee57.gt:
Put the chopped pepper in a silicone steamer and microwave for 30 seconds at 700w.
Add the sugar, sesame and soy sauce.
Mix it all and you are done!
e3d298ee57.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Pour the mixture into a steamer basket and steam the pepper until tender.
Serve with rice or noodles.

10dc73989c.gt:
Cook pasta as directed on package, omitting salt.
Meanwhile, heat large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add shrimp, tomatoes and cream cheese spread; cook and stir 3 to 4 min.
or until cream cheese is melted and shrimp are done.
Drain pasta; place in large bowl.
Add spinach and shrimp mixture; mix lightly.
10dc73989c.pred:
Heat oven to 400F.
Cook pasta in large pot of boiling salted water until al dente; drain.
Meanwhile, in large skillet, cook shrimp in 1 Tbsp.
olive oil over medium-high heat until pink and firm, 2 to 3 minutes.
Transfer to plate; cover to keep warm.
Add tomatoes to skillet; cook over medium heat until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add cream cheese spread; cook, stirring, until melted.
Add spinach; cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Add shrimp to skillet; cook until heated through, about 1 minute.
Add cream; cook until thickened, about 1 minute.
Add pasta to skillet; toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

74728bdde9.gt:
1.
Prepare rice according to package.2.
Combine hoisin and next 5 ingredients in a bowl.
Reserve 4 teaspoons.3.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon canola oil.
Sprinkle fillets with salt.
Add two fillets to pan; cook 4 minutes.
Turn; brush each with 1 teaspoon hoisin mixture.
Cook 2 minutes.
Remove fish from pan.
Repeat with 1 tablespoon canola oil, 2 fillets, and 2 teaspoons hoisin mixture.4.
Heat a skillet over high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon canola oil.
Add peas and onions; saute 1 minute.
Add mushrooms; saute 2 minutes.
Place 1/2 cup rice onto each of 4 plates.
Top each with 1 fillet and 1/2 cup vegetables; drizzle with 1 teaspoon hoisin mixture.
74728bdde9.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the boil-in-bag brown rice, hoisin sauce, water, lower-sodium soy sauce, ginger, sesame oil, and black pepper.
Set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon of the canola oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the flounder fillets and cook until browned on both sides, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate and keep warm.
Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of canola oil in the same skillet.
Add the snow peas and cook until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes.
Add the shiitake mushrooms and cook until tender, about 2 minutes.
Add the sauce mixture and cook until the sauce thickens, about 1 minute.
Return the flounder fillets to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce.
Serve immediately.

49ba66ed9e.gt:
In a large saucepan, heat the butter or margarine and oil over medium heat.
Add the chicken and brown lightly on each side.
Once the chicken breasts are cooked (the juices should run clear) remove them from the pan and set aside.
Add the shallots and the chicken stock to the pan.
Simmer for 3 minutes.
Add the raspberry vinegar.
Bring all to a boil and simmer, stirring, until the mixture thickens.
Stir in the cream and return the chicken to the pan.
Heat for 1 minute to warm the chicken, turning the chicken pieces to coat with the sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
49ba66ed9e.pred:
In a large skillet, heat butter and oil over medium-high heat.
Add chicken breasts and cook until no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes per side.
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Add shallots to pan and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
Add chicken stock and vinegar and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until reduced by half, about 10 minutes.
Whisk in cream and return to a simmer.
Stir in chicken breasts and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

4bf00ac974.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
For crust, add enough milk to egg yolk to measure 2/3 cup; set aside.
In medium bowl, combine flour and salt.
Cut in butter until crumbly.
With fork, stir in milk mixture until dough forms a ball.
You may need to add a few teaspoons more of milk if dough is still too dry.
Divide into halves.
Roll out half of the dough, on lightly floured surface, into a 15x10-inch rectangle.
Place on bottom of ungreased 15x10x1-inch jelly-roll pan.
For Filling, sprinkle cereal over top of crust; layer apples over cereal.
In small bowl, combine 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon and nutmeg.
Sprinkle over apples.
Roll remaining half of dough into a 15 1/2-10 1/2-inch rectangle; place over apples.
In small bowl, beat egg white with fork until foamy; brush over top crust.
In another small bowl, stir together 2 tablespoons granulated sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon; sprinkle over top crust.
Bake for 45 to 60 minutes or until lightly browned.
For Glaze, in small bowl, stir together all glaze ingredients.
Drizzle over top crust while still warm.
Cut into bars.
4bf00ac974.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the egg yolk, egg white, milk, and flour.
Stir in the butter, corn flakes, apples, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Spread the mixture into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
Cool completely.
In a small bowl, combine the powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla.
Spread the mixture over the cooled bars.
Cut into bars and serve.

03e6762fab.gt:
Combine the potatoes, spinach, carrots, turnips, garlic, and lentils in a slow cooker.
Pour enough water over the mixture to cover.
In a bowl, stir the fresh basil, chili powder, cinnamon, dried basil, paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, ground ginger, sea salt, and black pepper; stir into the slow cooker.
Cover the cooker, and cook on High for 8 hours.
03e6762fab.pred:
In a large pot, saute the garlic in the water until fragrant.
Add the potatoes, carrots, turnips, and lentils.
Cover with water, or add enough to cover the vegetables.
Add the Cindy's Magical Motorvatin' Spice Mix and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the spinach and basil, and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve with a dollop of yogurt, if desired.

78d578c5e4.gt:
heat oven to 400, using a oven safe bowl, it can be a casserole dish to bake ur dip in.
it just needs to bake for 13 minutes
in a bowl put all ingredients, except 1 tablespoon of almonds, reserved till later.
mix well together, put in oven safe dish.
now sprinkle the reserved almonds on top.bake and use crackers to serve.enjoy
78d578c5e4.pred:
In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except almonds.
Mix well.
Serve with crackers.

d46cb1cc0e.gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
In a medium bowl, stir together the flour and baking powder; set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs until they are light and fluffy.
Gradually add sugar and beat for about 3 minutes.
Stir in the oil and anise extract.
Fold in the dry ingredients and blend well.
Spread the mixture into a 9x13 inch pan and bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the oven.
When the pan cools slightly, cut the cookie down the middle, lengthwise.
Cut each half into 1/2 inch slices.
Place slices onto a cookie sheet and return to the oven long enough to brown on each side, like toast.
Watch so you don't burn them!
:).
Store in a tightly covered container.
d46cb1cc0e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
Stir in oil and anise extract.
Add flour mixture to egg mixture and stir until well blended.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

ce64c17852.gt:
In blender, combine soymilk and orange juice; add papaya, strawberries, and, if desired, protein powder and honey.
Cover and blend until smooth.
ce64c17852.pred:
In a blender, combine the soy milk, orange juice, chilled papaya, and frozen strawberries.
Blend until smooth.
Add the powdered soy protein concentrate and honey if desired.
Blend again until smooth.
Serve immediately.

6e7daaa7a7.gt:
In large bowl, mix ground beef, bread crumbs, and onion soup mix.
Form into meatballs.
Place in 9x13" pan.
In saucepan, combine chili sauce, cranberry sauce, sauerkraut, brown sugar and water.
Simmer over low heat till mixed.
Pour over meatballs.
Bake at 325 for 2 hours.
6e7daaa7a7.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, breadcrumbs, onion soup mix, chili sauce, cranberry sauce, and sauerkraut.
Mix well.
Shape into 1-inch balls.
Place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Serve with brown sugar and water.

ff131d2047.gt:
Preheat oven to 425F.
Trim tips from asparagus, and chop stalks into 1/4-inch pieces.
Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in large bowl.
Cut butter into small pieces.
Using fingers, rub butter into flour mixture until mixture resembles coarse meal.
Stir in 3/4 cup buttermilk.
Fold in cheese, asparagus pieces (but not tips), cayenne and pepper.
Turn dough onto floured work surface, and knead 6 or 7 times.
Shape dough into 1/2-inch-thick rectangle.
Using sharp knife, cut rectangle lengthwise into three strips.
Cut each strip into triangles.
Place triangles on greased baking sheet.
Brush scones with remaining buttermilk, then press 2 or 3 asparagus tips into tops.
Bake 12 to 15 minutes, or until tops are golden brown.
ff131d2047.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in butter with a pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse meal.
Stir in buttermilk and cheese.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently 10 times.
Pat dough into a 1-inch-thick round.
Cut into 8 wedges.
Place wedges on a baking sheet and bake 15 minutes.
Turn wedges over and bake 10 minutes more.
Serve warm.

555c73c04a.gt:
Thoroughly combine seasoning mix ingredients in a small bowl and set aside.
Cook pasta according to package directions and set aside.
Heat a skillet over high heat until it is hot, about 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, stir chicken pieces into seasoning.
Mix well.
Add 2 oz butter to pan.
Add chicken pieces and brown them.
Add the green onions, parsley, garlic and stock.
Cook two minutes or until the sauce is at a rolling boil.
Add the remaining butter (cut into pats) stirring to incorporate.
Cook for 3 minutes and add the cooked pasta.
Mix well.
Serve immediately.
I like to add parmesan on top.
555c73c04a.pred:
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
Add onion powder, salt, pepper, sage, and thyme.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic powder, green onion, parsley, and garlic.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until green onions are wilted, about 2 minutes.
Add chicken stock and pasta.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer until pasta is tender, about 10 minutes.
Serve immediately.

7ea397998a.gt:
Place the potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, 8 to 10 minutes.
Drain and allow to steam dry for a minute or two.
Place potatoes in a large bowl.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat; grease with cooking spray.
Cook and stir the green beans and onion until tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the garlic; cook and stir until garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute more.
Transfer the green bean mixture into the large bowl with the potatoes.
Add the balsamic vinaigrette, roasted red peppers, and basil; toss lightly.
Stir in the goat cheese.
7ea397998a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 15 minutes.
Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil spray in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add green beans and cook until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes.
Add dressing and cook until heated through, about 1 minute.
Add potatoes, roasted peppers, and basil.
Toss to combine.
Sprinkle with goat cheese and serve warm.

7a39ad4f0a.gt:
In a large pot, combine the stock with the carrots, celery, onion, leek, potato, ginger, cumin, coriander, and cayenne, and bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer over low heat until the vegetables are tender, 20-25 minutes.
Working in batches, puree the soup in a food processor(or blender), then return to the pot.
Stir in buttermilk and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reheat gently.
Ladle into bowls, and sprinkle with the parsley and serve.
Enjoy!
7a39ad4f0a.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the broth, carrots, celery, onion, leek, sweet potato, ginger, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, buttermilk, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the parsley.
Serve hot.

fd91c2f3e6.gt:
Sift maizena and flour together
Add castor sugar
Rub butter into the dry ingredients and knead until a stiff dough its formed
Press dough into a 20 x 29cm greased baking tray
Mark the slices lightly and prick with a fork
Bake at 150C for 50 minutes
Once baked, drench the shortbread with castor sugar
Cut the shortbread into squares
Allow to cool and then enjoy
fd91c2f3e6.pred:
Preheat oven to 180C.
Mix flour, castor sugar and butter together in a bowl.
Add in the maizena and mix well.
Press into a ball and wrap in cling film.
Chill for 30 minutes.
Roll out on a floured surface to 1/2 cm thickness.
Cut into shapes and place on a greased baking tray.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Leave to cool on a wire rack.

243f0c78f6.gt:
In a small bowl, combine dressing ingredients, whisk and set aside.
In a really large salad bowl, combine cabbage, lettuce, cilantro and green onions and toss gently.
Sprinkle in the sesame seeds and peanuts.
Add the chicken.
Pour in the dressing and toss.
Enjoy!
243f0c78f6.pred:
In a large bowl, whisk together the hoisin sauce, peanut butter, brown sugar, and asian chili paste.
Add the ginger and rice vinegar and whisk until combined.
Add the chicken and sesame seeds and toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine the cabbage, lettuce, cilantro, carrots, scallions, and peanuts.
Toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Divide the chicken salad among 4 plates.
Top each salad with a scoop of the chicken mixture.

8198c69331.gt:
Place all ingredients in your bread machine in the order given.
Set bread machine to dough cycle.
IMPORTANT!
CHECK YOUR MACHINE WHILE IT IS KNEADING and ADD MORE WATER IF NEEDED 1 TABLESPOON AT A TIME.
The dough should not be too dry - it should look smooth and satiny after kneading for a few minutes.
When dough cycle is complete, remove dough from machine and shape into long loaf (like french bread).
Place on a cookie sheet and let loaf rise for about 45 minutes or until doubled in size.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until nicely browned.
You can also just cook this in your bread machine on the regular bread cycle if you want.
It still tastes great, you just don't get the cuban shaped loaf.
8198c69331.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine water, sugar, salt, and yeast.
Add bread flour and mix well.
Add 1 cup of the flour mixture to the bread machine.
Set the machine to the dough setting.
When the dough is ready, remove it from the machine and place on a lightly floured surface.
Knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes.
Place in a large greased bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and divide into 12 equal pieces.
Shape each piece into a ball.
Place on a greased baking sheet.
Cover with plastic wrap and let rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack.

3d413a0413.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. 2.
Wash potatoes well.
3.
Lay each potato on a cutting board.
4.
With a sharp knife, thinly slice each potato, being careful to NOT CUT all the way through.
(TIP: I lay a chopstick on each side of the potato so I dont accidentally cut too far.)
5.
Season each potato.
This is where you can get creative slide a sliver of garlic between the layers, or experiment with different herbs, butter, whatever sounds good to you!.
6.
Place potatoes in a baking dish that has been drizzled with olive oil.
7.
Drizzle potatoes with olive oil.
8.
Bake at 425 degrees for 40 minutes, or until the inside is tender.
9.
Enjoy!
3d413a0413.pred:
Put the potatoes in a large pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and cook until tender.
Drain and cool.
Cut each potato into 1/4 inch slices.
Place in a large bowl and toss with olive oil, salt and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.
Sprinkle with garlic slivers and onion slivers.
Bake for another 10 minutes.
Sprinkle with any spices you'd like to use.
Bake for 5-10 minutes more, until the potatoes are golden brown.

c6b05c501b.gt:
Spread 1 bread slice with peanut butter, then spread other bread slice with jam; close to make sandwich.
Cook in skillet sprayed with cooking spray on medium heat 3 min.
on each side or until sandwich is golden brown on both sides.
Let stand 1 min.
; cut into quarters.
c6b05c501b.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the peanut butter and jam.
Spread the peanut butter mixture on one slice of bread.
Top with the other slice of bread.
Cut into quarters.

b7aac475a1.gt:
Place haddock and water in a dutch oven and heat to boiling.
Cover and reduce heat to low and simmer approximately 10-15 minutes or until the fish is white and flakes easily.
Remove the halibut, reserving (set aside) the 'broth' (liquid); cut the haddock into bite size pieces.
Return 1 CUP of the reserved broth to the dutch oven.
Add the potatoes, onion and green pepper and simmer 15 minutes or just until the potatoes are tender.
Add the remaining broth, the haddock, tomato, milk, salt and pepper.
Heat until hot, but do not boil; sprinkle with cheese before serving.
b7aac475a1.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the haddock, water, potatoes, onion, bell pepper, tomatoes, milk, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in the cheese and cook until the cheese is melted and the soup is heated through.

4efef5709b.gt:
Preheat a heavy bottomed skille tover medium-high heat.
Pour in the oil and add the zucchini and jalapeno, sprinkle with the salt.
Saute for about 7 minutes, or until the zucchini is lightly browned.
Add the garlic, olives, cumin, and coriander, and saute for 2 minutes more.
Add the salsa verde and black beans and cook for 5 minutes.
The salsa should reduce a bit so its not soupy.
Mix the ingredients for the Garlic-Lemon Yogurt if your using.
Warm the tortillas in a skillet or wrap in a moist towel & nuke for a minute.
Assembly the tacos by adding the filling, yogurt, and topping with scallions.
Enjoy!
4efef5709b.pred:
Combine all ingredients except tortillas in a large bowl.
Stir in the corn tortillas.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Serve with salsa, yogurt, and lemon wedges.

7d71040d61.gt:
In a skillet, cook the spinach, stirring, until wilted; transfer to a colander and squeeze dry.
Finely chop the spinach.
In a bowl, combine 1 1/2 teaspoons of the soy sauce, the sesame oil, sherry, salt, sugar and white pepper.
Mix in the pork, scallion, ginger and spinach.
Chill for 10 minutes.
Dust a large baking sheet with cornstarch.
Arrange 4 wonton wrappers on a work surface, keeping the other wrappers covered with plastic wrap.
Brush the edges of the wrappers with water and spoon 1 teaspoon of filling in the center of each.
Fold the wrappers diagonally over the filling to form triangles; seal.
Bring the two opposite corners of the triangle together; press to seal.
Transfer to the baking sheet and cover.
Repeat.
In a large saucepan of boiling water, simmer the wontons over moderate heat, stirring occasionally.
When they float, cook for 3 minutes longer.
Drain the wontons well.
In a large bowl, combine the remaining soy sauce with the chile oil, peanut oil and garlic.
Add the wontons and toss.
Sprinkle with the cilantro and serve.
7d71040d61.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the spinach, soy sauce, sesame oil, sherry, salt, sugar, and pepper.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, combine the pork, scallion, ginger, cornstarch, and 1 tablespoon of the chile oil.
Set aside.
Lay out the wonton wrappers on a clean work surface.
Place a small amount of the spinach mixture in the center of each wrapper.
Fold the wrapper over the filling, pressing the edges to seal.
Roll the wontons into a crescent shape.
Place the wontons on a baking sheet.
Brush the tops with the remaining chile oil.
Sprinkle with cornstarch.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until the wontons are golden brown.
Remove from the oven and brush with the peanut oil.
Sprinkle with the cilantro.
Serve with the remaining soy sauce.

9d9d29f6e8.gt:
Slice the strawberries in about 1/2-inch size pieces.
Add about 1/3 of the strawberries to the bottom of the serving dish.
Next, add 1/2 of the whipped cream on top of the berries.
Then add 1/2 of the corn flakes on top of the whipped cream.
Add another layer of the strawberries (add about 3/4 of the remaining strawberries, leaving the rest of them for garnish).
Next add the remaining whipped cream, top with the corn flakes, and garnish with the remaining strawberries.
9d9d29f6e8.pred:
Stir together the whipped cream and the corn flakes.
Stir in the strawberries.
Serve immediately.

4ab9695b51.gt:
Mix flour and cheese in a big bowl.
Using your fingers work in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add the egg yolk and work into a smooth dough.
Wrap with cling film and chill for 30 minutes.
Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface and cut out cookies of desired shape (I used a clover cookie cutter, but rounds or animal shapes would be great, too).
Brush with egg white and sprinkle with seeds or desired topping.
Bake in the preheated oven at 200C/400F for 15-18 minutes (the thinner you make your cookies, the faster they are ready--so start checking on them early).
4ab9695b51.pred:

Mix all ingredients together.

b500700d75.gt:
Pre-heat oven
In a bowl, grate the carrots and apple
Mix flour, baking soda, baking powerd , sugar , salt ,cinnamon and walnuts
Add the eggs, oil , milk ,vanilla extract
Add the carrots and apple
Spoon equal amount into the muffin tray
Bake for 20-30 min
b500700d75.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease 12 muffin cups with vegetable oil.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, milk, oil, vanilla, salt, sugar, cinnamon, and walnuts.
Stir in carrots and apple.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and baking soda.
Stir flour mixture into carrot mixture until just combined.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

96de2fb2f9.gt:
Cut broccoli florets into small bite-sized pieces.
Combine with grapes, celery, raisins, and sunflower seed kernels.
Mix mayonnaise with remaining ingredients, stirring with a whisk.
Pour dressing over the broccoli mix, and toss well.
Chill for 1 hour minimum.
96de2fb2f9.pred:
In a large bowl, combine broccoli, grapes, celery, raisins, sunflower seeds, mayonnaise, yogurt, sugar, and vinegar.
Mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve cold.

789488866b.gt:
Mix all wet ingredients and beat until everything is well incorporated.
Mix all dry ingredients.
Then add them to wet mixture a little at a time until everything is completely mix.
Divide mixture equally and pour in two loaf pans.
Bake between 55-60 minutes for 350F.
789488866b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, mix together the carrots, coconut, raisins, oil, yogurt, eggs, vanilla, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, baking soda, and nutmeg.
Stir in the flour until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

bf91ac4066.gt:
Saute onion in vegetable oil until clear.
Add all other ingredients and simmer for 10mins
Puree with hand mixer until smooth
bf91ac4066.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium heat.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool.
Store in a covered container in the refrigerator.

78e1fe788f.gt:
Stir together all sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then stir-fry garlic and ginger until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add shrimp and stir-fry until almost cooked through, about 3 minutes.
Add half of romaine and stir-fry until it begins to wilt, then add remaining romaine and stir-fry until just wilted and shrimp are just cooked through, about 1 minute.
Stir sauce, then add to stir-fry and simmer, stirring, 2 minutes.
78e1fe788f.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and ginger and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the shrimp and cook, stirring, until they turn pink, about 3 minutes.
Add the broth, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp are cooked through, about 3 minutes.
Stir in the rice and cook, stirring, until the rice is heated through, about 1 minute.
Serve with white rice.

b653472a7b.gt:
In soup pot dissolve curry paste with water , add cherry tomato ,bring to the boil on medium heat
Prepare banana blossom while soup is boiling ,cut half on runny water or in water bowl
Cut into 4 pieces ,now select only white leaves,take off small young banana inside
Cut to small pieces, this always soak in water to prevent from color change
Add to soup pot,increase to high heat ,stir to let all sink in hot boil soup ,let it simmer about 15 mins
Add fishsauce,add green leaves ,stir to mix,heat off ,serve hot with sticky rice by northern thai way or with steamed jasmine rice
b653472a7b.pred:
Mix all ingredients except the fish sauce in a small saucepan.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the fish sauce and stir.
Serve with rice.

73a84e1f5e.gt:
Wash and peel the zucchini and cut into long strips.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix the eggs, milk and salt, dip the zucchini strips into the mixture and then roll in the breadcrumbs.
Saute until crisp on the outside but not overcooked, about 2-3 minutes.
Serve.
73a84e1f5e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a bowl, combine the zucchini, eggs, milk, salt and pepper.
Mix well.
In another bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and 1/4 cup of the oil.
Dip the zucchini mixture into the breadcrumbs, coating well.
Place the zucchini in a greased baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes or until done.
Serve with a side of your favorite sauce.

4816a33066.gt:
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering.
Add onion and salt and stir until coated with oil.
Reduce heat to medium, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is soft, about 10 minutes (if onion begins to burn after 5 minutes, reduce heat to low).
Add garlic and chili powder and cook, uncovered, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add beef and cook, breaking up meat with wooden spoon, until just pink, about 3 minutes.
Add 1/4 teaspoon pepper, brown sugar, tomato puree, ketchup, water, and hot sauce.
Simmer until Sloppy Joe sauce is slightly thicker than ketchup, 8 to 10 minutes.
Adjust seasonings.
Spoon meat mixture onto hamburger buns and serve.
Make Ahead: If you find yourself with leftover Sloppy Joes or just feel like making a double batch, the meat mixture freezes well for up to one month.
To return the meat mixture to its original consistency, you may need to add a little water when it is reheated.
4816a33066.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add onion and saute until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add beef and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add salt, chili powder, black pepper, brown sugar, tomato puree, ketchup, water, hot pepper sauce, and 1/4 cup of the onion.
Stir to combine.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until meat is very tender, about 1 hour.
Serve over buns.

708886aaca.gt:
Heat oil in a five to six quart pot over moderately high heat.
Add garlic and pepper flake, saute until golden.
Be careful not to burn the garlic.
Stir in tomatoes and salt.
Simmer uncovered for 35 minutes.
Serve with pasta.
708886aaca.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook until golden, about 1 minute.
Add the red pepper flakes and stir to combine.
Add the tomatoes and their juice, and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in the salt and cook for 10 minutes longer.
Serve over your favorite pasta.

3ca1d4e9d8.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Place onion, celery, and carrot in a large, shallow roasting pan.
Place turkey, breast side up, on top of the vegetables in the roasting pan.
Pat the outside and inside of the turkey dry with paper towels.
Combine salt, black pepper and cayenne pepper in a small bowl.
Season the inside of the turkey with about 1/3 of the salt mixture.
Fold wing tips under the bird.
Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat until the edges begin to turn golden, about 2 minutes.
Cook and stir rosemary and sage for 1 minute.
Place rosemary and sage inside the cavity of the turkey; reserve melted butter.
Tie the legs together with twine.
Brush outside of the turkey completely with the melted butter.
Season with remaining 2/3 of the salt mixture.
Bake turkey, uncovered, in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 3 hours.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone should read 180 degrees F (82 degrees C).
Remove the turkey from the oven and allow to rest in a warm area 10 to 15 minutes before slicing.
3ca1d4e9d8.pred:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Place turkey in roasting pan.
Combine onion, celery, carrot, salt, pepper, and cayenne in a large bowl.
Stuff turkey with onion mixture.
Place turkey in roasting pan.
Roast turkey, basting with pan juices every 30 minutes, until meat thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh registers 180 degrees F, about 3 hours.
Remove turkey from oven and let stand 20 minutes before carving.
Garnish with rosemary and sage.

0121dfda05.gt:
Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat.
Add shallots, ginger, and garlic and let cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Stir in peanut butter, turmeric, cumin, and curry paste and let cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Whisk in water, coconut milk, lime zest, brown sugar, and salt until combined.
Add tofu, sweet potato, and kale, and bring to a boil.
Let simmer, covered, for 30 minutes, or until sweet potatoes are fork tender.
Stir in lime juice and adjust seasoning to taste.
Garnish with cashews and serve over rice or quinoa.
0121dfda05.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
Add shallots, ginger, garlic, and cumin; cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add peanut butter, turmeric, curry paste, and 1/2 cup water.
Stir until smooth.
Add remaining water, coconut milk, lime zest, brown sugar, sea salt, tofu, sweet potato, and kale.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in roasted cashews.
Serve over rice.

10935178ed.gt:
1.
Bring stock to a simmer in a saucepan (do not boil).
Keep warm over low heat.2.
Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add olive oil; swirl to coat.
Add pancetta; saute 6 minutes or until crisp.
Using a slotted spoon, remove pancetta from pan; drain on a paper towel.
Add shallots to drippings in pan; cook 2 minutes (do not brown), stirring frequently.
Stir in rice, rosemary, and garlic; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add wine; cook 2 minutes or until liquid is absorbed, stirring frequently.
Stir in 1 1/2 cups stock; cook 4 minutes or until liquid is nearly absorbed, stirring constantly.
Add remaining stock, 3/4 cup at a time, stirring nearly constantly until each portion of stock is absorbed before adding the next (about 22 minutes total); reserve 1/3 cup stock at the last addition.
Stir in pepper, truffle oil, and salt.
Remove pan from heat; stir in reserved 1/3 cup broth.
Top with pancetta.
10935178ed.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the pancetta and cook, stirring occasionally, until the pancetta is crisp and golden, about 5 minutes.
Add the shallots and cook, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the rice and stir to coat with the pancetta and shallots.
Add the stock, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly, until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
Add the garlic and rosemary and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Add the wine and cook, stirring, until the liquid is absorbed.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the truffle oil and stir to combine.
Remove from the heat and let the risotto stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
Fluff the risotto with a fork and serve.

a67add462f.gt:
Place diced carrots, onion, peppers, and garlic (not the peas yet) in a kettle with a small amount of water and curry powder.
Simmer about 5 minutes until tender.
Add zucchini, cover, and simmer 5 more minutes.
Blend all the remaining ingredients, except the peas and garboanzos or lentils, in a blender until smooth.
Add the blended ingredients, the peas, and the garbanzos or lentils to the rest of the vegetables.
Heat and serve over rice.
a67add462f.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add carrots, onion, and green pepper.
Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add zucchini and tomato sauce.
Cook until zucchini is tender.
Add peanut butter, Braggs, curry powder, garbanzo beans, and salt.
Stir well.
Add cooked rice and peas.
Stir well.
Serve over rice.
Garnish with cilantro.

b5234384e0.gt:
Heat oven to 325
Sautee onion and celery
Cook noodles as directed.
Mix tuna with mayo and soup.
Once noodles are cooked mix into tuna and mayo mix.
Spoon into casserole dish.
Sprinkle crumbled potato chips on top.
Bake for 30 mins or until potato chips are browned.
b5234384e0.pred:
Cook noodles according to package directions.
Drain and rinse the tuna.
Mix tuna, soup, mayo, and 1/2 cup water in a bowl.
Spread 1/2 cup of the tuna mixture in the bottom of a 13x9x2-inch baking dish.
Layer with noodles, celery, onion, and 1/2 cup of the crushed potato chips.
Top with remaining tuna mixture and crushed potato chips.
Cover and bake at 350F for 30 minutes.
Uncover and bake 10 minutes longer.

01eb818f49.gt:
Cook the chicken breast pieces in the water in a large pot over high heat until done (170 degrees).
Remove the chicken pieces to plate and cover with plastic wrap; set aside.
Pour the dried pasta in to the same boiling water and cook until tender, about 6 minutes.
Drain in a colander; set aside.
Place the Greek yogurt, the Hidden Valley Original Ranch Seasoning Mix, the reserved marinating juice from the artichoke hearts, Parmesan cheese, the zest and juice of the lemon, white pepper, curry and cayenne powders in a small sized bowl and whisk until well blended and smooth.
Add in the 2 diced chives, carrots, celery, parsley, shallots and pimento and gently stir.
Pour this mixture over the cooked pasta in a larger bowl and add the cooked chicken breast pieces that have been diced into small cubes.
Mix until all is evenly coated.
To serve, plate a serving of the pasta mixture and garnish with (optional) parsley, several grape tomatoes, 1 purple cabbage leaf, chives pieces and several quarters of artichoke hearts.
01eb818f49.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Combine chicken, 3 cups water, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a 1 1/2-quart casserole.
Bring to a boil.
Cover and bake 30 minutes.
Remove from oven; cool slightly.
Shred chicken; discard skin and bones.
Return chicken to casserole.
Stir in pasta, yogurt, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Bake, uncovered, 15 minutes.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Bake 15 minutes longer or until heated through.
Sprinkle with parsley.

e3cdb21cdf.gt:
In a large pot with boiling salted water cook spaghetti pasta until al dente.
Drain.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, basil, sliced mushrooms, and chopped tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in California-style vegetables, salt, and ground black pepper.
Cook for approximately 10 minutes, stirring often, until vegetables are tender and crisp.
Pour vegetable mixture over cooked and drained pasta.
Toss well.
Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and serve.
e3cdb21cdf.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and saute until tender.
Add the basil and mushrooms and saute until the mushrooms are tender.
Add the stewed tomatoes and vegetables and cook until heated through.
Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with Parmesan cheese.

143f7e5182.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix bread dough following the directions on the box (or use your favorite recipe).
Wrap the dough around the smokies, one at a time.
Place on a greased cookie sheet, or use Silpat or parchment paper.
Bake for 15 minutes.
143f7e5182.pred:
Snausages: 1.
In a large bowl, combine the bread mix and Lil' Smokies.
2.
Mix well.
3.
Shape into 16 sausage shapes.
4.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
5.
Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

039acee1c2.gt:
Pour peach juice into a champagne flute.
Slowly pour sparkling wine over peach juice; let sit until liquids have blended, about 1 minute.
Pour raspberry juice over champagne mixture.
039acee1c2.pred:
Place a large bowl of ice in the freezer.
Place a small bowl of raspberries in the freezer.
Place a small bowl of peach juice in the freezer.
Place a small bowl of champagne in the freezer.

Place a small bowl of peach juice in the freezer.

Place a small bowl of peach juice in the free

b12f641798.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F with rack in middle.
Pat beef dry and season with 2 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper.
Heat oil in pot over medium-high heat until it shimmers, then brown meat, without crowding, in 3 batches, turning, about 8 minutes per batch.
Transfer to a platter.
Reduce heat to medium, then add carrots, celery, onions, and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until well browned, about 12 minutes.
Push vegetables to one side of pot.
Add tomato paste to cleared area and cook paste, stirring, 2 minutes, then stir into vegetables.
Add vinegar and cook, stirring, 2 minutes.
Stir in wine, bay leaves, and thyme and boil until wine is reduced by about two thirds, 10 to 12 minutes.
Add broth to pot along with water, beef, and any juices from platter and bring to a simmer.
Cover and braise in oven until meat is very tender, about 2 1/2 hours.
Set a large colander in a large bowl.
Pour stew into colander.
Return pieces of meat to pot, then discard remaining solids.
Let cooking liquid stand 10 minutes.
While beef braises, peel potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch-wide wedges.
Slice carrots diagonally (1-inch).
Add potatoes and carrots to stew (make sure they are submerged) and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until potatoes and carrots are tender, about 40 minutes.
b12f641798.pred:
Preheat oven to 325F.
In a large heavy pot, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add beef and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Remove beef from pot and set aside.
Add onions, carrots, celery, and garlic to pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are softened, about 10 minutes.
Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, 1 minute.
Add wine, bay leaves, thyme, broth, and water.
Return beef to pot, cover, and simmer until beef is tender, about 2 hours.
Add potatoes and carrots, cover, and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Transfer stew to a large ovenproof casserole dish.
Cover and bake in preheated oven until hot and bubbling, about 30 minutes.
Serve with crusty bread.

03321392c1.gt:
Spread cut sides of roll with dressing and mustard.
Fill with remaining ingredients.
03321392c1.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spread MIRACLE WHIP on bottom half of roll.
Layer on turkey, tomato, peppers, and carrots.
Top with remaining half of roll.
Wrap in foil and bake 10-15 min.
or until heated through.

24b368b73d.gt:
To make Salad: Toast pine nuts in skillet over medium heat 5 minutes, or until golden brown.
Transfer to plate to cool.
Combine radicchio, radishes, fennel, and cucumber in large bowl.
To make Lemon-Mint Dressing: Puree mint, lemon juice, oil, maple syrup, and mustard in blender until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add dressing to salad; toss to coat, and garnish with toasted pine nuts.
24b368b73d.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Toss with enough dressing to coat.
Serve immediately.

9bde591cc5.gt:
In a large skillet, brown the ground meat and drain off any grease.
Add the chopped onion and cook for about 3 minutes, until the onions are softened.
Add the cabbage and water and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the cabbage starts to wilt.
Add the tomatoes, brown sugar, vinegar, salt, caraway seed and garlic.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat and cover.
Simmer until the cabbage is cooked to the desired tenderness, about 30 minutes.
Serve with white rice.
9bde591cc5.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, brown the ground chuck over medium heat.
Add the onion and saute until tender.
Add the cabbage and saute until soft.
Add the water, tomatoes, brown sugar, vinegar, salt, caraway seeds, and garlic powder.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Place the cabbage mixture in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 45 minutes.
Uncover and bake for 15 minutes more.

68a1ebd22c.gt:
Combine flour, baking powder, sugar, cardamom and salt in a large bowl.
Whisk egg and water together in a small bowl.
Make a well in center of dry ingredients and add egg mixture.
Mix together gradually with a fork until mixture forms a soft dough.
If it's too sticky, add 1 or 2 tablespoons of flour (one at a time).
Cover dough with a wet towel or plastic wrap and leave 30 minutes or longer.
Heat 4 cups of oil in a deep, heavy pot (cast iron is preferable) until is reaches 360F
While oil is heating, roll dough out on a floured surface into a rectangle 1/2 inch thick.
Use a sharp knife to cut into 20 equal rectangles.
Fry maandazi in batches of 5, for about 5 minutes per batch, turning to brown both sides.
Hint: Turn the mandaazi before it gets too puffy, or the air bubbles will prevent you from turning it at all.
Remove from oil when both sides are golden brown.
Serve warm, dipped in powdered sugar if desired.
68a1ebd22c.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, cardamom, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and water.
Add the egg mixture to the flour mixture and stir until a dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes.
Roll the dough out into a 12-inch circle.
Cut the dough into 12 equal pieces.
Place the pieces on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Cover the baking sheet with plastic wrap and let the dough rest for 10 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Bake the maandazi for 15 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack.
Serve warm.

159b22acbe.gt:
In 1 1/2- to 2-quart container with cover, mix all ingredients; cover tightly.
Store at room temperature.
Kitchen Tip:.
For cute gift bags, buy some small snack-sized bags and black pipe cleaners at the party or craft store.
Cut 5 pipe cleaners in half (makes ten 6-inch pieces).
Cut 14 pipe cleaners into 4-inch lengths (3-lengths per pipe cleaner).
To make each spider hold four 4-inch lengths together and twist a 6-inch length around the middle of the bundle to secure.
Bend 4-inch pieces to resemble spider legs.
Use 6-inch piece to seal gift bag.
Two 4-inch pieces will be left over.
159b22acbe.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Serve with a spoon.

3c81571916.gt:
Preheat oven to 375, in a large bowl combine all ingredients mix well.
lightly spray your 8x8 baking dish and add meat mixture to form an loaf.
bake uncovered about an hour or until thermometer reaches 170.
3c81571916.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground turkey, egg, meatloaf seasoning mix, tomatoes and green chilies, onion, and green bell pepper.
Form into 4-inch squares.
Place the squares on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with breadcrumbs.
Bake for 10 minutes more.

f87ab5a162.gt:
In a large pot, heat the oil.
Add the onion and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until golden brown, 7 minutes.
Add the bacon and cook, stirring, until the fat has rendered, 10 minutes.
Add the collards and cook over moderately high heat, stirring, until it begins to wilt, 4 minutes.
Add the vinegar and boil for 1 minute.
Add the sorghum syrup, stock, water, crushed red pepper and a large pinch of salt.
Cover and cook, stirring a few times, until the collards are very tender, 1 1/2 hours.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, simmer the cream over moderate heat until reduced by one-third, 10 minutes.
Add the kimchi and remove from the heat.
When the collards are done, stir in the kimchi cream.
Season with salt and serve.
f87ab5a162.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the bacon and cook, stirring occasionally, until the bacon is crisp, about 5 minutes.
Add the collard greens and cook, stirring occasionally, until wilted, about 10 minutes.
Add the sherry vinegar, sorghum syrup, chicken stock, water, crushed red pepper, salt, and cream.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until the greens are tender, about 20 minutes.
Add the kimchi and cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Serve hot.

217d8f645b.gt:
Preheat oven to 375F degrees.
Put a sheet of tinfoil on a cookie sheet.
Spray cookie sheet with lite olive oil or other veggie oil.
In a small bowl combine; onion flakes,oregano, garlic, paprika, salt& pepper, mix well.
Brush cut sides of the potato wedges with olive oil and sprinkle with the spice mixture.
Place potato pieces cut side down on the prepared cookie sheet.
Bake until underside are golden brown, about 30 minutes.
Gently turn the wedges so the other side is on the cookie sheet.
Bake for another 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and golden.
Serve while they ar piping hot.
217d8f645b.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Place potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with onion flakes, oregano, garlic, paprika, salt and pepper.
Bake for 30 minutes, turning once, until potatoes are tender and golden brown.

fcb625ec64.gt:
Cut the carrot into thin strips.
Rehydrate the kanpyo in water.
Place the pork into the kombu, and then place the carrots on top.
Roll it up from the front with the carrot, and tie in two places with the kanpyo.
Add the A condiments and Step 2 to a pot, cover with a drop lid, and boil for at least 40 minutes until the kombu softens.
Stick with a toothpick, and cook until it pierces straight through.
After it has softened, turn off the heat, let cool, cut into half, and arrange on a plate.
fcb625ec64.pred:
Combine the ingredients and make the rolls.
Cut the rolls into 1-inch pieces.
Serve with a dipping sauce.

4368d128b9.gt:
Brown the ground beef using the seasonings i have listed to flavor the meat.
(I usually add these seasonings to taste since i rarely measure them, so the measurements i have listed are a guideline) Add 1/4 cup of water and let meat and seasonings simmer until liquid is mostly cooked off.
You don't want it soupy.
Drain on paper toweling.
Clean lettuce, tear into bite sized pieces.
Toss with all of the rest of the ingredients adding about 1/2 cup of the dressing and tossing again well.
Serve with salsa and sour cream on the side if desired.
I list Doritos here because, let's face it, they're good!
But when I have time, i like to cut up corn tortillas into wedges, fry in a bit of oil, and season with Mexican style spices.
4368d128b9.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, brown ground beef and drain.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Top with cheese and bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

8fe5441410.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Bake the yams until they are not quite done.
Remove them from the oven and allow them to cool.
Cut off the ends, peel them and cut them into approximately 1 slices.
Heat a heavy 10 skillet or pot on medium-low and melt the Earth Balance.
Add the honey, maple syrup, and barley malt syrup and stir.
Add the sliced yams to the pan, wedging them all in there.
Lift the pan (wearing pot holders), tilting it so that the sauce covers the yams.
Cook for 10 minutes, lifting and tilting occasionally.
Carefully turn the yams over.
Cook for another 10 minutes, lifting and tilting your pan again so the sauce covers the yams.
8fe5441410.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Cut yams into 1 inch chunks.
Place yams in a large bowl.
Add Earth Balance Margarine, honey, maple syrup and barley malt syrup.
Mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Place yams on a baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

46dc2bc350.gt:
Break noodles
Mix everything together.
Mix flavor packets with 1 cup oil, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup white vinegar,
Mix with other ingredients and refrigerate over night
Stir next morning allowing noodles to soften
Will ne ready to serve in afternoon or evening
46dc2bc350.pred:
Cook broccoli slaw mix according to package directions.
Add the chopped green onions and sunflower seeds.
Toss well.
Add the slivered almonds.
Toss well again.
Cook the Ramen noodles according to package directions.
Drain and rinse under cold water.
Toss the noodles with the broccoli slaw mix, green onions, and almonds.

84afda0ee0.gt:
Boil egg noodles with a pinch of salt until cooked.
Add half of the soy sauce and allow to sit
(While noodles are boiling) Cut Chicken Breast into strips
Cut all vegetables to your liking.
Heat Vegetable Oil in a deep pan and add chicken, garlic, salt and pepper.
Fry until cooked
Add vegetables and cook until cooked
Add Cooked Egg Noodles and the rest of the soy sauce plus lemon.
(I like to add a table spoon of sweet chilli sauce aswell)
Serve and Enjoy :)))
84afda0ee0.pred:
Heat a wok or large skillet over medium high heat.
Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove chicken from wok and set aside.
Add onion, bell peppers, and spring onions to wok and stir fry until softened.
Add mushrooms and garlic and stir fry until mushrooms are tender.
Add soy sauce, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Stir to combine.
Return chicken to wok and toss to coat with sauce.
Cook until chicken is cooked through.
Serve over egg noodles.

830e83ffb1.gt:
Halve your bread crosswise.
Hollow out the inside of the bread halves to make the pockets.
Do your best to keep from putting holes in the roll.
Fill with your favorite pasta!
Note: Push the pasta mixture down into the bread pocket to allow more spaghetti to fit inside.
Once hollowed out, you can stuff your bread with any pasta.
Try it with a butter sauce, olive oil, pesto, tomato sauce or anything you like.
Go all out and add sausages and peppers, chicken, or mini meatballs.
You can even throw in a Caesar or mixed green salad tossed with dressing.
You are only limited by your imagination.
830e83ffb1.pred:
Mix all ingredients except for the pasta.
Cut the bread into 1/2 inch slices.
Place a spoonful of pasta in the center of each slice.
Top with a spoonful of meatballs.
Cover with a slice of bread.
Press down on the sandwich to make sure the filling is secure.
Repeat with the remaining bread and filling.
Serve with a side of salad.

b85277a635.gt:
In a large bowl, mix together the ginger, soy sauce, sake and mirin.
Add the sliced pork, cover, and marinate for about 1 hour.
Heat the oil in a skillet or wok over high heat.
Add the pork, and fry until brown.
The pork should have a dark crispy look to it.
Do not cook on low or medium heat, as the juices will not cook fast enough to get a crispy texture.
Discard leftover marinade.
b85277a635.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the ginger, soy sauce, sake, and mirin.
Set aside.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the pork and cook, stirring occasionally, until the pork is browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Add the ginger mixture and cook, stirring, until the pork is cooked through, about 5 minutes.

acc83d0fdd.gt:
In a medium saucepan, combine half of the strawberries with the sugar and 1/3 cup of water and bring to a simmer.
Cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar is dissolved and the liquid is slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
Transfer the strawberry mixture to a food processor.
Add the remaining strawberries and puree until smooth.
Strain the puree through a fine sieve set over a large bowl.
Add the Champagne and lemon juice and mix well.
Pour the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch glass or stainless steel baking dish.
Freeze the granita for 2 hours.
Scrape the frozen edges into the center.
Freeze for another 3 hours, scraping hourly, until the granita is icy and flaky.
Freeze for 8 hours or overnight.
Scrape the granita into bowls and serve.
acc83d0fdd.pred:
In a small saucepan, combine the strawberries, sugar, and lemon juice.
Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar dissolves.
Remove from the heat and allow to cool to room temperature.
Pour the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Cover and refrigerate until firm, about 3 hours.
Using a fork, scrape the mixture into a large bowl.
Return the mixture to the baking dish and freeze, stirring every 30 minutes, until it is almost frozen, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm, about 2 hours.
Remove from the freezer and scrape the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Freeze until firm,

94d70d2bcc.gt:
Wash, dry, and cut broccolini into thirds.
Heat oil over high in a wok or similar type pan.
Stir fry the stems first for about 3-4 minutes.
You may need to turn the heat down to medium high.
Add the top leaf portion, and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
Shut off heat and add oyster sauce, stirring to coat.
Serve.
94d70d2bcc.pred:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Wash and trim the broccolini.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the broccolini and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the oyster sauce and cook for 1 minute.
Transfer the broccolini to a baking dish and bake for 10 minutes.
Serve immediately.

78dd461363.gt:
Cream butter, peanut butter, sugar, honey, egg, vanilla.
Sift together dry ingredients and then blend into creamed mixture.
Stir in nuts and chocolate chips, if desired.
Spoon 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly brown; do not overbake.
Cool slightly; remove and place on rack to cool.
78dd461363.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease cookie sheets.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together butter and peanut butter.
Add sugar, honey, egg, and vanilla.
Mix well.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add to peanut butter mixture and mix well.
Stir in nuts and chocolate chips.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

83d2a64e21.gt:
Heat greased barbecue to medium heat.
Grill wings 7 to 8 min.
on each side or until done.
Meanwhile, mix Miracle Whip and Sriracha sauce in large bowl until blended.
Add wings to Miracle Whip mixture; toss to evenly coat.
Transfer to platter.
Sprinkle with onions.
83d2a64e21.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine chicken wings, Miracle Whip, Sriracha sauce, and green onion.
Toss to coat.
Spread chicken wings in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake 30 minutes, turning once.
Serve with celery sticks and carrot sticks.

ee5c4e9487.gt:
Arrange cauliflower and carrots in four half-pint canning jars; set aside.
Heat remaining ingredients to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat, cook 10 minutes.
Turn off heat; let steep 5 minutes.
Pour mixture over the vegetables to cover.
