Add sliced mushrooms one handful at a time to saute pan.
As mushrooms begin to develop rich, brown color, push them to the outside of the saute pan.
Turn the mushrooms over as they begin to color.
When pan becomes dry, add remaining clarified butter to the pan.
Add another handful of mushrooms to the pan and continue until all mushrooms have been added.
Season with salt and pepper after the last addition to the pan has been made.
Make a hole in the middle of the pan and add the shallots.
Deglaze pan with cognac, scraping up any browned mushroom bits.
Add the chives.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
904095d715.pred:
Heat 2 tablespoons clarified butter in a large saute pan over medium heat.
Add the cremini mushrooms and saute until they are golden brown and tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the shallots and saute for 1 minute.
Add the cognac and cook until it has evaporated.
Add the chives and saute for 1 minute.
Serve immediately.

e3bc640873.gt:
In a mixing bowl beat eggs, sugar, corn syrup and vanilla.
Add butter and mix well.
Stir in pecans and chocolate chips.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake at 350 F for 50-55 minutes or until set.
It is important for it to be set *before* you remove it from the oven.
It will not set afterward if you haven't baked it long enough.
Serve with ice cream if desired.
e3bc640873.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, beat eggs until light and fluffy.
Add sugar, corn syrup, and vanilla; beat until well blended.
Stir in melted butter.
Fold in pecans and chocolate chips.
Pour into unbaked pastry shells.
Bake for 45 minutes or until set.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream, if desired.

35bc02319c.gt:
To make doughnuts: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Mix the flours, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon in a mixing bowl.
Set aside.
In another bowl, combine the melted butter, milk, vanilla and maple syrup.
Then add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until combined.
Put the mixture into a piping bag or a Ziplock bag with the tip cut off, and pour into a pre-sprayed doughnut pan.
Bake doughnuts for 20-25 minutes or until browned and slightly firm to the touch.
Once done, let stand to cool for 20 minutes.
To make glaze: stir together 1/2 cup confectioners sugar, 2 tablespoons cocoa powder, and 1 tablespoon milk.
Once mixed well, distribute the glaze generously onto doughnuts.
35bc02319c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flours, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, melt butter and milk.
Add vanilla and maple syrup to butter mixture and stir until combined.
Add powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and milk to butter mixture and stir until smooth.
Add flour mixture to wet ingredients and stir until combined.
Drop dough by heaping tablespoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until doughnuts are golden brown.

8b0f1ee273.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large saucepan combine broth, undrained tomatoes and orzo.
Bring to boiling.
Stir in Grilled & Ready Southwestern Chicken Strips.
Transfer mixture to a 2-quart baking dish.
Bake, covered, for 25 to 30 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Uncover and sprinkle with cheese during last 5 minutes of baking.
Let stand, covered, for 10 minutes before serving.
8b0f1ee273.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook chicken strips over medium heat until no longer pink.
Drain and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine orzo, tomatoes, green chile peppers, broth, and chicken.
Transfer to a 2-quart casserole dish.
Top with cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and casserole is heated through.

cb7e6bedc8.gt:
Preheat oven to 180C.
Melt the butter in the microwave.
Mix all the ingredients together.
Pour the mixture into a baking dish and cook for 45 minutes.
cb7e6bedc8.pred:
Place all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Pour into a greased 20cm x 20cm x 5cm baking pan.
Bake at 180C for 40 minutes.
Cool and serve.

60a456e88d.gt:
In a medium saucepan of boiling water, cook the bulgur until al dente, about 10 minutes.
Drain well and cool.
In a large bowl, combine the bulgur with all of the remaining ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper and mix well.
60a456e88d.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

8d838c9253.gt:
Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat.
Coat pan with cooking spray.
Add celery, carrot, and onion to pan; cook 12 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Add broth and next 4 ingredients (through pepper); bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, and simmer 12 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Add chicken to pan; cook 3 minutes or until chicken is done.
Sprinkle with cheese.
8d838c9253.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spray a 9-inch square baking dish with cooking spray.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add the celery, carrot, onion, and garlic and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the broth, marinara, chickpeas, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Stir in the pasta and cook until the pasta is tender, about 10 minutes.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and serve.

0eeb43444a.gt:
Steam the cauliflower florets for 10 minutes or until tender.
In a small skillet over medium heat, saute garlic in hazelnut oil or coconut oil, just until fragrant.
Add all of the ingredients into a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Serve over gluten-free noodles, spaghetti squash, veggie sticks, spuds, kale chips or Vegan Shepherds Pie On The Fly.
0eeb43444a.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the cauliflower and cook, stirring, until it is softened and beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the artichoke hearts and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in the mustard, salt and pepper.
Cook for 1 minute.
Serve immediately.

643060cd52.gt:
Throw all ingredients into a bowl and combine!
(You can add 3tsp of Cacao powder for a slight chocolatey flavour)
643060cd52.pred:
Place all ingredients in a food processor and blend until smooth.
Form into 1 inch balls and roll in your favorite topping.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

3d9830c9de.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine all the ingredients except for the artichoke bottoms and the beef broth.
Divide and mound the meat mixture on the artichoke bottoms, about 4 tablespoons each.
In a well greased baking pan, place the filled artichokes, filled side up, in one layer.
Pour the broth over the whole thing.
Bake, lightly covered with foil, for 1 1/2 hours.
Uncover and bake another 10-15 minutes, until browned.
Serve hot.
3d9830c9de.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, brown the ground beef with the onion and garlic.
Add the mushrooms and cook until softened.
Drain the artichoke bottoms and add them to the skillet.
Stir in the tomato puree, water, salt, pepper and thyme.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Place the artichoke bottoms in a baking dish and cover with the meat mixture.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve with rice or pasta.

5baa4c01a1.gt:
Mix coffee and syrups together in a mug.
Fill with steamed milk.
Add a bit of foamed milk on top.
5baa4c01a1.pred:
In a blender, combine espresso, chocolate syrup, and caramel syrup.
Pour in the milk and blend until smooth.
Pour into a mug and steam and froth milk to the desired consistency.
Top with whipped cream and enjoy!

7a20842b45.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl using an electric mixer or stand mixer, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time.
Add vanilla.
In another bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder and salt.
Add the flour mixture and bananas to the butter mixture in the mixer, alternating between the two.
Line each muffin cup with a paper liner.
Fill each muffin cups about 2/3 full with batter and bake for 17-20 minutes until a tester inserted into a cupcake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack.
Let cupcakes cool completely before frosting.
For the frosting, using an electric mixer or stand mixer, cream butter until light and fluffy.
Add confectioners sugar 1/2 cup at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add vanilla and milk and beat until frosting is well combined.
Add in strawberry preserves 1 tablespoon at a time until frosting is creamy.
Frost cooled cupcakes and store in the refrigerator.
7a20842b45.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar.
Add the eggs and vanilla, and beat until smooth.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the mashed bananas.
Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.
For the frosting, cream together the butter and confectioners sugar.
Add the vanilla and milk, and beat until smooth.
Add the strawberry preserves and beat until combined.
Frost the cooled cupcakes.

c5f32e3595.gt:
Rinse a Collins glass by swirling absinthe inside it, just enough to coat the sides; discard excess.
Combine gin, jam, fennel syrup, lemon juice and bitters in a shaker with ice, and shake.
Add ice to the prepared glass, and into that strain the contents of the shaker.
Top with the soda, and serve.
c5f32e3595.pred:
Place the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

364e4fdc52.gt:
Melt butter, add flour, salt, and pepper, wisk until smooth.
Add milk slowly, whisking to blend.
Cook until thick and smooth, add cheese and stir until melted.
Cook elbow noodles as directed on package.
Drain and pour into a baking dish.
Pour cheese sauce over cooked elbows.
Bake at 350F for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
*It's best to use a double boiler or nonstick pan to make your cheese sauce.
364e4fdc52.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Stir in flour and cook until smooth.
Gradually add milk, stirring constantly.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in cheese.
Pour over cooked macaroni and stir to combine.
Transfer to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, for 25 minutes or until bubbly.

887374647e.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Lightly grease one 9x13 inch pan.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, flour, baking soda, vanilla, butter or margarine, honey and brown sugar.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Lightly press mixture into the prepared pan.
Bake at 325 degrees F for 18 to 22 minutes or until golden brown.
Let cool for 10 minutes then cut into bars.
Let bars cool completely in pan before removing or serving.
887374647e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a 13x9-inch baking pan with parchment paper.
Combine oats, flour, baking soda, and vanilla in a large bowl.
Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add honey and brown sugar; stir until smooth.
Remove from heat and stir in melted butter mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Spread mixture evenly in pan.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.
Cut into bars and store in an airtight container.

38c1babf26.gt:
In a small bowl combine graham cracker crumbs melted butter and 2 tablespoons of sugar.
After mixing well, press into the bottom of a cheesecake pan; set aside.
In a large bowl, combine room temperature cream cheese, eggs, vanilla, whipping cream and 1 cup sugar.
Beat until smooth and creamy.
Pour batter into the cheesecake pan and cook for 35 to 40 minutes at 350F.
If you like your cheesecake with a sour cream topping, remove from the oven after cooking, then combine 1 pint of sour cream, 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1 teaspoon of vanilla.
Spoon on top of the cheesecake and cook for 10 additional minutes at 420 degrees.
If I am adding fruit to the top of the cheesecake, I do not add the sour cream topping.
For chocolate cheesecake, add a bag of melted chocolate chips to the mixture and use chocolate cookie crumbs for the crust.
The vanilla can be substituted with any flavoring extract.
It is a very flexible basic recipe that can be changed to incorporate any favorite flavor.
38c1babf26.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs and melted butter.
Press the mixture onto the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch springform pan.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth.
Add the sugar and beat until fluffy.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add the vanilla and whipping cream and beat until smooth.
Pour the filling into the crust.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Turn off the oven and leave the cheesecake in the oven for 1 hour.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool to room temperature.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Remove from the refrigerator and allow to come to room temperature before serving.

a79407fd69.gt:
Combine all ingredients except almond extract and sweetener in a medium saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until mixture is smooth and comes to a boil.
Remove from heat.
Stir in almond extract, sweeten to taste and serve.
a79407fd69.pred:
In a large saucepan, bring milk, water, and almond butter to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in cocoa powder, cinnamon, and almond extract.
Stir until well combined.
Add sugar, if desired, and stir until dissolved.
Pour into mugs and serve.

0b797c29a0.gt:
Reserve 1 tablespoon of olive oil,now heat the remainder in a medium saucepan
Add the garlic and a pinch.of salt and over low heat.stirring until golden brown.then remove the pan from the heat.do not let the garlic burn as it will taint its flavor.if its burn you will have to start over.
Meanwhile, bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil.add the spaghetti and remaining olive oil and cook for 10 to 12 minutes, until tender.
Drain the spaghetti thoroughly and return to the pan.
Add the oil and garlic mixture to the spaghetti and toss to coat.season with pepper,add the chopped fresh parsley, and toss to coat.
Put on a plater and serve warm, serve immediately.
0b797c29a0.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until it is fragrant and just beginning to turn golden, about 1 minute.
Add the parsley and cook, stirring, until it is wilted, about 1 minute.
Add the cooked spaghetti and toss to coat with the oil and garlic mixture.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

3c3a00487b.gt:
combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl -- make well in center.
combine egg, milk and oil, stir well.
add to dry ingredients, just till moistened --
combine blueberries, 1 tbls flour and 1 tbls sugar, toss gently to coat.
fold into batter.
spoon batter into 6 greased jumbo muffin cups, 2/3 rds full --
combine 1/4 cup sugar, 2 1/2 tbls flour and cinnamon, cut in butter -- till crumbly --
sprinkle over batter.
bake at 400* for 20 minutes or golden.
remove from pan to wire rack immediately.
3c3a00487b.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, baking powder, sugar, lemon rind, and milk.
Stir in butter and egg.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Spoon into 12 greased muffin cups.
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm.

c5696489b7.gt:
Soften cream cheese and mix well with sour cream, cheese and salsa.
Make sure to drain the salsa if it has to much liquid.
Garnish with chopped tomato or cilantro.
c5696489b7.pred:
In a medium bowl, mix together the cream cheese, sour cream, and Mexican blend cheese.
Add the salsa and tomatoes or cilantro.
Mix well.
Serve with tortilla chips.

59de26d69e.gt:
Saute onions and celery
Add chicken powder & 4 cups of water add chicken pieces (wingdings) & cook on med high for 45mins
Add cream of chicken let cook for another 30 mins
Cook rice as it states on the box
Place rice on plate top with chicken and enjoy
59de26d69e.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Brown chicken in frying pan.
Add seasonings and onion to pan.
Add rice and water.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes.
Serve with gravy.

b5d5eda997.gt:
Preheat oven to 325F
mix cake in bowl...following the directions on the box.
add jell-o pudding
add strawberry extract
add 1\2 can of strawberry frosting
pour mixture in a floured cake pan.
I used a bundt pan
bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.
once cake has cooled, take the un-used portion of the frosting and microwave for 10 seconds.
stir and drizzle with spoon over cake
b5d5eda997.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes.
Cool completely.
Frost with strawberry frosting.

c799c55881.gt:
Combine the sun-dried tomatoes, parsley, butter, and Tabasco in a medium bowl and mix into a uniform paste.
Taste and season with salt and pepper as needed.
Place 8 slices of the toasted bread on a work surface.
Spread an even amount of the tomato butter on each slice, using it all up.
Set the remaining 4 unbuttered bread slices aside.
Place 2 pieces of bacon each on the buttered sides of 4 of the bread slices.
Top the bacon with 1/4 cup of the arugula per sandwich.
Top the arugula with a slice of the unbuttered bread.
Place a quarter of the sardines on top of each unbuttered piece of bread and season with pepper.
Top the sardines with another 1/4 cup of the arugula per sandwich, and finish with a slice of buttered bread, buttered-side down.
Slice each sandwich in half and serve.
c799c55881.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Butter 6 slices of bread.
Toast 8 slices of bread.
In a small bowl, combine the sun-dried tomatoes, parsley, butter, Tabasco, salt and pepper.
Spread 1/2 teaspoon of the tomato mixture on each slice of toast.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the sun-dried tomato mixture.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the bacon.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the sardine mixture.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the arugula.
Spread 1/2 teaspoon of the tomato mixture on each slice of toast.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the sun-dried tomato mixture.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the bacon.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the sardine mixture.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the arugula.
Spread 1/2 teaspoon of the tomato mixture on each slice of toast.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the sun-dried tomato mixture.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the bacon.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the sardine mixture.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the arugula.
Spread 1/2 teaspoon of the tomato mixture on each slice of toast.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the sun-dried tomato mixture.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the bacon.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the sardine mixture.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of the arugula.
Spread 1/2 teaspoon of the tomato mixture on each slice of toast.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspo

842d3c7eb8.gt:
Combine and mix all of the ingredients together in a bowl.
Mix the egg whites in a cutting motion.
Strain the mixture through a sieve and cook the tamagoyaki in a tamagoyaki pan.
Once cooled, cut into long strips.
842d3c7eb8.pred:
In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, shiro-dashi, water, sugar, and sake.
Add salt to taste.
Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Pour in the egg mixture and cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until the eggs are almost set.
Add the ingredients to the pan and continue to cook, stirring until the omelette is cooked through.
Serve immediately.

8fdec3f08f.gt:
Bring a saucepan of water to the boil, begin to cook the spaghetti
Prepare the topping.
Finely slice garlic, cut red pepper into thin strips, cut olives in half, cut crab sticks into cubes, slice salmon into small slices.
Shallow fry garlic, red pepper and olives until softened.
Add the crab sticks, salmon and shrimps and cook until it's pretty much there.
Throw in a dash of white wine and a dash of lemon juice.
Season to taste with salt, pepper, basil.
Drain spaghetti and combine with topping.
Generously slash it with olive oil.
Boom.
8fdec3f08f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook spaghetti according to package directions.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine smoked salmon, crab sticks, shrimps, red pepper, olives, white wine, lemon juice, garlic, basil, seasoned salt, and olive oil.
Stir until well combined.
Drain spaghetti and add to bowl with sauce.
Toss to coat.
Transfer to a 9x13 baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes, or until heated through.
Serve immediately.

f89bbed17a.gt:
Bring sweet potatoes and beets to a boil.
Slice sweet peppers lengthways.
Finely chop parsley.
Grate carrots and put aside in a bowl.
Cut beets into squares of medium to small sizes but not large.
Crush sweet potatoes and place both in a large bowl.
Chop up kale as finely as you can.
Ensure not to add the stalk.
Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl adding the salt and black pepper to taste.
Add sweet corn and cream style corn to bowl and mix.
In greased dish add approximately half of mixture.
Then add a layer of cheddar cheese and add all of the feta cheese.
Add remainder of mixture and layer top with cheddar cheese.
Bake at 190C for 30-45minutes.
Enjoy!
:)
f89bbed17a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix all ingredients except corn and cream style corn.
Pour into a 9 inch pie plate.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with corn and cream style corn.
Bake for 15 minutes longer.

586af1303f.gt:
In mixer, beat cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth.
Add the peanut butter, milk and 3 tablespoons peanuts.
Beat until smooth.
Fold in 2 cups of Cool whip.
Spoon filling into graham cracker crust.
Refrigerate for 1 hour or until set.
Top with remaining Cool Whip.
(You can either put Cool Whip on as a top layer, or you can individually serve the Cool Whip as a large dollop on each piece of pie.
).
To serve, place piece of pie on plate and drizzle with some chocolate syrup and then some caramel syrup.
Sprinkle with chopped roasted peanuts.
You can also serve with some powdered sugar, chocolate curls and mint sprigs.
586af1303f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter and sugar.
Press into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth.
Add the powdered sugar and milk and beat until well combined.
Add the peanut butter and beat until smooth.
Spread the peanut butter mixture into the crust.
In a small bowl, combine the chopped roasted peanuts, milk and chocolate syrup.
Spread over the peanut butter layer.
In a small bowl, combine the chopped roasted peanuts, milk and caramel syrup.
Spread over the chocolate layer.
In a large bowl, beat the Cool Whip until soft peaks form.
Spread over the caramel layer.
Sprinkle with chopped roasted peanuts.
Refrigerate for 4 hours or until set.

df3852f109.gt:
preheat the oven to 350F.
For the fruits: Dice the peaches and place in a large bowl.
Add the lemon zest, lemon juice, 1/2 sugar, and 1/4 flour.
Toss well.
Gently mix in the blueberries.
Allow the mixture to sit for 5 minutes.
Spoon mixture in a 8x11 baking dish.
For the crumble: combine 2 cups four, 2/3 cup sugar, 1/2 cup light brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 2 sticks of salted butter in a bowl.
Mix the ingredients with an electric mixer.
Mix until the butter is the size of a peas.
Rub the mixture with your fingertips until it's in big crumbles, then sprinkle evenly over the fruit mixture.
bake for 45 to 60 minutes, until the tips are brown and crisp and the juices are bubbly.
Serve warm or room temperature.
df3852f109.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine blueberries, peaches, lemon zest, lemon juice, sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl.
Mix well.
Place mixture in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Sprinkle with the diced butter.
Bake for 45 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown.
Serve warm.

a562032555.gt:
Mix the flour and salt in a large mixing bowl with a wooden spoon.
In another large bowl, empty the yeast package, then slowly add the warm water, mixing with a fork to fully dissolve the yeast.
When the yeast mixture forms some bubbles, add the mixture to the flour/salt, then add the three eggs.
Mix the batter, then set the bowl on top of your refrigerator (or other warm place), cover with damp dish towel.
After 20 minutes, check the dough for rising, mix again and let rise for another 20 minutes.
In a saucepan, heat the oil to medium heat.
Add the dough by the spoonful (about the size of 2 golf balls) Experiment with the first batch to make sure the oil is not too hot.
Remove when golden brown and place on paper bags to absorb the oil.
Place warm Zeppoles in a paper bag with powdered sugar and SHAKE.
Cover with powdered sugar.
a562032555.pred:
Mix together the flour, yeast, warm water and salt.
Add the eggs and powdered sugar and mix well.
Heat the corn oil in a large skillet.
Drop the batter by the teaspoonful into the hot oil.
Fry until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve warm.

8c7a346bad.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly grease a cookie sheet.
Unroll dough on lightly floured surface and press seams together.
Sprinkle one side of block of cream cheese with enough dill to cover.
Place cream cheese, dill side down, in center of dough.
Sprinkle with more dill to cover.
Bring sides of dough up around cheese block and seal to completely enclose.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 15 minutes.
Serve warm.
8c7a346bad.pred:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Spread cream cheese onto one side of each crescent roll.
Roll up the crescent dough and place seam side down on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with dill weed.
Serve warm.

83dee537f7.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix all of the ingredients (except the tomato sauce) together and form into (2) loaves.
Place loaves onto a lightly greased foil lined and rimmed cookie sheet.
Bake for 45 minutes, then pour one can tomato sauce over each loaf.
Return to oven to bake for another 15 minutes.
Let set 10 minutes before serving.
83dee537f7.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Place meat, sausage, stuffing mix, eggs, salt, pepper, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, and cheese in a large bowl.
Mix well.
Form into a loaf shape and place in a 9x5x3 inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
Remove from oven and let stand for 10 minutes.
Slice into 12 pieces and serve.

2b4cfb961c.gt:
Put all the ingredient in a slow cooker and mix thoroughly.
Cover and cook on high until apples are tender, about 3 hours.
The yummy salted-cinnamon-vanilla-caramel sauce that coats the apples will thicken slightly upon cooling.
Cook uncovered for a thicker sauce.
My conversion to feed a crowd of 40: I quadrupled the recipe and cooked it in my 18-quart electric roaster set to 300 degrees F for about 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
I used a mix of apples: galas, golden delicious, golden supreme, and Nittany.
Any apple that keeps its shape during baking will work well.
2b4cfb961c.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the apples, brown sugar, butter, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg.
Add the vanilla extract and stir to combine.
Pour the mixture into a slow cooker and cook on low for 4 hours.
Stir every hour.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

f105f448a6.gt:
Prepare all the ingredients first!
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Fry chili and spring onions and for two minutes.
Add tomato puree, garlic and ginger; stir and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add prawns and cook for five minutes until they change color and turn pink.
Add lime, coriander, 2 tablespoon creme fraiche and garam masala, let it all bubble for 2 minutes.
Top with the last tablespoon of creme fraiche, garnish with cilantro leaves and serve and eat immediately.
f105f448a6.pred:
In a large frying pan, heat the oil and fry the chilli, spring onions, garlic, and ginger until softened.
Add the tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the prawns and cook for 5 minutes until they turn pink.
Add the lime juice and cook for 1 minute.
Add the coriander and creme fraiche and cook for 1 minute.
Add the garam masala and salt to taste.
Serve with rice or naan bread.

dd261ac85d.gt:
In a large pot, heat the oil over moderately low heat.
Add the scallion bulbs and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes.
Add the Swiss chard, black-eyed peas, water, broth, Tabasco, and salt to the pot.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer, partially covered, stirring occasionally, until the black-eyed peas are tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir the ham into the soup and cook until the ham is warmed through, about 2 minutes.
Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the pepper, vinegar, and scallion tops.
dd261ac85d.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the scallions and cook, stirring, until softened, about 2 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the Swiss chard and cook, stirring, until wilted, about 5 minutes.
Add the water, broth, and Tabasco sauce.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, uncovered, until the greens are tender, about 10 minutes.
Add the black-eyed peas and ham and cook, stirring, until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove from the heat and stir in the vinegar.
Serve hot.

276686850b.gt:
Add 3 quarts water and olive oil to 6 quart pot.
Bring water to a boil.
Add noodles and boil 6 minutes.
No salt!
While noodles cook, pour cans of soup and Albacore into large mixing bowl and stir with a fork adding one soup can of water until it is smooth like gravy.
When noodles are done, drain them and rinse them with hot water.
Return cooked noodles to pan and add soup and tuna while stirring.
Pour tuna and noodle mixture into 9"x13" baking pan.
Sprinkle with pepper, garlic powder and spread both cheeses.
Add french fried onions evenly over the top of noodle mixture.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake in pre-heated 350 oven for 30 minutes.
Remove foil after baking for 30 minutes and increase oven temperature to 400 for 10 more minutes to brown onions and seal cheeses.
Cut into large squares and serve while hot.
276686850b.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the egg noodles and tuna.
In a medium bowl, combine the soup, cheeses, onions, pepper, and garlic powder.
Pour the soup mixture over the noodles and tuna.
Stir until well combined.
Pour into a 9x13 baking dish.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Top with french fried onions.
Bake for 10 more minutes.

af6f74da4c.gt:
Cut the enoki mushrooms into 3 even lengths, and shred apart.
Cut the tofu into 2 cm cubes.
Bring the dashi stock to a boil and add the ingredients.
Add the enoki mushrooms and tofu and bring to a gentle simmer again.
Serve in bowls scattered with some chopped green onion.
af6f74da4c.pred:
Preheat the broth.
In a large pot, combine the ingredients and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the tofu and enoki mushrooms.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the dashi stock, sake, mirin, and salt.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the usukuchi soy sauce.
Simmer for 1 minute.
Garnish with green onions.
Serve.

ef00415f9c.gt:
Wash the rice and leave for 30 minutes.
This is 900 g of asari clams with shells.
Steam the clams in sake and remove the meat from the shells.
Save the soup left behind from steaming the clams.
Refer to steps 6 - 9 to find out how to steam the clams with sake.
Add the washed rice to the rice cooker, along with the soup we took in step 3, cooking sake and soy sauce.
Fill with water until you reach the 2 cups mark (or however much liquid you would normally use for the amount of rice you want), and cook the rice.
Once the rice has cooked, add the clam meat and let them steam for a while.
How to steam clams: Add the asari clams to a frying pan, pour over some cooking sake, put on the lid, and steam-cook on a low-medium heat.
If you overcook the clams the meat will shrink so take them off the heat as soon as they start to open up.
This is how they look when they're opened.
Take a look at this related recipe too Fukagawa Don (Rice bowl).
ef00415f9c.pred:
In a large pot, bring 360 ml of water to a boil.
Add the rice and cook until it is tender and the water has been absorbed.
Meanwhile, in a separate pot, bring 600 grams of Manila clams (asari) and 1 1/2 tbsp of cooking sake / soy sauce to a boil.
Once the clams are open, drain them and set aside.
When the rice is cooked, add the clams and their broth to the rice.
Stir well and serve.

0f248f2042.gt:
In a large frying/saute pan add oil, butter and garlic, saute on low flame until oil starts to bubble.
Add tomatoes, salt and pepper.
Cook covered on a low flame for about 30 minutes.
Add vodka.
Cook uncovered for 25 minutes.
Add prosciutto-- cook 5 more minutes.
Add basil and heavy cream-- cook just 5 more minutes.
SERVE IT NOW!
I like this over penne pasta.
I only use Barilla.
0f248f2042.pred:
Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add the butter and garlic and cook until the garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the vodka and cook until the alcohol has evaporated, about 5 minutes.
Add the prosciutto and cook until the meat is heated through, about 2 minutes.
Add the basil and cream and cook until the sauce is thickened, about 10 minutes.
Serve over pasta.

5a22f9a832.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
Combine ground beef, rolled oats, French onion soup, and eggs in a bowl until thoroughly combined; transfer to prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until the meat loaf is no longer pink in the middle and an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf reads at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), 60 to 75 minutes.
5a22f9a832.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Form into a loaf and place on a greased baking sheet.
Bake for 45 minutes.

8b4a7055f2.gt:
Mix mayo, soy, juice, wasabi and onion together, fold through the crab meat and pile into the prepared avocado.
Serve immediately.
8b4a7055f2.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
Mix well.
Serve immediately.

2b3918d7ce.gt:
Core the peppers using the blunt edge of a potato peeler, save half the seeds removed, toss the core.
In a bowl add cream cheese, chili powder, hot sauce (you pick the heat) and liquid smoke and half the jalapeno seeds.
Mix/Mash together until blended.
Stuff the cored peppers with cream cheese mix then wrap with raw bacon.
Use your fingers!
Kabob them, repeat untill all the peppers are stuffed and wrapped.
Grill on an indirect heat, (on tin foil) for about 15 minutes.
Then on an open flame for 5-8 mins to crisp the bacon, turning a few times.
Serve and enjoy!
2b3918d7ce.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut jalapenos in half lengthwise, remove seeds and membranes.
Place cream cheese in a bowl and mix with chili powder and hot sauce.
Wrap each jalapeno half with a strip of bacon.
Place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until bacon is crispy.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Serve with a side of ranch dressing.

606b8ac522.gt:
Cut mars bars in 1cm thick slices, and place in a pyrex bowl.
Set the bow over a pot off boiling water and allow the chocolate to melt.
The nugget and caramel will take longer to melt then the chocolate, so stir vigorously until all the lumps have melted.
Remove from the heat, add the wipped cream and stir well.
You can add a little milk if the consistency is too thick.
Serve over ice cream.
Add a tot of brandy if you want hot chocolate brandy.
(Great for a cold day)
606b8ac522.pred:
Pour milk into a saucepan and add the Mars bars.
Melt the chocolate in the saucepan.
Add the whipping cream and mix well.
Pour into a mug and top with ice-cream.

2d86850b18.gt:
Mix all ingredients thoroughly and turn out onto a floured board, knead lightly and then roll out gently and cut into biscuits.
Brush lightly with melted butter or margarine.
Place of greased cookie sheet and bake at 450 degrees for about 15 minutes.
2d86850b18.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and oil.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Carefully fold in the starter.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until the dough is smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes.
Roll the dough out to a 1/2-inch thickness and cut out biscuits using a biscuit cutter or a glass.
Place the biscuits on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve warm with butter.

4256f1a9b2.gt:
Preheat oven to 300.
Prepare some boiling water.
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine cream, banana puree and 2 T. sugar.
Cook, stirring occasionally until small bubbles appear around edges of pan.
Set aside.
In a bowl, beat egg yolks and vanilla until smooth and light.
Pour hot cream mixture into egg yolks, a little at a time, beating continuously until well blended.
Strain mixture through a fine sieve into a bowl.
Divide mixture among 4 ramekins.
Arrange ramekins in a baking pan and place on middle shelf of preheated oven.
Fill pan with boiling water to halfway up sides of ramekins.
Cover pan loosely with aluminum foil.
Bake until custard is just set, about 25 minutes.
(this took an additional 9 minutes for mine, as I have deeper ramekins) Chill 2-3 hours.
Slice bananas horizontally into 1/2" slices and arrange on top of chilled creme brulees.
Sprinkle remaining sugar over tops of bananas.
With cooking torch, move flame econtinuously over the surface of the ramekins, in a circular motion until sugar melts and becomes golden brown and bubbly.
(this is where I failed.
I was afraid to add the entire 1/3 cup sugar, so didn't get enough carmelized effect) Serve immediately.
4256f1a9b2.pred:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
In a medium saucepan, combine the cream, bananas, and sugar.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Remove from heat and let cool.
In a large bowl, beat the egg yolks until thick.
Stir in the banana mixture and vanilla.
Pour into 6 ramekins.
Place ramekins in a roasting pan.
Pour enough hot water into the roasting pan to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Remove ramekins from the water bath and let cool.
Refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, sprinkle each ramekin with a little sugar and place under a broiler until sugar is caramelized.
Serve immediately.

2f09be220e.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl.
Spoon out into a glass pie plate or casserole dish.
Bake for 25 minutes.
Serve with nachos or corn chips.
2f09be220e.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the green pepper, onion, olives, cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese, and salsa.
Mix well.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Serve with tortilla chips.

6ad5b0a9bb.gt:
Pour 4 oz A&W Rootbeer in a glass
Add vodka and syrup to the root beer, stir well and add ice
6ad5b0a9bb.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a tall glass.
Top with additional ice.

675ec6c36f.gt:
Mix dry ingredients together in medium bowl.
Add all wet ingredients (eggs, buttermilk, and oil) to a separate bowl and stir just until blended.
If you need to substitute for the buttermilk: in a liquid measure put 2 Tbsp lemon juice and then fill the rest of the way to the 2c level with regular milk or milk substitute.
(it's a 1T to 1c ratio).
Add the wet ingredient to the dry ingredients just until combined.
Do not over mix, batter will be slightly lumpy.
Lightly coat skillet with oil.
Heat to medium low.
Drop 1/4 cup of batter onto heated skillet.
Use the back side of a spoon to help even out the batter.
Cook on first side until bubbles begin to form on surface and underside is golden, about 2 minutes.
Flip over and cook another 2 minutes until golden brown and center springs back when lightly touched.
Serve warm with maple syrup and butter.
675ec6c36f.pred:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees F.
Grease a 12-inch nonstick skillet with 1 tablespoon of the oil.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, eggs, and remaining 1 tablespoon oil.
Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the wet ingredients.
Stir just until the batter is smooth.
Pour the batter into the prepared skillet and cook over medium-low heat until the edges are set and the center is still a little wet, about 5 minutes.
Carefully flip the pancakes and cook until the other side is set, about 2 minutes more.
Transfer the pancakes to a baking sheet and keep warm in the oven.
Repeat with the remaining batter.
Serve immediately.

ea9ea44d2f.gt:
Place the cucumber, celery, garbanzo beans, carrots, raisins, and mint in a large bowl, and toss with the olive oil and red wine vinegar to coat.
Serve immediately.
ea9ea44d2f.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Add the olive oil and vinegar and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

6b9b0c6f34.gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Combine ingredients; spoon into 8 mounds, 2 inches apart, on parchment-covered baking sheets, using about 1 Tbsp.
cheese mixture for each.
Flatten slightly.
Bake 4 min.
or until golden brown around edges.
Cool on baking sheets 2 min.
Transfer to wire racks; cool completely.
6b9b0c6f34.pred:
Spread the cheese on a baking sheet and place in the oven at 350 degrees.
While the cheese is melting, mince the garlic and add the crushed red pepper.
When the cheese is melted, remove the baking sheet from the oven and spread the garlic and red pepper mixture over the melted cheese.
Return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for 5 minutes.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle the Parmesan cheese over the top.
Return to the oven and bake for 2 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
Enjoy!

952ff059c4.gt:
In medium bowl, mix cocoa, sugar and oil.
Beat in the egg replacer; stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder and salt.
Stir into cocoa mixture.
Cover and chill 4 hours (or put in the freezer for about 30 minutes).
Preheat oven to 350.
Lightly grease cookie sheet.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls.
Using your finger, poke a hole into the ball and place 2 marshmallow pieces inside.
Form dough back into a ball, making sure marshmallow is completely covered; coat with powdered sugar.
Bake in preheated oven for 10-12 minutes.
Leave on cookie sheet for 1 minute and then transfer to a wire rack or brown paper.
EGG REPLACER 1 egg = 2 TBSP water + 1 TBSP oil + 2 tsp baking powder
Make sure you mix these together before adding to the recipe (dont just throw them all into the batter they must be mixed together first).
952ff059c4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine cocoa powder, sugar, oil, egg replacers, vanilla, flour, baking powder, and salt.
Mix until well blended.
Fold in marshmallows.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
Bake for 10 minutes, or until the edges are set.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack.
Store in an airtight container.

80c8683fe0.gt:
To toast nuts, preheat oven to 375F (190C).
Spread nuts out on a baking sheet and bake until lightly toasted, about 5 minutes.
Nuts can be stored in the refrigerator.
Wash and separate endive into leaves.
Dry with a clean tea towel.
If not serving right away, place in a plastic bag and refrigerate for up to 1 day.
Whisk olive oil with vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper.
Taste and add more vinegar if needed.
Dressing can be left at room temperature for several hours or refrigerated in a sealed jar.
Vinaigrette becomes cloudy when cold.
When ready to serve, let vinaigrette come to room temperature.
Arrange endive on individual plates.
Shake vinaigrette and drizzle over salad.
Scatter toasted nuts over top.
Serve right away.
80c8683fe0.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the walnuts, endive, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper.
Mix well.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 hours.

18c37b1d2b.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve with fresh fruit and a glass of water.

6c3cf7db1f.gt:
Decase the sausage and saute in a large pot; use a wooden spoon to crumble the sausage as it cooks.
Once the sausage is nicely browned, stir in the onion, garlic, chili powder and cumin and continue cooking until the onion softens about 5 minutes.
Add the beer and allow it to simmer for an additional 5 minutes scraping up any brown bits from the bottom of the pan.
Stir in the tomatoes, tomato paste and allow it to simmer, uncovered for an additional 10-15 minutes on med-low, stirring occasionally.
Taste and adjust seasonings with salt and pepper.
Finally stir in the beans and the corn.
Let this come to a simmer and its ready to serve!
(Can be prepared a day ahead.
).
6c3cf7db1f.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large Dutch oven, brown sausage links on all sides.
Remove sausage from pan and set aside.
Add onion, garlic, chili powder, cumin, and salt to the pan.
Cook until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add beans, corn, tomatoes, tomato paste, beer, and 1 cup water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes.
Return sausage to the pan and simmer for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheese and sour cream.
Serve with tortilla chips.

ddf57796e4.gt:
Drain pineapple, reserving 1 cup of chunks, 1/2 cup juice (reserving juice for other purposes).
Combine 1/2 cup of the juice, ginger, soy sauce, cilantro and meat in bowl.
Cover bowl, marinate for 15 minutes.
In large, nonstick skillet, heat oil, add garlic, saute 30 seconds, until fragrant.
Remove the meat from the marinade, place in the skillet.
Stir fry 5 minutes, just until cooked through, remove the meat and keep warm.
Combine marinade and cornstarch in bowl.
Add the beans, chilies, pepper and marinade to skillet; stir fry 4 minutes (or until veggies are crisp tender and mixture is thickened).
Stir in 1 cup pineapple chunks, scallions and meat; heat through.
ddf57796e4.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add steak and stir-fry until browned on all sides, about 3 minutes.
Remove steak from skillet and set aside.
Add pineapple and ginger to skillet and cook until pineapple is heated through, about 2 minutes.
Add soy sauce and stir-fry until it thickens, about 1 minute.
Add cilantro, green beans, sweet pepper, scallions, and chili and stir-fry until green beans are tender, about 5 minutes.
Return steak to skillet and stir-fry until heated through, about 2 minutes.

a0b7c1096b.gt:
Strain plums through a sieve over a bowl, reserving juice.
Cut plums in half; discard pits.
Combine plums, reserved juice, red wine, honey, cinnamon, and cloves in a medium saucepan.
Bring to a boil.
Cover; reduce heat, and simmer 15 minutes.
Place half of soup in a blender; process until smooth.
Pour into a bowl.
Repeat procedure with other half of soup.
Stir in liqueur and rind.
Place 3/4 cup soup into each of 6 wine goblets.
Top each serving with 1 tablespoon yogurt and 1 mint sprig, if desired.
a0b7c1096b.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the plums, wine, honey, cinnamon, cloves, and Cointreau.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the yogurt and lemon rind and simmer for 5 minutes longer.
Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla.
Ladle into bowls and garnish with mint sprigs, if desired.

c53f241c68.gt:
In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in water.
Add the flours, and salt.
Stir until well blended.
The dough should be shaggy and sticky.
Let rise overnight, at least 12-18 hours, for best results.
Flour a work surface.
Fold dough over itself once or twice.
Place the dough, seam side down, on a floured kitchen towel.
Cover with another floured kitchen towel.Let the dough rise at room temperature for 1-2 hours.
Preheat the oven 20 minutes before the dough is ready to 475 degrees.
Put the dutch oven into the oven.
When dough is ready, take out the dutch oven, and then using the kitchen towels, flip the dough into the pot, seam side up.
Shake the pot if the dough loses it's shape.
Cover and bake for 30 minutes.
Uncover and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the dough is turned golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack, and enjoy!
c53f241c68.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the yeast, water and 1/2 cup of the flour.
Let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes.
Add the remaining flour, salt and 1/2 cup of the flour and mix well.
Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
Place in a greased bowl, cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.
Punch down and divide into 2 equal portions.
Shape each portion into a ball and place in a greased 9-inch round cake pan.
Cover and let rise until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from pan and cool on a wire rack.

88b045f0a0.gt:
Take the thawed roast, and cut several slits into (2-3 inches long) into it with a knife.
Put the thawed roast in a large crockpot.
Put the sliced onion, the coriander and the garlic cloves in the pot with the roast.
Fill the crockpot with water as close to the top of the roast as you can.
Add the four bouillion cubes to the water.
Cook at low (10 hours).
After 10 hours, turn the crockpot to warm, and remove the roast.
Strain out the onions, garlic, and coriander, and put them back in the crockpot.
Discard the water/broth.
Shred (or cut up in small pieces)the roast and put it back in the crockpot.
Stir in the cayenne, paprika, and black pepper, along with the lime juice.
Allow it to sit for ten minutes.
Put the barbecue sauce in with the roast, stirring to coat.
Allow it to sit for at least 20 minutes (the longer it sits, the better it is) and then eat!
88b045f0a0.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large pot, combine the pork, beef bouillon cubes, garlic, onion, cayenne pepper, paprika, ground black pepper, and lime juice.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Remove from heat and let cool.
Shred the pork and beef with two forks.
In a large bowl, combine the pork and beef, garlic, onion, cayenne pepper, paprika, ground black pepper, and lime juice.
Mix well.
Spread the barbecue sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Pour the pork mixture over the sauce.
Bake for 1 hour, or until the pork mixture is hot and bubbly.
Serve on buns or rolls.

22b18abc2f.gt:
*adding potatoes and corn are optional
Add all ingredients, except shrimp to a large saucepan on high heat.
Bring to a boil for 10 minutes.
Reduce the heat to low.
Add the shrimp and cook until bright pink, about 5 minutes.
Drain the shrimp from the cooking liquid and place in a serving dish.
Chill or eat while warm, enjoy!!!
!
22b18abc2f.pred:
Place the shrimp in a large pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
Remove the shrimp from the pot and set aside.
Add the onions, garlic, crab boil seasoning, bay leaves, peppercorns, and lemon to the pot and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the beer and hot sauce and simmer for 3 minutes.
Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and serve.

f4e0bc9330.gt:
combine chopped broccoli and chicken broth and bring to a boil.
cook until broccoli is tender.
in a separate pan saute onions in butter until translucent but not browned.
add this mixture to the broccoli and broth stirring in the flour.
cook until thickened.
add milk, cream, seasoning and cheese.
simmer until cheese melts, but do not boil before serving.
f4e0bc9330.pred:
In a large saucepan, saute the onion in the butter until soft.
Add the broccoli and cook until tender.
Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in the flour.
Return to heat and stir until thickened.
Add the milk, cream, pepper, thyme, salt and cheese.
Stir until cheese is melted and the soup is heated through.

02f021290a.gt:
Cream butter & sugar, add eggs (1 at a time) beating after each one.
Dissolve baking soda in buttermilk.
Add to creamed mixture.
Add dates and orange slice to flour to coat.
Add coconut.
Combine the two mixtures.
Makes stiff dough that should be mixed with your hands.
Bake in a greased and floured 13x9x3 pan at 250* for 2 1/2 hours.
Combine orange juice and powered sugar and our over the hot cake.
Let it stand over night before serving.
02f021290a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.
In a large bowl, cream together the margarine or butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until well blended.
Stir in the baking soda and buttermilk.
Add the flour, dates, candy orange slices, nuts, and coconut.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
Invert the cake onto the rack and cool completely.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar.
Cut into squares and serve.

582a1779fb.gt:
Put all ingredients into a blender or food processor.
Process until smooth.
Pour into glass.
Enjoy!
582a1779fb.pred:
In a blender, combine the milk, orange juice, strawberries, yogurt, peanut butter, chocolate drink mix, and honey.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and enjoy!

8b290d6b5c.gt:
Preheat oven to 330 degrees F (165C).
Butter and flour a 10 inch bundt pan.
Combine flour, baking powder, soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt.
In large bowl, cream butter with sugar until light and fluffy (no less than 6 minutes).
Add eggs; beat until smooth.
Add flour mixture alternately with yoghurt (or sour cream); beat until smooth.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake about 1 hour, or until tester comes out with a few moist crumbs attached.
Preheat broiler.
Combine brown sugar, butter, almonds, coconut, milk and vanilla.
Spoon mixture over top of cake.
Place under broiler, 3 inches from heat source until lightly browned.
WATCH VERY CAREFULLY as this can go from caramelly to burned in no time!
8b290d6b5c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add eggs, yogurt, and milk.
Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Add flour mixture to creamed mixture alternately with the milk.
Fold in toasted almonds and coconut.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.

00707f2955.gt:
Fry bacon.
Remove bacon from pan; add butter.
Add flour; purists say don't brown flour but I do because I don't like a raw flour taste, and I cook on high (sigh).
Add milk.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook until thickened.
Add cheese.
crumble up bacon and add here.
00707f2955.pred:
In a large saucepan, melt butter and bacon.
Add flour and stir until smooth.
Add milk and stir until thickened.
Add salt, pepper, cheese and stir until melted.
Serve over your favorite pasta.

3e75168d43.gt:
Heat oven to 375.
Place bananas cut sides up in a buttered baking dish (8 or 9-in square) and sprinkle with marshmallows, chocolate chips, and brown sugar.
Mix cornflakes with butter and sprinkle over top.
Bake about 12 minutes or until bananas are tender.
3e75168d43.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place peeled bananas in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Mix together melted butter, brown sugar, corn flakes, and chocolate chips.
Sprinkle over bananas.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Serve warm with a drizzle of syrup.

ec1a27fd77.gt:
In a ceramic bowl over boiling water melt the chocolate, water and butter together over a pot of boiling water.
(Bain marie method)
Pour the melted chocolate over the sugar and mix well.
Then separate the egg yolks from the egg whites.
And one by one add the yolks to the mixture mixing after each one.
Beat the egg whites until they are firm.
Then fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture.
Once its all nicely mixed spoon into invidual ramekins.
Leave in the fridge for two hours to set.
Once set decorate your mousse.
I sprinkled powdered suger over mine just before serving and added a few slices of banana.
ec1a27fd77.pred:
In a small saucepan, melt the chocolate and butter together.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the melted chocolate and butter to the egg mixture and whisk until smooth.
Add the water and whisk until combined.
Pour the mixture into a mold and chill for 2 hours.
Once chilled, unmold and serve.

8a8a89a6fc.gt:
In a small pot over medium heat, add coconut milk, sugar, salt and 1 cup of the chopped fruit.
Bring to a simmer and add the oatmeal.
Reduce the heat to medium low and stir often, cooking the oatmeal for about 10 minutes until oats are tender and liquid has cooked down.
Transfer oats to a bowl and garnish with extra fresh chopped fruit and any other toppings.
Here are a few suggestions for toppings and add-ins: coconut sugar or brown sugar honey or agave for drizzling chopped walnuts, almonds or pistachios dried fruit
8a8a89a6fc.pred:
Heat the coconut milk in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add the brown sugar, salt, and cinnamon.
Stir until the sugar dissolves.
Add the oats and fruit.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the oats are tender and the mixture is creamy.
Serve hot.

b3016a1ae9.gt:
Divide cucumber slices among canning jars.
Add 1/2 teaspoon pickling spice and 1/2 teaspoon turmeric to each jar.
Stir vinegar, water, sugar, and sea salt together in a large saucepan and bring to a boil.
Cook and stir until the sugar and salt dissolve; cook at a boil for 2 minutes.
Carefully fill jars with brine to within 1/2 inch of the rim, covering the cucumbers completely.
Discard any leftover brine.
Place the lids on the jars.
Refrigerate at least 24 hours before serving.
Store in the refrigerator for up to 6 months.
b3016a1ae9.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the cucumbers, pickling spice, turmeric, vinegar, water, and sugar.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat and let cool.
Pack the cucumbers into the jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace.
Place the lids and rings on the jars and screw on the rings tightly.
Let the jars sit at room temperature for 24 hours.
Store in a cool, dark place for 2 weeks before eating.

df687bb6ec.gt:
Spray a 9x14 casserole dish with cooking spray.
Place the chicken in the casserole dish.
Mix all remaining ingredients in a bowl.
Pour over chicken breasts in dish.
Bake at 350 degrees (F) for 30 minutes.
Serve with potatoes or egg noodles.
df687bb6ec.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, brown chicken in bacon fat.
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Add onion, mushrooms, and sun dried tomatoes to skillet and saute until onions are translucent.
Add cream of mushroom soup and red wine vinegar and stir until well blended.
Add chicken back to skillet and heat through.
Stir in sage, oregano, roasted garlic, and red pepper seasoning.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in basil.
Serve over rice or pasta.

73d085e33c.gt:
Preheat a panini grill.
Slice each quarter of focaccia bread in half horizontally.
Spread each half with pesto.
Layer bottom halves with equal amounts chicken, bell pepper, onion, and cheese.
Top with remaining focaccia halves, forming 4 sandwiches.
Grill paninis 5 minutes in the preheated grill, or until focaccia bread is golden brown and cheese is melted.
73d085e33c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spread pesto evenly over both sides of the focaccia bread.
Place focaccia on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly toasted.
Remove from oven and set aside.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink.
Add green bell pepper and red onion and cook until tender.
Add Monterey Jack cheese and cook until melted.
Spread chicken mixture evenly over focaccia.
Top with remaining 1/2 cup of pesto.
Cut focaccia into 4 equal pieces.
Serve immediately.

1bcf4a39d5.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Press pie crust into a 9-inch deep dish pie plate.
Cover the edges of the crust with aluminum foil.
Bake pie crust until lightly browned, about 12 minutes.
Set pie crust aside to cool.
Increase oven heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp, about 10 minutes.
Drain the bacon slices on paper towels, while retaining drippings in the skillet.
Stir zucchini, mushrooms, onion, and garlic into the reserved bacon drippings; season with Italian seasoning, dill, parsley, garlic salt, and black pepper.
Cook and stir the zucchini mixture until the zucchini is tender yet crisp, 5 to 7 minutes; remove from heat.
Chop the bacon and stir through the zucchini mixture.
Sprinkle about half the mozzarella cheese into the bottom of the pie crust.
Spoon zucchini mixture over the mozzarella cheese layer.
Pour eggs over the zucchini mixture; top with remaining mozzarella cheese.
Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the mozzarella cheese.
Put pie plate onto a baking sheet.
Bake in preheated oven until the top begins to brown, about 30 minutes.
1bcf4a39d5.pred:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp.
Remove bacon from skillet and drain on paper towels.
Discard all but 1 tablespoon of bacon grease.
Add zucchini and mushrooms to skillet and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add Italian seasoning, dill weed, parsley, garlic salt, and black pepper.
Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Remove from heat and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine zucchini mixture, bacon, mozzarella cheese, egg, and Parmesan cheese.
Pour into pie crust and bake for 30 minutes or until set.
Cool slightly before cutting and serving.

30ddae3add.gt:
Slice the sausage, clean the vegetables and slice the zucchini.
Other vegetables will work for this as well (some ideas are mushrooms, onions, peppers, or tomatoes).
Throw everything in the pot except the cream and Parmesan.
Bring to a boil as then simmer for about 10 minutes.
Stir frequently and check noodles for doneness at about 7 minutes.
Remove from heat once the noodles are done.
Any extra liquid is fine as the pasta will dry out after sitting for a minute or two.
Add the cream and Parmesan (you can add a couple tablespoons of olive oil instead of cream should you choose to).
Stir well.
Enjoy!
30ddae3add.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Meanwhile, brown sausage in a large skillet over medium heat.
Drain pasta and add to skillet with sausage.
Add spinach, broth, garlic, garlic powder, pepper, chili powder, and salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in cream and Parmesan cheese.
Cook until sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes.
Serve immediately.

54bc08b13e.gt:
Combine cream, milk, water, cocoa powder, corn syrup, and salt in a medium saucepan.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat, whisking until cocoa powder is completely dissolved.
Remove from heat and add chocolate, butter, and vanilla, stirring until chocolate is melted and sauce is smooth.
Serve warm.
54bc08b13e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler over low heat, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the corn syrup and salt.
Remove from heat and stir in the water.
Stir in the chopped chocolate.
Pour into a 1-quart casserole dish.
Bake for 25 minutes.
Cool completely.
Serve warm or cold.

8121dfc152.gt:
Cut herring into small cubes.
Mix herring with onion, eggs, apple and lemon juice.
Combine sour cream, garlic, salt and pepper; add to herring mixture and mix well.
Sprinkle with dill or parsley.
Serve with rye bread.
8121dfc152.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, sour cream, salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, combine the eggs, onion, garlic, apple, herring and dill.
Add the lemon juice mixture and mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve with rye bread.

3986074ac9.gt:
In a large bowl, mix together cottage cheese, caraway seed, sugar, monosodium glutamate (MSG), white pepper, chives and celery salt.
Allow the mixture to chill in the refrigerator 8 to 12 hours, or overnight, before serving.
3986074ac9.pred:
In a medium bowl, combine the cottage cheese, caraway seeds, sugar, MSG, white pepper, and chives.
Stir to combine.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Serve with celery salt.

b8e018f7cd.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Spray lined baking sheet with cooking spray.
Remove eyes and scrape away bruises and dice potatoes.
Add olive oil, salt, pepper and any other seasonings you like and toss to coat.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, turn and bake for another 15-20 minutes.
b8e018f7cd.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Place potatoes in a large bowl.
Add olive oil, salt, pepper, and herbs.
Toss to coat potatoes.
Spread potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, stirring once.
Add paprika to taste.
Bake for 10 more minutes, or until potatoes are tender.

827de473ae.gt:
Position oven rack to center position.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Butter a 10-inch pie plate.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir bacon in the hot skillet until crisp, 5 to 10 minutes.
Remove bacon and drain all but 2 tablespoons grease from skillet.
Cook and stir asparagus and mushrooms in the remaining bacon grease until asparagus is tender, about 5 minutes.
Remove skillet from heat and toss bacon into asparagus mixture.
Spread asparagus-bacon mixture into the prepared pie pan.
Sprinkle Swiss cheese over mixture.
Whisk cream, eggs, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Pour egg mixture over asparagus-cheese mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until quiche is set and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
827de473ae.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp.
Remove bacon from skillet and drain on paper towels.
Discard all but 2 tablespoons of bacon drippings.
Add asparagus and mushrooms to skillet and cook until tender.
Add Swiss cheese and cream and cook until cheese is melted.
Remove from heat and stir in eggs.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour into a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 30 minutes or until set.
Sprinkle with bacon and serve.

3b92f8e755.gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees.
Place a ridged cast-iron skillet or other heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Working in batches, brush eggplant slices on both sides with olive oil and cook, turning, until soft and (if using a ridged pan) crisscrossed with grid marks.
Set aside and allow to cool.
In a large bowl, combine feta, pine nuts, raisins, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, bread crumbs, garlic, lemon zest, mint and parsley.
Mix in egg, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Spread eggplant slices on a surface, and divide stuffing evenly among them, placing 1 to 2 tablespoons at one end of each slice.
Roll up slices tightly to secure filling, and place in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish (or other shallow baking pan in which rolls fit snugly in a single layer).
Pour crushed tomatoes on top of eggplant rolls.
Arrange mozzarella slices in a line lengthwise down center of pan.
Drizzle olive oil evenly over pan, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Bake until cheese has melted and eggplant is bubbling and fragrant, 25 to 30 minutes.
Remove from heat and allow to stand 5 to 10 minutes.
Serve hot.
3b92f8e755.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the eggplant slices, feta cheese, pine nuts, raisins, olive oil, lemon zest, mint, parsley, garlic, and egg.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
On a lightly floured surface, roll the eggplant slices into 1-inch wide rolls.
Place 1/2 cup of the tomatoes, 1/4 cup of the cheese, and 1/2 teaspoon of the mint and parsley in the center of each eggplant roll.
Fold the eggplant in half and roll up tightly.
Secure with a toothpick.
Brush the rolls with olive oil and bake for 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
Drizzle with olive oil and serve.

fc76b776c7.gt:
Pre-heat oven to gas mark 2/300F/150C.
Prepare a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
First of all, beat the butter in a bowl with a wooden spoon to soften it.
Beat in the sugar, followed by the sifted flour and semolina.
Work the ingredients together with the spoon, pressing them to the side of the bowl, then finish off with your hands until you have a smooth mixture that doesn't leave any bits in the bowl.
Divide the mixture into 9, and shape each portion into a ball (dust the work surface with flour if you find the mixture too sticky to work with).
Flatten each one slightly and prick the centre with a fork (but not all the way through).
To make it look pretty, make a 1 cm crinkly border on the top by lightly pressing a fork making a slight indent working all the way around (working for the edge towards the centre).
Make sure that the biscuits are at least 1/2 inch in thickness (with the indentations at the edges).
Place onto the prepared baking sheet, very well spaced out as they will spread out quite a bit during baking.
Bake them for 50-60 minutes on the centre shelf of the oven (keep an eye on it after 45 mins - the edges seem to colour more easily than the top) it should have turned pale gold and feel firm in the centre.
Remove from the oven and dust the top with caster sugar.
Leave it to cool for 5 minutes on the baking tray before transferring them onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Store in an airtight container.
fc76b776c7.pred:
Preheat oven to 180C.
Line a 20cm square baking tin with baking paper.
Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Add the flour and semolina and mix well.
Press the dough into the prepared tin and bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool in the tin.
When cool, cut into squares and dust with caster sugar.

05010dda12.gt:
Place all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well with a spoon.
Sift mixture twice.
Store in a tightly covered container, as it keeps well for several weeks at room temperature.
05010dda12.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Roll into 1 inch balls and place on a greased cookie sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes.
Cool on wire racks.

3d390b8cc2.gt:
Heat 1 T oil in a large soup pot over medium high heat.
Add sausage, and cook 3 to 4 minutes or until browned on all sides.
Transfer sausages to a plate.
Add remaining oil to drippings in pot to equal 1/4 C cup.
Whisk in flour Cook over low heat, stirring frequently for about 20 minutes or until mixture is dark reddish-brown.
Stir in onion, peppers, celery and garlic and saute over medium heat for 8 minutes or until softened.
Stir in stock and next 9 ingredients .
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer, covered for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile cook grits according to package directions and and cheese.
Cover and keep warm.
Stir in sausage, shrimp, and crab sections and cook for about 3-4 minutes or until shrimp are just done.
Do not overcook.
Remove bay leaves and serve gumbo over cheese grits.
Season with hot sauce if desired.
3d390b8cc2.pred:
In a large Dutch oven, heat 1/2 cup of the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the sausage and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 5 minutes.
Remove the sausage from the pot and set aside.
Add the remaining 1/2 cup oil to the pot and heat over medium-high heat.
Add the onion, bell peppers, celery, and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft, about 10 minutes.
Add the sausage, stock, tomatoes, okra, thyme, bay leaves, salt, pepper, cayenne, file powder, and lime juice.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the gumbo is thickened, about 1 1/2 hours.
Add the shrimp and crab and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the seafood is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Serve over hot, cooked grits.
Garnish with hot sauce, if desired.

27dd242a7a.gt:
Mix first 6 ingredients together and place in an oven proof casserole dish.
Sprinkle cheese on top and bake for 15 to 20 minutes at 350.
Serve hot over chips,this isn't very good cold.
27dd242a7a.pred:
In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, and frito bean dip.
Add the Tabasco sauce and salt.
Mix well.
Add the green onions and cheeses.
Mix well.
Serve with tortillas or corn chips.

663548f6ad.gt:
Do not peel potatoes.
Cut potatoes in long, uniformly shaped sticks.
Fry in hot oil(approx 325F)to desired doneness(dark & well done is the way they do them at the stands on the boardwalk).
Remove fries to paper towels and generously salt right away.
Serve in a paper cup or cone with plenty of malt vinegar.
663548f6ad.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch thick slices.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Fry potato slices in batches until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels.
Season with salt and malt vinegar.

06e92239ab.gt:
Combine all of the ingredients in a mason jar, screw on the top and shake to thoroughly mix.
Let sit for at least 20 minutes.
Keep refrigerated.
Makes about 3/4 to 1 cup of dressing.
06e92239ab.pred:
In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, oil, mustard, honey, garlic, salt and pepper.
Serve over salad greens or as a dip for fresh vegetables.

5c9b0f1426.gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
Rinse asparagus and snap off the tough ends.
Spray a cookie sheet and lay asparagus on it then sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Cook in a preheated oven for 8-10 minutes.
Sprinkle the blue cheese and walnuts on HOT asparagus.
Return the asparagus to the oven for an additional 1-2 minutes.
5c9b0f1426.pred:
Roast the asparagus in the oven at 400 degrees for 10 minutes.
Drizzle with blue cheese and walnuts.
Serve with a sprinkle of salt and pepper.

16b48ecd6b.gt:
All the ingredients in brackets can be added according to your own taste.
Peel and slice the potatoes and cook them for about 10 or 15 minutes in a microwave.
Fry the chopped onion with garlic (and chopped chilli).
Add the beef chunks (bacon bits) to the already fried mixture.
Cook the meat.
Add the sliced peppers (mushrooms).
When the meat is cooked add the potatoes and toss everything together until everything is heated through.
If the meat looks like it's drying add a little bit of wine (or water with a dash of vinegar if you don't want to or can't use alcohol).
16b48ecd6b.pred:
In a large pot, boil the potatoes until tender.
Remove the potatoes from the water and set aside.
In the same pot, saute the onion and garlic until the onion is translucent.
Add the beef chunks and cook until browned.
Add the potatoes and the pepper and cook until the potatoes are heated through.
Season with salt and pepper.

9405c380d3.gt:
Place a large pot or saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add the butter, allow to melt then add the garlic, ginger, 1/2 of the cream, soy sauce, a few grindings of black pepper, pinch of salt, sugar and sweet potatoes.
Reduce heat to low, cover and cook until the sweet potatoes are very tender, about 45 minutes.
Remove from heat, mash with a potato masher adding the remaining cream.
Taste, adjust seasoning with black pepper and soy sauce as needed.
Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve.
9405c380d3.pred:
In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the cream and sugar and cook, stirring, until the sugar dissolves.
Add the soy sauce, tamari, ginger, garlic, and sweet potatoes.
Cook, stirring, until the sweet potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with black pepper to taste.
Remove from the heat and stir in the cilantro.
Serve warm.

e29121a9a8.gt:
In a food processor, puree the avocados with the chickpeas, lemon juice and tahini.
Add the 1/2 cup of oil and puree until smooth; season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the dip to a bowl, drizzle with olive oil and serve with crudites, bread and chips.
e29121a9a8.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the avocados, chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, olive oil, salt and pepper in a food processor.
Process until smooth.
Spoon into a serving bowl and drizzle with more olive oil.
Serve with crudites, bread and tortilla chips.

8b231f2c0b.gt:
In a double boiler over medium heat, melt the butter and chocolate chips, whisking constantly until combined.
Whisk in the evaporated milk and powdered sugar and bring to a boil, stirring often, for 8 minutes.
Remove from heat and add vanilla.
Store in a glass container in the refrigerator.
Keeps for several weeks.
Makes approximately 3 cups.
8b231f2c0b.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan.
Heat over medium heat, stirring constantly, until butter is melted.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Serve warm or cold.

97117994fc.gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Beat first 6 ingredients in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Stir in apples.
Pour into greased and floured 12-cup fluted tube pan or 10-inch tube pan.
Bake 50 min.
to 1 hour or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean.
Cool cake in pan 15 min.
Loosen cake from sides of pan; invert onto wire rack.
Gently remove pan.
Cool cake completely.
Transfer to plate.
Microwave caramels and milk in microwaveable bowl on HIGH 1-1/2 min.
or until caramels are completely melted and sauce is smooth, stirring every 30 sec.
Cool 10 min.
or until slightly thickened.
Drizzle over cake just before serving.
97117994fc.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour 2 9-inch round cake pans.
Prepare cake mix as directed on package.
Pour 1/3 cup water into a medium bowl.
Add dry pudding mix and whisk until smooth.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat eggs and oil until light and fluffy.
Add milk, apples and chopped caramels.
Beat until well blended.
Pour into prepared pans.
Bake 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes.
Remove from pans and cool completely on wire racks.
To make the caramel topping, melt the 3 tablespoons of milk in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Add the chopped caramels and stir until melted.
Drizzle over the cake.

6ea1219c93.gt:
Chop the sweet potato into small cubes, and soak in water to remove the bitterness.
Transfer to a heatproof dish, wrap in plastic wrap, and microwave (for 2 to 3 minutes at 500W).
Heat water and sugar in a sauce pan, and add the sweet potatoes once the sugar dissolves.
Simmer until the liquid boils out.
Bring the eggs to room temperature.
Sift together the almond powder, cake flour, cinnamon, and baking powder.
Microwave or double boil the butter to melt.
Beat the egg in a bowl, add the brown sugar and honey, and mix well.
