In a large bowl, combine egg, milk, mayonnaise, 1/4 cup of the cheese, salt, and pepper.
Mix well.
Pour mixture over potato wedges.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender and cheese is melted.

283c2400cb.gt:
Transfer cream to bowl of 5-quart electric stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment.
Tightly cover top of bowl and mixer with plastic wrap.
Beat cream at moderately high speed until it holds soft peaks, 10 to 12 minutes.
Increase speed to high and beat until mixture separates into thick, pale-yellow butter and thin, liquid buttermilk, about 5 minutes more.
Strain mixture through colander into large bowl.
Using hands, vigorously knead butter in colander, squeezing out remaining buttermilk, until dense and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Transfer butter to large bowl, reserving buttermilk.
Using hands, knead salt into butter.
Roll into logs and wrap in plastic wrap or transfer to airtight container and refrigerate.
(Butter will keep up to 1 week refrigerated or 1 month frozen.)
Strain buttermilk through fine-mesh sieve, then cover and refrigerate up to 1 week.
283c2400cb.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a 5-quart stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the cream on medium speed until it begins to thicken, about 5 minutes.
Add the salt and beat until the cream holds soft peaks, about 1 minute.
Transfer the cream to a large bowl and let cool to room temperature.
In a small bowl, whisk together the buttermilk and the butter.
Add the buttermilk mixture to the cream and beat on medium speed until the butter is incorporated and the mixture is smooth, about 1 minute.
Pour the mixture into an 8-inch square baking dish and bake until the top is golden brown and the center is set, about 45 minutes.
Cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours.
Serve with fresh fruit, berries, or toasted bread.

6a751b3cb8.gt:
Crumble the tofu and chop the vegetables.
You can also use other vegetables you like, such as spinach, kale, bell pepper, black olives, broccoli, onion.
Put a little splash of extra virgin olive oil in a pan on medium heat and saute mushrooms and asparagus (or whatever veggies you are using that take a little longer to cook).
Once they are cooked and starting to brown, set aside for a few minutes.
Add a little more oil to the pan to prevent the tofu from sticking.
Add tofu crumbles, and start with 1 teaspoon ground turmeric, adding more if needed.
Mix together until turmeric is evenly dispersed and tofu is a nice yellow egg-y color.
Add cheese shreds and nutritional yeast (adds more cheesiness) to the tofu and mix until cheese starts to melt.
Add all veggies to the pan, including sauteed mushrooms and asparagus.
Gently mix in salt, pepper, and garlic powder to taste.
6a751b3cb8.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add tofu and mushrooms and cook until tofu is golden brown and mushrooms are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add asparagus and cook until tender, about 3 minutes.
Add tomato and avocado and cook until tomato is soft and avocado is heated through, about 2 minutes.
Add turmeric, salt and pepper, and garlic powder and stir to combine.
Add cheese and nutritional yeast and stir until cheese is melted.
Serve hot in a bowl.

58c85cf057.gt:
Mix 2 Tbsp flour and the salt and pepper in a ziptop bag.
Add chicken; shake to coat.
Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet.
Add chicken; saute 5 minutes, or until cooked through.
Remove to a plate.
In a cup, mix remaining flour, the broth and garlic.
Add asparagus to skillet and saute 1 minute until bright green.
Stir chicken broth mixture, add to pan and cook 1 minute until thickened slightly and asparagus are tender.
Add chicken back to pan.
Stir in tomatoes; remove from heat.
Stir in scallions and dill.
58c85cf057.pred:
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the skillet.
Add the asparagus and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Add the broth and bring to a boil.
Return the chicken to the skillet and cook, covered, over medium heat until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and scallions and cook, stirring, until the tomatoes are heated through, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

88803603ec.gt:
Place sardines in 11 x 7 x 2-inch glass baking dish.
Sprinkle fish with 1 teaspoon coarse salt.
Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare barbecue (medium-high heat).
Combine cilantro, parsley, and lemon peel in small bowl.
Mix olives and onion in another small bowl.
Brush sardines lightly with oil.
Sprinkle half of herb mixture over sardines; turn to coat.
Grill sardines until just opaque in center, 1 to 2 minutes per side, depending on size.
Arrange sardines on platter.
Sprinkle with olive mixture, then remaining herb mixture.
Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.
Garnish with lemon wedges.
88803603ec.pred:
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Brush the sardines with olive oil and season with salt and herbs.
Grill the sardines, turning once, until just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer the sardines to a serving platter and garnish with lemon wedges.
Serve with the lemon wedges and olives.

e65b0ff688.gt:
Combine chicken strips, orange juice, and 1 teaspoon cornstarch in a medium bowl; cover and chill 1 hour.
Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add cashews; cook, stirring constantly, 30 seconds.
Remove from skillet; set aside.
Add chicken mixture to skillet.
Cook, uncovered, over medium-high heat 8 minutes or until chicken is lightly browned, stirring constantly.
Add water chestnuts and next 3 ingredients; cook 5 minutes.
Combine broth, soy sauce, and 1 tablespoon cornstarch; add to chicken mixture.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat, and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Remove from heat; stir in oranges.
Spoon chicken mixture over rice, and sprinkle with cashews.
Serve immediately.
e65b0ff688.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup cornstarch with 1/4 cup orange juice.
In a large skillet, heat 1 teaspoon oil over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Add remaining 1/4 cup cornstarch to the skillet and stir until dissolved.
Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup orange juice, the remaining 1/4 teaspoon oil, the cashews, water chestnuts, green pepper, green onion, ginger, broth, soy sauce, and mandarin oranges.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 10 minutes.
Stir in the cooked rice and chicken.
Cover and bake for 20 minutes.
Uncover and bake 10 minutes more, or until chicken is cooked through and sauce is thickened.

4ebe6235f7.gt:
Combine cheese and salsa over low heat until melted.
Stir in sour cream.
Pour over split hot baked potatoes.
4ebe6235f7.pred: Mix all ingredients together and serve.

8b434331f6.gt:
Heat oven to 425F.
Cook broccoli according to pkg directions.
Mix margarine, onion salt, parsley, onion powder in saucepan.
Heat until melted.
Set aside.
Mix baking mix, wine, & chicken until soft dough forms.
You can add a little extra wine if there is still some of the baking mix not mixed in.
Press into bottom of baking dish.
Pour butter mixture over biscuit mixture.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Pour broccoli over biscuit mix.
Cut into squares & serve.
8b434331f6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine the broccoli with the cheese sauce.
In a separate bowl, mix together the margarine, onion salt, parsley flakes, onion powder, and flour.
Add the chicken and wine to the broccoli mixture and stir to combine.
Add the flour mixture to the broccoli mixture and stir until combined.
Spoon the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.

f78a4f2c70.gt:
Preheat oven to 425F.
Coat baking sheet with cooking spray.
Heat large, deep skillet over medium heat.
Add 1 Tbs.
oil, and swirl to coat pan.
Add onion and cook 5 minutes, or until onion becomes translucent, stirring often.
Stir in button mushrooms, garlic, and salt, and cook 8 to 10 minutes, or until mushrooms are soft and most of liquid is evaporated, stirring frequently.
Stir in rice, and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer, or until heated through.
Remove from heat, and stir in goat cheese.
Fill each portobello with about 1/3 cup filling mixture.
Toss tomatoes with lemon juice in bowl, and lay tomato halves cut-side up over tops of filled portobellos.
Place stuffed portobellos on baking sheet greased with remaining 1 Tbs.
oil, and sprinkle each with 1 tsp.
breadcrumbs.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes, or until mushrooms are cooked through and breadcrumbs are golden.
Sprinkle with parsley.
f78a4f2c70.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the mushrooms, onion, garlic, salt, and 1 Tbs.
of the olive oil.
Stuff each mushroom with the mixture.
Place the mushrooms in a baking dish and top with the remaining 1 Tbs.
of olive oil, the wild rice, and the goat cheese.
Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and bake for 30 minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve.

8c03aee630.gt:
Whisk together lime zest and juice, butter, oil, sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl.
Wash quinoa in 3 changes of cold water in a bowl, draining in a sieve each time.
Cook quinoa in a medium pot of boiling salted water (1 tablespoon salt for 2 quarts water), uncovered, until almost tender, about 10 minutes.
Drain in sieve, then set sieve in same pot with 1 inch of simmering water (water should not touch bottom of sieve).
Cover quinoa with a folded kitchen towel, then cover sieve with a lid (don't worry if lid doesn't fit tightly) and steam over medium heat until tender, fluffy, and dry, about 10 minutes.
Remove pot from heat and remove lid.
Let stand, still covered with towel, 5 minutes.
Add quinoa to dressing and toss until dressing is absorbed, then stir in remaining ingredients and salt and pepper to taste.
8c03aee630.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the lime zest, lime juice, butter, oil, sugar, and 2 cups water.
Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring occasionally.
Add the quinoa and simmer, covered, until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender, about 15 minutes.
Stir in the black beans and tomatoes.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, until the quinoa is tender and the beans are heated through, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the scallions and cilantro.
Serve warm.

1873e358d7.gt:
Slice hard stem off the mushrooms and shred accordingly.
Rinse the ginger and mince or julienne.
Add the prepared ingredients (Step 1) into a small pan.
Also add water, and cover the pan to cook over medium heat.
After the mushrooms are slightly soft, add soy milk and curry powder.
Bring it to a boil.
*But don't boil it too much after adding soy milk!
Turn the heat down to low.
Dissolve the miso thoroughly to finish.
Sprinkle in some parley and cinnamon if you'd like.
1873e358d7.pred:
In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Add the ginger and mushrooms.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the soy milk, curry powder, and miso.
Stir and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the parsley and cinnamon.
Stir and serve.

72392b90a9.gt:
Place steak in a 6" x 9" baking dish.
Combine marinade ingredients; pour over meat.
Cover with plastic; refrigerate 1/2 to 2 hours.
Combine salad ingredients in a bowl; chill until ready to serve.
Remove meat from marinade; pat dry.
Coat grill or broiler pan with cooking spray.
Heat grill on high.
Grill or broil steak 3 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
Transfer to a platter and let rest 10 minutes.
Remove onion from marinade.
Coat a nonstick skillet with cooking spray.
Cook onion over medium-high heat until tender, 5 minutes.
Move to a bowl.
Cut meat thinly.
For lettuce rolls: Layer rice, salad, soybean paste, onions and steak in the center of each lettuce leaf; roll up.
Serve 4 rolls per person.
72392b90a9.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the steak, onion, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, apple juice, lemon juice, sesame oil, sugar, scallions, chiles, rice vinegar, soybean paste, and 1 tablespoon of the oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir to combine.
Divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and form into 4 rolls, each about 1/2-inch thick.
Spray the rolls with cooking spray and place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes, or until the rolls are cooked through.
Remove from the oven and top with the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil and the lettuce.
Serve immediately.

01483cc0de.gt:
Place the water and asparagus in a saucepan, and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Cook covered 5 minutes.
Remove cover and cook 1 or 2 minutes, until tender.
Drain and set aside, but keep warm.
Melt the margarine in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the turkey cutlets 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or until browned and no longer pink on the inside.
Remove turkey from the pan and set aside.
Add the garlic and shrimp to the already heated skillet.
Cook over medium-high heat 1 or 2 minutes, stirring constantly until the shrimp is heated through.
Prepare hollandaise sauce according to package directions.
Place each turkey cutlet on a plate.
Top with the asparagus and shrimp.
Spoon hollandaise sauce over all.
01483cc0de.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Place asparagus in a large bowl; cover with water.
Cover and microwave on high for 5 minutes.
Drain asparagus; pat dry with paper towels.
Place asparagus in prepared baking dish.
Melt margarine in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Stir in garlic; cook 1 minute.
Stir in shrimp; cook 2 minutes or until shrimp are opaque.
Stir in asparagus; pour over turkey.
Sprinkle with hollandaise sauce.
Bake 30 minutes or until turkey is done.

fd96b8b1a7.gt:
Heat about 1-2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium low heat.
Add the mushrooms.
Cook them with the lid on for about 9 minutes or until golden brown, stirring occasionally.
Transfer to a food processor and pulse until finely ground.
In the same saucepan (add a little more oil if needed), over medium low heat, combine the minced mushrooms and onions.
Saute until onions are nice and soft and then add the ground turkey.
As it cooks, break up the turkey.
After a few minutes add all of the remaining ingredients (except the buns).
Continue to cook until the turkey is browned and no longer pink.
Spoon mixture onto buns and top with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired.
(Recipe adapted from Pass The Sushi, who in turn adapted it from Americas Test Kitchen.)
fd96b8b1a7.pred:
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the mushrooms, onion, and turkey and cook until the turkey is browned and the mushrooms are tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the ketchup, mustard, BBQ sauce, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve the sloppy tom mixture in hamburger buns.

1d1371bb0c.gt:
Use a large Korean pumpkin.
I used 1/2 this time, and it weighed about 500 g.
Wash the Korean pumpkin very well, cut into half and scoop out the seeds and pith cleanly with a spoon.
Slice about 5 mm thick without peeling.
Finely chop the garlic and green chili peppers.
If you touch the chili peppers with your bare hand, it will hurt as if you got burned, so I recommend wearing disposable gloves.
Put the sesame oil, garlic and green chili peppers in a frying pan and stir fry.
When the pan is very fragrant, add the sliced Korean pumpkin.
Stir fry well.
It will cook quite fast.
When the pumpkin slices are translucent, season with salt and pepper and Dashida.
Adjust the amount of Dashida to taste.
Done!
It's delicious when freshly made or chilled!
1d1371bb0c.pred:
Cut the pumpkin into 1-inch cubes.
Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the pumpkin and cook, stirring occasionally, until the pumpkin is tender and has begun to brown, about 10 minutes.
Add the garlic and chili peppers and cook for 1 minute.
Add the beef dashida and salt and pepper.
Cook for 1 minute, then remove from heat.
Serve hot.

5894d0c850.gt:
In a large bowl, combine 2 cups of flour, sugar, undissolved yeast and salt.
Heat milk, water and 5 tablespoons butter until very warm (120F-130F).
Stir into dry ingredients.
Mix in eggs and enough remaining flour to make soft dough.
Knead on floured surface until smooth, about 6 minutes.
Cover let rest 10 minutes.
Divide dough into 32 pieces; roll into balls.
Melt remaining butter.
Dip balls in butter.
Layer evenly on bottom of greased 10 inch tube pan with non-removable bottom; 1/3 cup maple syrup, 1/2 cup nuts,16 balls, 1/3 cup maple syrup, 1/2 nuts, 16 balls and 1/3 cup maple syrup.
Cover and let rise in warm place until it has doubled in size, about 30-40 minutes.
Bake in 375F preheated oven for 35 minutes or until done.
Cover with foil during the last 10 minutes of baking.
Invert on serving plate.
5894d0c850.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, yeast, salt and milk.
Stir until smooth.
Add water and butter and stir until combined.
Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
Stir down and add maple syrup and walnuts.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool slightly before cutting into squares.

57e41370a3.gt:
Combine flour, baking powder, nutmeg, and salt in one bowl.
In another bow, beat egg yolks slightly.
Beat in milk, bananas, and oil.
Add egg mixture to flour mixture all at once.
Stir just till combined but still slightly lumpy.
In small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold beaten egg whites into flour mixture, leaving a few puffs of egg white.
Do not overmix!
Pour batter onto pre-heated, lightly greased waffle maker.
Bake waffles according to manufacturer's directions.
Serve hot and fresh.
I topped mine with butter and syrup, and they were delicious!
57e41370a3.pred:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine the flours, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat egg yolks with milk and bananas.
In another bowl, beat egg whites until stiff.
Fold egg whites into egg yolk mixture.
Fold in flour mixture.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Pour batter into skillet and cook until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with butter and maple syrup.

f15f7c9832.gt:
Cut the chicken into thin diagonal slices, then into 1 cm strips.
Finely julienne the peppers.
Rub the shio-koji into the chicken.
Add the ingredients and rub to flavor the chicken.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Spread the chicken and cook over high heat until the edges turn white.
Flip over, and brown both sides.
Add the peppers and shio-konbu and stir fry quickly.
Swirl in the sake and it's done!
f15f7c9832.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
Add the green peppers and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the shio-kombu, sake, soy sauce, katakuriko, shio-koji, and sake.
Stir to combine.
Return the chicken to the skillet and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Serve with rice.

e03a36dd25.gt:
Place popcorn kernels in paper bag.
Fold the top of the bag 3 times.
Place in microwave.
Set time for 40 to 60 seconds.
(this will vary depending on your microwave, Mine takes 3 minutes total)
When popping has stopped pour popcorn in a bowl and finish popping any unpopped kernels for 15 to 20 seconds (depending on your microwave).
Add rest of popcorn to bowl, when done.
Salt popcorn to your taste and enjoy!
Note: Add melted butter and/or other seasonings over top of popcorn and stir well to distribute butter and seasonings.
e03a36dd25.pred:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees F.
Place the popcorn in a paper bag.
Sprinkle salt over the popcorn.
Close the bag and shake to distribute the salt.
Place the bag on a baking sheet and put it in the oven.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until the popcorn is golden brown.
Remove from the oven and open the bag.
Add butter, if desired, and sprinkle with seasoning.
Shake to distribute the butter and seasoning.
Serve immediately.

a884010613.gt:
Combine all ingredients except toast.
Cover toast slices with mushroom mixture & grill (broil) until melted & golden.
a884010613.pred:
Heat a grill pan over medium heat.
Add the mushrooms and salami to the pan and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from the heat and set aside.
In a small bowl, beat the eggs with a fork.
Add the cheese, mushrooms, salami, green capsicum, spring onions, oregano, and toasted bread to the eggs.
Mix well.
Pour the mixture into the pan with the mushrooms and salami.
Place the pan under the grill and cook for 10 minutes, or until the eggs are set.
Serve immediately.

a3eee86647.gt:
Mix everything together and pat into 2 loaves (apx 5"x8").
Freeze or bake at this point.
Mix the topping (brown sugar, ketchup and mustard) and spread on top right before baking.
Bake uncovered at 350 for 50 - 60 minutes (or Microwave for 15-20 minutes).
If from frozen - let thaw in refrigerator overnight, then add topping and bake.
(oops - it should be 6-8 servings per loaf - thanks I'mPat!
).
a3eee86647.pred:
Combine all ingredients except the ketchup and mustard.
Mix well.
Shape into a loaf and place in a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
Remove from oven and spread ketchup over the top.
Return to oven and bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and spread mustard over the top.
Return to oven and bake for 5 minutes.
Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes.
Cut into slices and serve.

03b718988e.gt:
Place bacon in a stock pot over medium-low heat; cook and stir until bacon begins to brown, about 5 minutes.
Stir onion and garlic into bacon; cook and stir until onion is tender, about 10 minutes.
Add green tomatoes, vegetable broth, celery salt, bay leaf, and black pepper to bacon-onion mixture; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until tomatoes are tender, about 40 minutes.
03b718988e.pred:
In a large saucepan, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp.
Remove bacon from pan and set aside.
Add onion and garlic to bacon drippings in pan and cook until onion is soft.
Add green tomatoes, broth, celery salt, bay leaf, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove bay leaf.
Add bacon and simmer for 5 minutes.

fba1dcbbd2.gt:
Sift dry ingredients.
Cut in 1/4 cup of butter.
Add the cream.
Roll out on a floured board.
Cut with a 2-inch cutter.
Bake on an ungreased pan in a hot oven of 400F (200C) for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve with butter, whipped cream, and jam if desired.
fba1dcbbd2.pred:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in cream of tartar.
Add cream or half and half and stir until dough forms a ball.
Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes.
Roll dough out to 1/2-inch thickness.
Cut into desired shapes using a biscuit cutter.
Place biscuits on a greased baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.

e2ffa57ffc.gt:
To make Dressing: Blend all ingredients in blender 1 minute.
Chill.
To make Salad: Cut tofu into 12 rectangular slices.
Lay 3 slices of tofu, overlapping slightly, on each of 4 plates.
Arrange cucumber slices around tofu, and fan avocado slices on plates.
Scatter sprouts, then green onions over vegetables.
Drizzle Dressing over Salad.
Sprinkle with furikake.
e2ffa57ffc.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients.
In a medium bowl, combine the next 4 ingredients.
In a large bowl, combine the tofu, cucumbers, avocado, and daikon radish sprouts.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

b47821bb2c.gt:
Chop a head of broccoli.
Rinse broccoli, set to dry out completely.
This step is very important, otherwise, the broccoli will come out soggy.
Mince Garlic.
Place garlic, olive oil, salt & pepper in a Ziploc bag.
shake it up until broccoli is well coated.
Spread out unto cookie sheet ( if grilling set on grilling sheet.)
cook for 30+ minute's until broccoli is crunchy.
preheat oven to 375
b47821bb2c.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the garlic, olive oil, and seasoning salt.
Mix well.
Pour the oil mixture over the broccoli in the Ziploc bag.
Seal the bag and shake to coat the broccoli with the oil mixture.
Place the bag in the refrigerator for 1 hour or more.
Preheat the broiler.
Remove the broccoli from the bag and place on a broiler pan.
Broil for 5 minutes or until the broccoli is tender.
Serve with a pepper grinder of your choice.

0a605c19e8.gt:
Add everything but the shrimp to a gallon-sized freezer bag.
Seal the bag and shake well to combine.
Taste test for spiciness; add sriracha for more heat, and tomato paste and olive oil for less heat.
When youre happy with it, add the shrimp and marinate in the fridge for 45 minutes.
Dump the entire bag, marinade included, into a pre-heated frying pan.
Fry the shrimp until theyre curled up and no longer translucent, a couple of minutes on each side.
You can also skewer and grill the shrimp.
Serve over rice, pasta, udon, in lettuce wraps with carrot and sprouts, as an appetizer ...
0a605c19e8.pred:
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the garlic and parsley and cook for 1 minute.
Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the lemon juice, Sriracha, tomato paste, oregano, salt and pepper.
Cook for 2 minutes.
Serve with rice or pasta.

1dcfb48390.gt:
Prep: Smash the tofu until it turns into a paste.
Add the tempura batter crumbs and let them soften.
Finely shred the cabbage.
Mix the ingredients together.
Mix the ingredients and cabbage with the tofu and mix very very well.
That's the batter.
Pan fry: Heat oil in a frying pan, cook the pork and pour in the batter.
When the pork is cooked, turn the pancake over to brown the other sides.
When done, transfer to a serving plate, top with the okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, ketchup etc.
to your liking and it's done.
Add some aonori seaweed powder and bonito flakes to taste, and enjoy.
1dcfb48390.pred:
Heat a frying pan over medium heat.
Add the pork and cook until browned.
Remove the pork from the pan and set aside.
Add the cabbage and tofu to the pan and cook until the cabbage is softened.
Add the tempura batter crumbs and stir to coat the cabbage and tofu.
Add the flour, katakuriko, water, dashi stock granules, mayonnaise, ketchup, okonomiyaki sauce, and bonito flakes.
Mix well and cook until the batter is thickened.
Add the pork back to the pan and cook until the pork is heated through.
Serve immediately.

fbc4ea771e.gt:
Make Cacik: In a mixing bowl, combine cucumbers and garlic.
Add salt to taste.
Mix in yogurt with wooden spoon.
Transfer to serving bowl.
Garnish with mint and drizzle olive oil on top.
Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate.
Prepare skewers by spraying a light coat of cooking oil to prevent sticking.
Place lamb and vegetables on skewers.
Grill spicy lamb kebabs for about 5-7 minutes on each side or until desired doneness.
Serve with hummus, baba ghannouj, or turkish cacik, a cucumber yogurt sauce for dipping.
fbc4ea771e.pred:
In a large bowl, combine lamb, green peppers, cherry tomatoes, onions, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, cumin, turmeric, red pepper, cucumbers, yogurt, garlic cloves, mint, salt and olive oil.
Mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Thread the lamb, green peppers, cherry tomatoes, onions and cucumbers onto skewers.
Grill for 10 to 15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the meat is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Serve with Turkish Cacik.

b61f1917f7.gt:
For the salad: First place lettuce in a bowl, then top with chicken, onion, nectarine, raspberries, celery and almonds.
Pour vinaigrette over top and serve!
For the dressing: Put all ingredients in a container that has a good sealing lid and shake the snot out of it.
b61f1917f7.pred:
Combine lettuce, chicken, onion, nectarine, raspberries, celery, almonds, oranges, olive oil, red wine vinegar, herbs, salt, garlic and honey in a large bowl.
Toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

5c462ab39b.gt:
Mix all ingredients well and refrigerate for a few hours to let the flavors blend!
Its that simple!
My mom got this recipe from a friend of hers more than 20 years ago.
Her friend got the recipe while staying at an Inn/B&B named The Magnolia in Napa Valley.
5c462ab39b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Pour into a 9x13 inch pan.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Serve warm.

1a8f7f2d8d.gt:
In a medium-large bowl, combine the rhubarb, strawberries, sugar and cornstarch.
Mix well.
The mixture should be thick and syrupy after being stirred well.
Roll out pie crust according to recipe or package instructions and place in a 9- or 9.5-inch pie plate.
Pour the strawberry/rhubarb mixture into the crust, using a large spoon to fill evenly.
For the topping: In a small bowl, combine the flour and brown sugar.
Cut the butter into pieces and using a pastry cutter or two knives, cut the butter into the flour/sugar mixture until it has the consistency of coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle the streusel topping evenly over the top of the pie.
Place the pie on a rimmed baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees for 50-55 minutes, covering the pie crust edges with foil halfway through in order to prevent over-browning.
Let the pie cool completely before cutting into pieces.
Serve with a dollop of freshly whipped cream, if desired.
1a8f7f2d8d.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Combine sugar, cornstarch, flour, brown sugar, and butter in a large bowl.
Stir until well blended.
Add rhubarb and strawberries.
Pour into a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Sprinkle with streusel topping.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Let cool completely before serving.

419586e535.gt:
BASE: Stir together oats, flour, brown sugar, soda, salt, and melted butter.
Pat into a 11x7x1 1/2 baking dish.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Cool.
SECOND LAYER: Mix sugar, butter and melted chocolate.
Add egg: beat well.
Stir together flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add to chocolate mixture alternately with milk and vanilla.
Stir in chopped nuts if using.
Spread over baked cooled base layer.
Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.
Cool.
FROSTING: Melt chocolate with butter over low heat, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in powdered sugar and vanilla.
Blend in hot water to make an almost pourable consistency.
Frost brownies.
Cut into 16 bars.
419586e535.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour 13x9-inch pan.
In large bowl, combine oats, flour, brown sugar, baking soda, and salt.
In medium bowl, beat butter and sugar until creamy.
Add egg and melted chocolate; beat until well blended.
Add flour mixture to butter mixture; beat until well blended.
Stir in nuts (if using).
Spread batter in prepared pan.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool completely in pan on wire rack.
For frosting, in medium bowl, beat butter and confectioners' sugar until smooth.
Add vanilla and hot water; beat until well blended.
Spread frosting over cooled brownies.
Sprinkle with additional nuts, if desired.
Cut into 12 squares.

c1c23779c6.gt:
Heat the cider, syrup, sugar and cinnamon sticks in a saucepan over medium heat.
Cook until the mixture is simmering, reduces by half and starts to thicken, about 15 minutes.
Remove from the heat, stir in the butter and let it cool completely.
Remove the cinnamon sticks, then pour over pancakes or use as desired.
c1c23779c6.pred:
Mix all ingredients in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the liquid is reduced to 1/2 cup, about 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

85a7242daa.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. If making cupcakes, line about 30 muffin tins with paper liners (for cake, grease and line with parchment paper three 9-inch round cake pans).
In a medium-sized bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
In the bowl of your electric mixer, beat eggs and sugar until thick and creamy (about 2 minutes).
Blend in vanilla, oil and sour cream.
Add flour mixture and milk, alternating adding a little of each at a time, starting and finishing with flour.
Pour into your muffin tins filling each about 2/3 full.
Bake cupcakes 18-19 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
For cakes, divide batter evenly among the three cake pans and bake for 25-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Frost with your frosting of choice.
I have made this with vanilla buttercream (classic combo), with lemon cream cheese frosting, with strawberry buttercream, with chocolate buttercream, with magical frosting, with Swiss meringue buttercreamthey are delicious no matter what you top them with!
Much thanks for this recipe to my neighbor and friend, Lauren McIntyre!
85a7242daa.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease and flour 2 (9-inch) round cake pans.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a medium bowl, beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add vanilla and oil and beat until well blended.
Add milk and sour cream and beat until smooth.
Add flour mixture to egg mixture and beat until well blended.
Divide batter evenly between prepared pans.
Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes.
Cool in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes.
Remove from pans and cool completely on wire racks.
Frost with your favorite frosting.

579917be2c.gt:
Light the grill or heat the broiler.
Coat the chicken with 1 tablespoon of the oil and season with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper.
Grill or broil until just done, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes and then cut crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.
In a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook the fusilli until just done, about 13 minutes.
Drain, rinse with cold water, and drain thoroughly.
In a large bowl, toss the pasta with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
Add the chicken, artichoke hearts, scallions, parsley, the remaining 5 tablespoons oil, the vinegar, the remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and the Parmesan to the pasta and toss well.
579917be2c.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, oil, salt, and pepper.
Toss to coat.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
Drain.
Add the artichoke hearts and scallions to the chicken mixture and toss to combine.
Add the pasta, vinegar, and cheese.
Toss to coat.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Serve cold.

72a1d68c4d.gt:
Slice the jalapenos longwise and carefully remove all the seeds and veins.set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix up the Cornbread batter according to the box instructions, add in the Corn and 1 cup of the Cheddar.
Fill each Jalapeno half with some batter!
Careful, dont over fill them!
Sprinkle them all with the remaining 1/2 cup of Cheddar.
Place them on a baking rack & sheet pan, bake them at 350 for about 15-20 minutes, or until the Cornbread is firm and cooked through.
They will be puffed and cheesy too!
Alternatively put the dough in mini muffin tin and then place a slice of jalapeno on top or sneak it in the middle and put more cheese on top.
This is a milder approach.
72a1d68c4d.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Mix cornbread batter as directed on box.
Drain jalapenos, reserving liquid.
Mix jalapenos with cheese, corn, and 1/2 cup of the reserved liquid.
Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the cornbread batter into each jalapeno.
Place in a baking dish and bake for 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake 5 minutes longer.

a5c8eb3798.gt:
Cook the pasta in large pot of the boiling salted water until al dente.
Using a mortar and pestle, mash the salt and garlics together into a paste.
Warm the yogurt slightly in sauce pan.
Remove a small amount of warm yogurt from the pan, and stir together with garlic paste.
Stir this mixture into the remaining yogurt.
Drain the pasta and rinsed in cold water.
Place in caserol or deep serving dish, tosh with 1 table spoon of butter or margarine.
Tosh with half of the garlic - yogurt sauce.
Spread the remaining sauce over the pasta.
Garnish with the parsley.
For a very special dish, brown the pine nuts in two table spoon of butter or margarine.
Pour over the parsley.
Serve immediately.
a5c8eb3798.pred:
In a large pot, bring 4 cups of water to a boil.
Add the pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes, or until al dente.
Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, combine the yogurt, butter, garlic, salt, and parsley.
Stir until smooth.
Toss the pasta with the yogurt sauce, and serve.
If you like, you can also add the pine nuts to the sauce.

1788cb51c4.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place squash, cut sides down, in a 9x13 baking dish.
Pour water into dish around squash halves.
Bake in the preheated oven until tender and easily pierced with a fork, about 1 1/2 hours.
Carefully remove the skin with a fork; it should be very easy to remove.
Top squash halves with butter and season with salt and pepper to taste.
1788cb51c4.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place squash halves cut side down on a baking sheet.
Bake for 30 minutes or until tender.
Remove from oven and set aside.
In a small bowl, combine 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon water.
Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Add water and stir until butter is melted and mixture is smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour butter mixture into squash halves.
Sprinkle with additional salt and pepper if desired.
Bake for 10 minutes or until butter mixture is bubbling.

63eaa4f8ef.gt:
In a 350 degree oven, toast the walnuts that have been tossed with the oil, salt and pepper.
Bake for about 5-6 minutes, being careful to not let them burn.
In a large saute pan or skillet over medium high heat, add the vinegar, garlic and oil.
As soon as they are hot, add the onions and cook for only 30 seconds or so.
Next add the cabbage and cook for just about 2 minutes, stirring continually, until color changes from bright purple to pink.
Season with salt, pepper and a dash more vinegar.
Remove the wilted cabbage to individual salad plates and top with the apples, walnuts, goat cheese, and herbs.
63eaa4f8ef.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the walnuts, oil, salt and pepper.
Stir to coat the nuts with the oil.
Add the shredded or sliced cabbage, apple, garlic, and balsamic vinegar.
Toss to combine.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, red onion, and parsley.
Stir to combine.
Pour the oil mixture over the cabbage mixture and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

3cb86cf2f4.gt:
Wash 5 potatoes.
Cut into square pieces.
Preheat oil in skillet on stove top.
I use my iron skillet
Chop up 1/4 white onion on cutting board along with potatoes.
Chop up two green peppers on board.
Dust garlic powder over potato, onion, pepper mix
Place potatoes, onion and peppers in skillet.
Dust with salt and pepper for additional flavor.
Cook until golden brown or potatoes are tender.
Serves about 5, can serve more just cut up more potatoes.
One potato per person want to feed.
3cb86cf2f4.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add potatoes and onion and cook until potatoes are tender and golden brown.
Add green peppers and garlic powder and cook until peppers are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

fc990de78b.gt:
Cut leeks diagonally into thirds and then diagonally in half to form 6 triangular pieces from each leek.
Rinse under cold water; drain.
Melt margarine in a heavy skillet; add leeks.
Cook until lightly browned, stirring gently, approx 15 minutes.
Stir in the broth cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until golden and the broth has mostly evaporated.
fc990de78b.pred:
In a large skillet, melt margarine or butter over medium heat.
Add leeks and cook, stirring, until wilted, about 5 minutes.
Add broth and salt.
Cover and simmer over low heat until leeks are tender, about 20 minutes.
Uncover and cook until liquid is reduced by half, about 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

e766664a53.gt:
Heat the oven to 450 degrees F with a rack in the middle position.
Take a small slice off of the bottom of each potato so that they will sit flat, and then a small slice (about 1/4) from each end.
Make slices crosswise down the potato at 1/4 intervals, leaving 1/4 at the bottom.
Make sure you do not cut all the way through.
Rinse the sliced potatoes under cold running water, making sure water gets between each slice to wash away excess starch.
Place the potatoes on a plate, bottom side up, and microwave for 5 minutes (do not cover).
Flip the potatoes over, then microwave for another 5 minutes.
While the potatoes are in the microwave, make the topping.
Pulse the bread in a food processor until you have coarsely ground crumbs.
In a medium bowl, use a fork to mix the crumbs with the melted butter, cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, paprika, garlic powder, oregano, minced garlic, salt, and pepper until it forms a chunky paste.
Set aside.
When the potatoes are finished in the microwave, place them on a rimmed baking sheet.
Drizzle slowly with olive oil, so that it can run into the slices.
Fan the slices slightly, then dash each one with paprika, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 30 minutes, until the potatoes are cooked through and the edges are just starting to brown.
Remove from the oven and turn the broiler on.
Press the topping onto the top of the cooked potatoes, pressing into any slices that you easily can, but being careful not to rip the potatoes.
Place under the broiler for a couple of minutes, until the topping is bubbly and starting to brown.
e766664a53.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut each potato into 4 wedges.
Place potato wedges in a large bowl.
Add olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, oregano, salt, pepper, and minced garlic.
Toss to coat.
Spread potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until potatoes are tender and lightly browned.
Remove from oven and set aside.
Meanwhile, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Add the cheeses and cook, stirring constantly, until melted and smooth.
Remove from heat and stir in the parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper.
Spoon cheese mixture over potatoes.
Sprinkle with paprika and garlic powder.
Bake for 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

96a66bd364.gt:
Whisk the milk and oil together.
(The key to making this good and not tasting like oil is using a little less oil and a little more milk.)
Add flour, salt, and sugar.
Press on bottom of pie plate.
With a fork, poke holes in bottom and sides of crust.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
So easy and so good.
See Amazing Blueberry Cream Cheese Pie for ideas on what to make this with.
96a66bd364.pred:
Mix all ingredients together until a dough forms.
Press into a 9 inch pie pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Cool completely.
Fill with your favorite pie filling.

79aa81e6ca.gt:
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat; whisk in flour, and cook until flour turns from white to a nutty brown color, 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir in onion and cook until transparent, about 5 minutes.
Add meats and brown until no longer pink, 10 to 12 minutes; stir in Cajun seasoning and garlic powder; drain fat.
Cool to room temperature.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of 1/4 inch.
Use a 5 inch diameter round cookie cutter or cut around a saucer to make a round of dough.
Place a heaping tablespoon of meat filling in the center of each round.
Fold dough over filling and seal edges closed by pressing with a fork or fingers.
Repeat to make 15 pies, re-rolling dough scraps as needed.
Heat oil for frying in deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Deep fry pies in small batches until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
Or bake pies on greased cookie sheets in preheated 350 degree F (175 degrees C) oven 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
79aa81e6ca.pred:
Preheat the oil to 375 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, Cajun seasoning, and garlic powder.
Add the meat and mix well.
Add the onion and mix again.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Remove the meat mixture from the refrigerator and form into 1-inch balls.
Dip the meat balls in the flour mixture, then roll in the pie dough.
Place the meat balls in the hot oil and fry until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

24c12168e6.gt:
Insert wooden craft sticks or lollipop sticks into the cores of the apples at the stem.
Place the roasted peanuts and candies on separate plates.
Set aside.
Place the chocolate into a metal or glass bowl and set over a pan of barely simmering water.
Stir frequently until melted.
Remove from the heat.
Dip apples into the melted chocolate, turning to coat completely.
Dip or roll in candy or nuts, then place on a sheet of waxed paper.
Repeat with remaining apples.
Allow apples to set at room temperature until the chocolate is firm, about 20 minutes, before serving.
24c12168e6.pred:
In a medium bowl, combine the apples, peanuts, and chocolate candies.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Melt the semisweet chocolate in a double boiler over low heat, stirring occasionally, until smooth.
Dip the apples into the chocolate, coating them completely.
Place the apples on a parchment-lined baking sheet and refrigerate until the chocolate is set, about 15 minutes.
Remove the apples from the refrigerator and sprinkle with the remaining candy-coated milk chocolate candies.

d44553522d.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook bacon in large skillet until crispy, about 5 min.
; drain.
Set bacon aside.
Add ground beef, onions and peppers to skillet; cook 5 min.
or until ground beef is browned, stirring constantly.
Stir in tomato sauce; cook 3 min.
or until heated through.
Remove from heat; stir in olives, raisins and reserved bacon.
Spoon mixture into 13x9-inch baking dish.
Combine prepared corn muffin batter and cheese in medium bowl.
Spoon evenly over meat mixture.
Bake 20 min.
or until corn muffin topping is completely baked and golden brown.
Cool slightly before serving.
Top each serving with sour cream.
d44553522d.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp.
Remove bacon from skillet and drain on paper towels.
Discard all but 2 tablespoons of bacon drippings.
Add ground beef to skillet and cook until no longer pink; drain.
Stir in onion, red pepper, tomato sauce, green olives, raisins, corn muffin mix, and 1 cup cheese.
Pour into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish.
Top with remaining cheese.
Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until heated through.
Sprinkle with remaining bacon.
Bake 5 minutes longer or until bacon is crisp.

c79e2e0b30.gt:
Stir together chopped eggplants, onions, 1/4 cup olive oil and salt to taste in a large roasting pan, then roast the mixture on the second-lowest oven rack at 425 degrees for about 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add in zucchini, bell peppers and 2 tablespoons oil and more salt; return to oven and roast for another 20-25 minutes or until the bell peppers are tender.
Meanwhile, while veggies are roasting in the oven (or you can prepare this hours in advance also) in a large saucepan, simmer the chopped tomatoes, garlic, thyme and remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and bit more salt to taste; simmer about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until thickened.
Remove the roasting pan and stir in the tomato mixture into the roasting pan.
Add in about 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese; stir to combine, and season with black pepper and more salt if needed; set the roasting pan aside.
Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling water seasoned with about 1 tablespoon salt; cook until JUST firm-tender; drain.
While the pasta is cooking, stir in fresh parsley and basil to the veggies in the roasting pan; mix to combine.
Add in the cooked drained pasta to about 1/3 of the veggie mixture; toss to combine.
Spread the remaining cooked pasta on a large serving dish and top with remaining ratatouille on top.
Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
c79e2e0b30.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
In a large ovenproof skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the eggplant, onions, zucchini, bell peppers, and garlic and cook until the vegetables are softened, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the tomatoes, thyme, and remaining 12 tablespoons of olive oil.
Bring to a simmer, then cover and bake in the preheated oven until the vegetables are very tender, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
Drain the pasta and return it to the pot.
Add the vegetable mixture and toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and serve.

9fd9690bf2.gt:
1.
Mix all ingredients together.
2.
Cook in a greased 9 springform pan at 400 degrees F for 3035 minutes, or until cooked in the center.
3.
Cool and cut into wedges.
9fd9690bf2.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Mix corn muffin mix, creamed corn, milk, eggs, and cheese in a large bowl.
Pour into greased muffin tins.
Bake for 20 minutes.

1b81060720.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Partially bake the pie crust for 5 minutes according to package (or your recipe) instructions.
Whisk together the sugar, flour, salt and cocoa powder in medium mixing bowl.
Blend in melted butter.
Add the eggs and vanilla and stir until well blended.
Pour into the pie crust and bake 45 minutes.
The filling will be soft in the center but not runny; do not overbake, as it will set up some as it cools.
If crust gets too brown, cover with a pie shield or aluminum foil.
Allow to cool to room temperature (this allows the fudge to set up.)
I think it is best served warmed.
I micowave a slice for about 20 seconds on high.
Top with your choice of ice cream, fudge sauce, whipped cream, nuts and cherries.
1b81060720.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and cocoa powder.
Add the butter and mix with a fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press the mixture into the bottom and up the sides of a 9 inch pie pan.
Bake for 10 minutes, then remove from the oven and set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs and vanilla extract until well combined.
Gradually add the sugar and beat until smooth.
Stir in the melted butter.
Pour the filling into the baked crust.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until the filling is set.
Cool completely before serving.

db5fd3bd93.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the bacon until almost cooked, but not too crisp.
Remove bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and place it in a large bowl.
Drain all but about 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease from the skillet and discard it or use it for another purpose.
Add the onion and green pepper into the skillet, if using.
Saute for a few minutes to soften.
Add them into the large bowl with the bacon.
Into the large bowl add the undrained pork and beans, the 2 cans of rinsed and drained beans and the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.
Cover the dish with a sheet of foil and bake at 325 F for 45 minutes.
Uncover and continue baking for 20-25 more minutes.
Cooks Notes: Sometime I will add a chipotle chile with a little of the adobo sauce that has been finely diced.
You know I cant get enough of those!
It is also delicious to turn them into cowboy beans (what Nanny called them) and add cooked ground beef or sausage.
db5fd3bd93.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, cook bacon until crisp.
Remove bacon and set aside.
Add onion, green pepper, and garlic to the skillet and cook until onion is tender.
Add pork and beans, barbecue sauce, ketchup, picante sauce, molasses, maple syrup, brown sugar, Liquid Smoke, mustard, cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder.
Cook until heated through.
Pour mixture into a 9x13 baking dish.
Top with bacon.
Bake for 1 hour.
Serve with cornbread.

0bb9567cbe.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Separate each biscuit into 3 pieces.
Place on baking sheet.
Combine the cheese, mayo, onion, bacon, sugar, garlic salt and hot pepper sauce in a medium bowl; mix well.
Place a spoonful of the mixture, spreading evenly, on each biscuit round.
Bake 10 minutes or until golden.
0bb9567cbe.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Mix together the biscuits, cheese, mayonnaise, onion, and sugar.
Spoon mixture into a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Top with bacon.
Bake 15 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown.
Sprinkle with garlic salt.
Bake 5 minutes longer.
Serve immediately.

ae95df029b.gt:
Cream butter, sugar and splenda in a mixer.
Beat in apple sauce + eggs one at a time; add vanilla extract.
Mix flour, baking soda and baking powder in a bowl, add 1/2 to mix; beat - add yoghurt - beat - add remaining flour mix.
Stir in rhubarb.
Add batter to medium muffin cups.
In small bowl - mix topping ingredients and sprinkle on top of muffins.
Bake at 350 F - for 25 min or until golden.
ae95df029b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, combine the butter, applesauce, sugar, Splenda, eggs, yogurt, flour, baking soda, baking powder, vanilla, and rhubarb.
Mix well.
Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the muffin cups.
Serve warm.

df67994fb9.gt:
Cream the butter and sugar.
Beat in the egg, vanilla and almond extracts.
Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt.
Mix until well blended.
Fold in the almonds and coconut.
Cover dough and refrigerate for at least one hour.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C), and grease cookie sheets.
Roll dough into 1/2 inch rolls and cut into 1 1/2 inch lengths.
Bake 18 to 20 minutes, or until golden.
Dip in confectioners' sugar and let cool.
df67994fb9.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a cookie sheet.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar.
Add the egg and vanilla; beat well.
Combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and almond extract; stir into the creamed mixture.
Stir in the almonds and coconut.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheet.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack.
Dip the warm cookies in the confectioners' sugar and almond mixture.
Place on the cookie sheet to cool.

8c32c6a022.gt:
Make the dough.
Put all the dough ingredients except for the olive oil into a plastic bag, and knead it well to make the dough.
When the dough comes together, add the olive oil and keep kneading (10 minutes).
Leave it to rise in the bag (30 minutes).
When the dough has risen, press it down lightly to deflate.
Place it on a kitchen parchment paper lined oven tray and leave to rest for 10 minutes.
Cut up the toppings for the pizza crust.
Slice the sausages diagonally.
Slice the onion and cherry tomatoes.
Defrost the seafood mix.
Put olive oil on your hands, and spread the dough out to cover the oven tray.
Preheat the oven to 300C (or 250C if your oven doesn't get that hot).
Spread the dough with pizza sauce, and cover evenly with toppings of your choice.
Add the pizza cheese to finish.
Bake at 300C for 13 minutes.
Top with something like fresh basil leaves and cut into 8 portions.
It's very hot so be careful.
I tried varying the toppings by section.
You won't get bored with the toppings this way, and looks like fun too.
8c32c6a022.pred:
Preheat oven to 200C.
Mix the cake flour, bread flour, sugar, salt and yeast together in a large bowl.
Add the lukewarm water and olive oil and mix to form a dough.
Knead the dough for 10 minutes until it is smooth and elastic.
Cover the dough with a clean tea towel and leave to rest for 1 hour.
Meanwhile, cook the sausages in a frying pan until browned.
Peel and finely chop the onion.
Defrost the mixed frozen seafood.
Cut the tomatoes into halves.
Slice the sausages and onion.
Cut the cheese into small cubes.
Prepare the pizza sauce.
After the dough has rested, divide it into 4 pieces.
Roll out each piece of dough into a circle.
Place a sausage slice in the center of each circle.
Top with onion, seafood, tomatoes and cheese.
Fold the dough over the filling and pinch the edges together to seal.
Place the pizzas on a baking tray and bake for 15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
Serve to guests.

8a42a2a009.gt:
On 1 slice of bread, spread a light layer of sweet and spicy mustard.
Meanwhile, preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Lay the pieces of oven-roasted turkey on the mustard side of the bread; then add the roasted red peppers and top with the smoked provolone.
Put the sandwich on a baking tray in the oven and cook for 3-4 minutes (until the cheese just starts to melt).
Remove from oven and put on a piece of red leaf lettuce and go!
8a42a2a009.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spread 1 tablespoon of sweet and spicy mustard on each slice of foccacia bread.
Place 5 slices of oven roasted turkey on each slice of foccacia.
Top with 3 pieces of roasted red peppers.
Place 4 slices of smoked provolone cheese on top of the red peppers.
Place a piece of red leaf lettuce on top of the cheese.
Bake in the oven for 10 minutes.

e621c384f2.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment.
Unfold pastry and cut into 4 equal squares.
2.
Spread 1 teaspoon mustard on each pastry square, leaving 1/4 inch border.
Layer 1 slice turkey, 1 slice Swiss, and 1 slice ham in the center of each square.
Whisk egg with 1 tablespoon water; brush onto edges of the square.
Fold squares to form triangles and crimp edges to seal.
Place on a baking sheet and brush with remaining egg mixture.
3.
Bake pastries for 25 minutes or until golden.
Dust with sugar and serve with preserves on the side.
e621c384f2.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spread 1/4 cup of the preserves on one side of each pastry sheet.
Cut each sheet into 4 squares.
Place 1 slice of ham, 1 slice of cheese, and 1 egg on each square.
Top with 1 slice of turkey and 1/4 teaspoon of honey mustard.
Roll up each square and place seam side down on a baking sheet.
Brush with egg and sprinkle with confectioners sugar.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

a004c9c6ff.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Butter 8x8x2-inch glass baking dish.
Cook sausage in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat until brown, breaking into small pieces with back of spoon, about 5 minutes.
Mix in flour, then milk.
Cook until mixture thickens and comes to boil, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
Layer potatoes in prepared dish.
Top with 1/3 of green onions, 1 cup cheese, 1/3 of green onions, sausage mixture, sprinkle the herbs on top, and the remaining 1/4 cup cheese.
Bake casserole until potatoes are tender, about 45 minutes.
Sprinkle with remaining green onions and serve.
a004c9c6ff.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until no longer pink.
Drain off fat.
Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture is bubbly.
Add milk and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Stir in hash browns, green onions, parsley, rosemary, and cheese.
Transfer mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, for 20 minutes.
Serve hot.

629fc487a6.gt:
Heat butter in saucepan over medium heat until foaming.
Add onion and garlic to butter.
Cook until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Add curry powder, stirring to coat the onions well.
Add corn, stir, and continue to cook.
In a small bowl, add the coconut milk slowly to the cornstarch, stirring to prevent lumps.
Add this mixture to the corn mixture, stirring well.
Add remaining ingredients.
Lower heat, and cook for about 7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
The coconut milk should be mostly absorbed.
Serve warm.
629fc487a6.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and saute until the onion is translucent.
Add the curry powder, stirring to coat the onion and garlic.
Add the corn, cornstarch, coconut milk, tomatoes, salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the corn is tender and the sauce has thickened, about 20 minutes.
Serve hot.

26c6578eb7.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 375 F. 2.
Combine egg, ricotta, spinach, pepper and salt in a mixing bowl.
3.
Spray a 9 by 13 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
4.
Lay the chicken breasts into the dish.
Top each breast evenly with the cheese mixture.
Roll up the chicken breasts so that the cheese mixture is inside of the roll.
Set the chicken rolls in the dish, seam side down.
5.
Pour the tomato sauce evenly over the top of the chicken breasts.
6.
Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella over the tops.
7.
Bake for 35-45 minutes at least, or until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbling!
Calories per serving: 205* Fat: 6g* Fiber: 1g* Carbs: 4g* Protein: 33g* Points+: 5* Old Points: 4*
26c6578eb7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the egg, ricotta cheese, spinach, pepper, and salt.
Stir in the chicken, tomato sauce, and 1/2 cup of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Spoon the mixture into the chicken breasts, dividing equally.
Place the chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese over the chicken.
Bake for 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted.

ccc0ef6d85.gt:
Melt butter in large skillet over medium-low heat.
Add leeks; saute until tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in parsley.
Cool.
Spread leek topping evenly over pizza shell; sprinkle tomatoes over.
Top with cheese.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon oil over.
Bake about 10 minutes at 450 F.
Remove from oven and brush crust with olive oil.
ccc0ef6d85.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together the butter, leeks, parsley, tomatoes, and cheese.
Spread the mixture evenly onto a pizza dough.
Bake for 10 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
Serve hot.

8c72bca7c7.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Heat olive oil in a large skillet; cook and stir zucchini, onion, and bell pepper in hot oil until tender, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in green chiles, eggs, salt, cumin, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper; set aside.
Mix sour cream and flour in a bowl.
Layer half the corn tortillas in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Spread half the zucchini mixture and half the sour cream mixture on top; sprinkle with half the Cheddar cheese.
Repeat the layers.
Bake in preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 30 minutes.
8c72bca7c7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add zucchini and onion; cook 5 minutes or until tender.
Add bell pepper and green chiles; cook 3 minutes.
Stir in eggs, salt, cumin, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper.
Cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat.
In a bowl, combine sour cream and flour.
Stir into zucchini mixture.
Spoon into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Top with cheese.
Bake 20 minutes or until heated through.
